Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: Coinbase implemented the support for XRP cryptocurrency and when I pulled up the deposit web form it showed only the wallet address, it did NOT show an XRP tag, so I completed the transfer and it said it would take 10min, after 20min I checked my wallet and it was not in there, so I opened up a support ticket, they said that the form should have had a wallet address and an XRP tag number which mine did not. I even sent them a screenshot of it showing no need for the XRP tag when I pulled up the deposit form on their site. They proceed to tell me they can not put the currency that I transfered to their wallet in my XRP wallet when this was NOT my fault in ANY WAY!!! This is a fault with their site and DEV team letting people submit transfers without their system being fully operational and in no way did it say any tag requirement when I made the transfer and I have proof of that. They need to fix this or I will be pushing the issue legally as this was NOT MY FAULT because their site was not fully functional since implementing their new XRP support wallet!

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am trying to transfer funds ( specifically, {$10000.00} ) from my Wells Fargo account to an account in another bank ( in this case, XXXX XXXX ). I can not do this as Wells Fargo only offers options of ( 1 ) using XXXX to send money or ( 2 ) wire money or ( 3 ) send a paper check by defining the recipient as a payee. 
Option 1 ( XXXX ) does not work as I have my email associated with another account ( XXXX ). 
Option 2 ( wire ) costs {$30.00} Option 3 is inconvenient and outdated. I don't want to get a check as TD does not have branches and I won't be able to deposit is. I also want to keep all transactions digital. 

By designing the system to only transfer money using XXXX, it does 2 things : 1 - limits the amount to {$2500.00} which is not sufficient for many purposes 2- making it practically impossible to transfer money to other individuals ( e.g., family members ) or self at other banks. 

My money is now practically trapped at Wells Fargo, and it must be very convenient for them as they are making interest on my deposit and also limit their fraud risk by basically making it impossible to take money out of account, instead of building an up-to-date fraud prevention system. 

I'd like to see big banks forced to bring back the old ACH transfer system. 

Thanks XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
A check i/a/o {$2200.00} has been debited to and cleared the payor 's account at Bank of America ( 8 weeks ago ) and still has not been credited to the payee 's ( my ) account also at Bank of America. All at various service departments at Bank of America agree that this was a bank check processing error ( see case # XXXX ). ( see also compliant # XXXX. ) However, no one at the bank seems to has the authority to correct this bank error. 

It is my understanding that a bank generally has ten business days to investigate an issue. The bank or credit union must correct an error within one business day after determining that an error has occurred. The bank then has three business days to report its findings to you.

If the bank or cant complete its investigation within ten business days, it must generally issue a temporary credit to your account for the amount of the disputed transaction, minus a maximum of {$50.00}, while it continues to investigate. 

The bank must then resolve the issue in 45 days. 

These time frames has long past and the credit has still not been made..

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
My identity was stolen including SSN, Drivers License, address. Starting XXXX XX/XX/2022. 
I immediately locked credit with the three credit agencies ( XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ). But after receiving notices from XXXX XXXX  that an account with was opened in my name was opened and had {$800.00} overdraft I found that FactorTrust is yet another credit reporting agency that was used to open ( or attempt to open ) fraudulent accounts in my name. I tried to lock my account with FactorTrust but the identification questions they asked were nonsense. Such as 'What city does XXXX XXXX live? ) My last name is XXXX, but I know of no XXXX XXXX. Other questions were just as impossible to answer. I called the customer service number and was informed that indeed, even though FactorTrust is affiliated with XXXX, that I must request a Freeze and Alert through FactorTrust even though I had already placed both with XXXX. I was also told they could not assist me with this on the phone. I would need to send a request through the mail. When dealing with fraudulent activity that is opening bank accounts and incurring large overdrafts, waiting a couple weeks for the mail to go both ways is unacceptable. 
If FactorTrust is affiliated with XXXX, then Freezing and adding Credit Alerts on XXXX should also Freeze and set Alerts on FactorTrust. Also FactorTrustr needs to review the computer algorithm that generates the security questions to make sue they are something that a typical consumer can answer. They should also be able to deal with the issue through the phone system. Mail is not an adequate channel. More immediate response is required when identity fraud is occurring. Someone is opening accounts and charging money. 
If FactorTrust is a valid credit reporting agency, then it needs to be included in the list of agencies that right now stands as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. These are the agencies that are suggested to lock down in case of credit fraud FactorTrust is not mentioned.

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX had contacted me, at which time I told him that I did not have the money in my account, he informed that by not settling this case I would be sued, I would have a lien on my home, on my bank account ... and I told him that unfortunately I would have to take that chance I had not realized that they money had already been deducted from my account ... he acted as though he had no idea. Low and behold that on XX/XX/XXXX I went to the ATM to make a small withdrawal, it was rejected stating there were insufficient funds, I then looked at my account on my phone and saw that on XX/XX/XXXX a payment of XXXX was withdrawn and sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I called XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and he told me that is what my agreement was, that I was told that the payment was due on the XXXX, and that I postdated the checking information for that day. I told him that I did no such thing, I told XXXX on the XXXX that I would not have the money for XX/XX/XXXX. XX/XX/2019 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , Co, XXXX Chase Executive Offices Mail CodeXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Ohio XXXX RE : Account Numbers XXXX ; XXXX Dear Sir or Madam : I am writing to dispute fraudulent charges on my account in the amount of {$13000.00} {$12000.00}. I am requesting that the charges be removed, that any finance and other charges related to the fraudulent amount be credited, as well, and that I receive an accurate statement. This request is made pursuant to the Fair Credit Billing Acts amendments to the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. 1666-1666b, 12 C.F.R. 226.13. See also 12 C.F.R. 226.12 ( b ). 
Enclosed are copies of my Identity Theft Report, my Colorado drivers license, and flight itinerary, showing that I was not in town or at my house to receive or sign for any packages, supporting my position. Please investigate this matter and correct the billing error as soon as possible. 
In the letter you sent me for denying these fraudulent claims you state I received benefit from these transaction this is in correct. I did not receive benefits from these transactions because I did not receive any merchandise or any type of benefit. 
I have also talked to XXXX EXT. XXXX and XXXX EXT. XXXX and told them I did not make these purchase. They confirmed that the dates, that packages were delivered I was not at my house, I was in another State. They do not want to listen to anything I have to say. They told me that I have to write a letter to Chase Executive office. 
Also please send me all the information you have received for the retailers. Once I receive this information, hope fully including what was purchased and the tracking information. I will review this information. I am sure if you review the tracing information, my signature will not be the signature that signed for these packages.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I went to pay my house payment last month and found that Mr Cooper/ Nationstar raised my house payment over {$600.00} per month. Loan # XXXX I immediately call Mr cooper to find out what was going on. I was told that my taxes went up and there was not enough money in the escrow account to pay the taxes. 
I knew this was not true as I just filed my taxes and my taxes had only gone up by around {$160.00} per year total. 
I told them that and they argued with me and declined to get me to someone that I could talk to about this. 
After looking into this more, what I found is that when Mr cooper put my loan together they did not include one of the tax lots that my property is on. 
I know that they knew about the extra tax lot because they were trying to get a better loan to value on the property by using the lot in the appraisal but couldn't. 
They also had several years of my tax records before they would process the loan. 
Here is what I know happened. I only was getting the load to pay off some credit card dept that I occurred to remodel the property. I told the loan  officer XXXX XXXX that I did not want my payments to be higher than what I was paying at the time. 
She assured me that they would only be a few dollars more than what I was paying at the time. 
Also after they told me the loan was approved and there would be enough money to pay off what I wanted to they came back to me and said that they had to raise the interest rate so that the loan would qualify. 
That did not set well with me but I did it because the rate although higher than I had been quoted by other companies was not much higher and I did not want to go through the whole process again with another company. 
Bottom line is that I just can not afford to pay an extra {$600.00} plus a month on my house payment. This because Mr Cooper did not do there job when putting the loan together. 
I hope that you can help.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2022, my brother provided my name and number to a guy that was selling a top for my XXXX XXXX on XXXX. He found the guy in a private XXXX group for XXXX owners. The guy eventually called me to arrange for the sale. Because I assumed my brother had already vetted the guy, I was more comfortable making the transaction, but was still a little hesitant. I should have trusted my gut feeling. I proposed completing the transaction via XXXX because they are more secure, but the alleged seller suggested XXXX or XXXX. Since my bank, Chase Bank, offered XXXX and promoted it as an option for sending money, I assumed my bank provided the same protections as they did for fraudulent transactions from my checking, savings, debit card and credit card accounts. Because I was still a little hesitant, I offered to send half the money upfront and the other half once I received verifiable proof the top was shipped. The alleged seller agreed. Shortly after sending the alleged seller {$420.00} and confirming it was sent, I went back to the sellers listings and inquired about some other parts. This communication was via XXXX messenger as I originally communicated with the alleged seller by phone since my brother gave him my number. It was during the messenger exchange that it was discovered the top did not belong to the alleged seller and was not shipped as promised. I immediately contacted my bank to stop or recover the XXXX transaction. While on the on the phone with my bank, the seller texted me a tracking number and requested the final payment of {$420.00}. He began to call and text a few times while on the phone with my bank, but I ignored the attempts. After filing my fraud complaint and completing the call with my bank, I texted the scammer back and requested an invoice. He deflected and said there was no need to send an invoice because it was already shipped, and again requested the remaining {$420.00} of the {$850.00} sale price be sent to complete the sale. I then informed him that I knew he was a scammer, which he obviously denied. During that exchange he agreed to send me back the {$420.00}, but I knew that was never going to happen. This all happened within a 20 to 30 minute timeframe. While filing my claim with my bank I asked several questions, which revealed that even though I was a victim of fraud/scam, I would be provided no protections because I authorized the transaction. That is puzzling because I was still a victim of fraud despite the bank 's interpretation and what constituted their protections for me as a customer. I assumed that if my bank promoted services with XXXX, that I would be afforded protections against fraud. It was clear during the process of me filing the fraud complaint that me getting my {$420.00} back was more than likely not going to be the outcome. I am a victim of fraud and I feel like the bank should refund my money since the XXXX service they provided offers no options for getting the money back from the scammers no matter how soon you report the fraud. The bank should not offer the service if there are no remedies for fraud and offer no protections. I should be refunded {$420.00} and the bank should stop offering XXXX services if they can not provide protections to its customers or sufficient remedies for recovery. I have to wait 10 days while they investigate my fraud claim that they have already disclosed the likelihood of recovering my money is very, very low. XXXX also offered no resolution and kept me on hold for XXXX hours before I eventually hung up. XXXX made no attempt to collect any information from my fraud claim and said I should contact my bank, which I did before contacting them. 

The information the scammer used is below : Name used :. XXXX XXXX Email address used : XXXX Phone number used :. ( XXXX ) XXXX Also note : the email was verified by XXXX on the Chase website. One would assume that verification by Chase and XXXX meant the address was good and free from fraud, but that is the false security Chase and XXXX provides its customers. They make it very easy for scammers to operate and victimize its clients. I am more wise because of this very expensive lesson and hope my experience helps others avoid becoming a victim of fraud as I did.

I asked if this was the case to close my application and remove the inquiry from my credit report at which time they stated that wasn't possible.

I was also told that my loan would be taken out of default & any tax offset would be removed from my account. Since then I had been making payments. XX/XX/XXXX I filed my taxes with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX & was updated that I should receive my refund in my account on XX/XX/XXXX. That didn't happen. I checked IRS.gov website & my status showed that my refund was taken & put towards my student loan as a tax offset. On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted National Recoveries to see exactly what was going on, & I was informed by XXXX that they did not tell the U.S. Department of Education that I had entered into the loan rehabilitation program & was making voluntary payments & to take my loan out of default status & off tax offset. I asked if I could request a hearing & they said they didn't handle that. They also said they mailed me a letter informing me that they didn't have all the required information to enroll me into the loan rehabilitation program. I responded by telling them but yet and still y'all was taking my money since XX/XX/XXXX. The letter they mailed was dated XX/XX/XXXX to my old address. I had no idea my loan was still on tax offset until I went to IRS.gov. The letter I received from the U.S. Department of Treasury was dated XX/XX/XXXX, after I should've received my refund.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is in regards to my mother, who is a former Capital One credit card holder. She has give me power of attorney so I am authorized me to act on her behalf. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, she called Capital One to pay off her balance and close her account. She was told she had to pay a {$21.00} fee to close the account, and she did so, paying a total of {$1100.00} over the phone. 

She received a transaction statement for the period from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, acknowledging that payment and saying that Capital One owed her {$1.00}. Then another statement, for the period from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, claimed she owed {$30.00}. The following day, XX/XX/XXXX, I wrote to Capital One, explaining the situation and asking them to close her account and stop billing her. 

A few weeks later, she received another bill. Finally, in mid XXXX, I called Capital One and was told that the first time my mother called, the customer service rep made a mistake and my mother had not been given the amount of interest owed. That interest was continued to grow each month. The customer service rep said that she would erase the interest from the account, and my mother would owe nothing. Last week she received another bill for {$88.00}. 

I called again on today, XX/XX/XXXX. The rep on the phone had all of the information -- knew the entire history about the agreement to waive the interest fees -- and said that the previous rep had not completed the update properly. She assured me that it would now be taken care of and that a XXXX   balance would be reflected on the printed statement my mother receives within one or two billing cycles. Thats the part that makes me nervous because that is what I heard last month. She also said that the waiver of interest would not apply to future purchases or cash advances. However, the account was closed in XXXX, so there will no longer be any more transactionsonce they remove the {$88.00} interest payment from the account. My concern is that Capital One will keep charging interest on the interest it had charged before, in the hopes that my senior citizen mother will just give up and pay it.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Consumer complaint narrative:
I leased a car from XXXX XXXX in XXXX and was financed through GM Financial for 3 years. I received a letter from GM saying I could end my lease early at the beginning of XXXX. I then purchased my car on XX/XX/XXXX. I wanted to stay with the same people who handled the lease for me, but they had moved to XXXX XXXX in XXXX. I asked them to handle the purchase for me and they put the loan through XXXX XXXX XXXX. I received a letter from GM Financial saying my lease loan is paid in full. The letter is dated XX/XX/XXXX. I received a balance sheet showing the check was applied on XX/XX/XXXX and I owe {$0.00}. I have a car Title in my new lenders name and I have a letter from XXXX thanking me for purchasing my car. GM Financial is putting on my credit report I owe {$2500.00}. I have spoken with XXXX XXXX who put the purchase through, XXXX XXXX, the GM of the Dealership, several people at GM Financial and an assistant to the VP of GM Financial, XXXX XXXX and she told me she would take care of it. As of XX/XX/XXXX I am still getting hits on my credit report and this has been going on since XX/XX/XXXX. I don't understand the way I have been treated. I am the customer and GM Financial acknowledges they made a mistake. Instead of taking care of this for me like I was told they would, I have been talked to horribly. I have been talked down to, my credit has been damaged, it has dropped over a 100 points and I have been lied to over and over again and for no reason. I never thought a company like GM Financial would treat a customer like this. They acknowledge the mistake, but so far have not fixed it. This has been going on since the first week of XXXX and I feel I have been more than patient. I would like this problem to be resolved, because it is damaging my reputation. XXXX XXXX told me it could take the credit companies a month or so to report the correction on their end, but GM Financial has not even stopped reporting the false accusations that I owe them money, because I received another credit alert on XX/XX/XXXX saying GM Financial put it on my report that I owe {$2500.00}. I was told from the GM at XXXX that I would be receiving a letter from XXXX XXXX saying it was taken care of. I haven't. The last time I spoke with her she said she may have forgotten to sign off on it, but she would. So far, she hasn't or GM wouldn't keep posting it to the Credit Bureaus. Please help me to get this error corrected. It is damaging my life. I don't understand this, I am the customer and all I did was purchase my car. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
Commerce Bank in XXXX, Missouri : XXXX stopped in to change personal checking to a " relationship '' checking. While making this change XXXX XXXX, personal banker II suggested changing our debit card to a Platinum debit card because it had more perks and " looked cooler ''. I told her we did not want the card if our debit card # would change as we have many accounts and businesses tied to that debit card. She said she didn't think it would change and I reminded her several times during the conversation that we did not want the card if the card # would change. She attempted to print the new Platinum card while we were there and was not successful for whatever reason. I again reminded her of the card # change. She said she would reach out to someone and ask if the card # would remain the same if we upgraded to the Platinum card. She said she would call the next day to let us know the answer. I would think a Personal Banker level II would have known this. We then left pending her answer. 
Bank was closed the following Monday. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX called to let us know that our current debit card had been cancelled and a new Platinum card issued!!! This was done WITHOUT our consent! XXXX stated that the girl she contacted took it upon herself to cancel our current debit card and issue the new one. I told XXXX that this can not happen and to reverse this transaction immediately and reminded her once again of all the accounts and businesses we have tied to our current debit card. She said she would talk to someone else and see what could be done. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  I called and left a message for XXXX XXXX asking if she had an answer about the unauthorized cancellation of our debit card. 

XXXX XXXX pm XXXX XXXX called to tell us there was nothing she could do to fix this. I asked to talk to the branch manager XXXX XXXX. XXXX was not available so XXXX said she would have her call me. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX called and we discussed the issue of an unauthorized cancellation of our debit card. I explained the impact this would have on my husband and I. We are XXXX XXXX XXXX that live far out in the country without internet access and little cell phone service. I explained to XXXX all of the accounts and businesses that we have tied to the now cancelled debit card and asked her how in the world are we supposed to transfer all of the accounts and businesses to the new card without internet/phone service to do so. XXXX said she would reach out to the Supervisor of the girl that cancelled our debit card. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Called and left a message for XXXX. 

XXXX after no return call from XXXX, my husband and I drove to the bank to speak with XXXX. We were told she was in a meeting. We speak with XXXX XXXX and she said she would call by the end of the day. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX called to tell us there was nothing that could be done to reverse this. She transferred me to XXXX then XXXX went into XXXX 's office so all 3 of us could talk. XXXX told me she contacted the debit card department and was told that once a new card is issued, the old card is marked as inactive but we can still use it for 30 days but after that we HAD to use the new one! I can't even wrap my head around this. I would think this is an illegal activity, I told her I would like the name of the Supervisor that is over the girl that cancelled our card. I also asked for more information so I could file this complaint, dates/times of communications to internal departments. 

XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  As of today I have not heard back from XXXX XXXX, branch manager of the XXXX Commerce Bank, or XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

We NEVER authorized the cancellation of our current debit card in order to be changed to a Platinum debit card. 

Our current debit card goes completely inactive on the XXXX of XXXX per XXXX. We did receive the new Platinum card but have not activated it, as per XXXX, our current card will immediately be deactivated once we do that.

Santander Bank has caused my husband ( XXXX XXXX ) and I ( XXXX XXXX ) harm by reporting information on our credit reports for late payments on XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX due to an error caused by Santander Bank. 

Here is what XXXX team issues that have harmed my family credit history : -Inaccurately calculated our mortgage escrow analysis using the 3 year amount on my hazard insurance versus the annual amount causing a shortage to our mortgage escrow account. Our monthly mortgage payment went from {$3100.00} monthly to {$4400.00} XXXX never updated my new address or phone information when a request to change address was sent on my XX/XX/XXXX statement. 

-Due to this inaccurate contact information I was not aware my mortgage payment had changed due to escrow payment increases. As my bank recurring payment was set to a {$3900.00} ( included monthly mortgage of {$3100.00} and additional payment toward principle of XXXX ), XXXX reported my husband XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX as XXXX on 4 months dropping our credit score from XXXX to XXXX. 

-We were paying {$760.00} monthly extra principle however due to escrow errors none of this was applied to my principal which cause more interest to compound. 

-After my letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX issued a refund check of roughly {$13000.00} of overage on my XXXX account which is proof of their inaccurate escrow analysis. 

XXXX Bank has cause harm to my family due to unfair and deceptive practices. We will be disputing these with credit bureaus however it is likely our credit history has been harmed for the next 7 years. 

Please hold them accountable for harming customers as these escrow analysis errors should have been caught. Additionally servicing practices of not updating customer information causing irreparable damage.

Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative: on XX/XX/19 I went to a XXXX  dental office for a free consult. and by the end of the appt the dental office had some how in a very slick and quick manner conviced me that I needed all kinds of work done and when I said ok they opened a line of credit via wells fargo in the amount of {$8500.00}. and charged my " NEW ACCT '' a total of {$8500.00} for services I had not even received yet. not realizing the office had already charged the acct I made a 2 appt on XX/XX/2019 to start the work. after returning home from second appt I received my wells fargo credit card statement which included a new charge in the amount {$8500.00} with an interest rate of 12.99 % which is very high as my credit score is close to 900. I called wells fargo right away to question the how they can charge the high interest rate on A+++ credit and knowing that I have another credit card with them in great standing with a lower rate. I was told that they had no control of the rate and that the dental office has the control to lower it. How is that possible? The dental office had the card number before I even had a chance to get the card in the mail and read over the terms and see the rates. If the office would have let the paperwork and card to be sent to me before they charged it I would not have said no to doing the work. I never signed a credit app or was not aware or told the fees and rate just charged. when I asked the dental office why the whole amount of {$8500.00} was charged before any work was really done I was told that in order to have the teeth impreions made into mouth plates that they needed to be paid in full for them. so I was under the asumsion that the cost for making the mouth plates would be charged only. not the whole amount quoted for " Phase! '' work which by they way is the same amount of money no matter the patient or work to be done. I also never received an itemized invoice with item and amount for each in plain English so I can understand where the {$8500.00} was spent. I called the dental office and found out that they can or could change my interest rate would even give me 2 years with 0 % if paid in full at the end of 2 years. if not paid in full I would owe all the back interest rate and my rate would go back to the 12.99 %. how is it that the dental office can change or assign the rates and not the lending company? how is it that they can assign credit without looking at the credit score. they run a credit check to check credit but fail to get rates based apon the credit score. i have already closed the account in question and i am disputing the account and charges of {$8500.00}. And i stopped making contact with the dental office as well. and still don't have anything for the money that was charged. I feel that Wells fargo and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX are practicing unfair and predatory credit card lending and unfair business practices.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a notice from XXXX that a new collection appeared on my Credit Report from Genesis Credit Management. This is the third time it was sold to a different collection agency because the other two had no information to properly validate the debt, so they changed the dates and the account number and sold it to another unsuspecting debt collection agency. It's been to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and now Genesis Credit Management. 

Genesis did not send me the proper notification before it reported on my credit report. The day I was notified that it reported on my credit, I sent Genesis a request for validation and I disputed the account with all 3 credit bureaus. 

Genesis " verified '' the information with all 3 credit bureaus before responding to my request for validation. 

I received a response to my Validation Request on XX/XX/2019. They sent a letter claiming that I owe them a debt and attached was a one page, half computer generated, half handwritten report that did not include my name, birthday, address or any identifying information. It also did not include the name, address or contact information of the " original creditor '' - leading me to believe this company is blatantly committing fraud and willfully non compliant with laws that govern their compliance. 

They also did not prove that they own the debt, that the debt was valid. But, in their invoice, they added {$2000.00} in collection fees/interest - which is not legal unless they can furnish the original contract that states there will be interest and collection fees. 

This company is practicing Illegal Debt Collection Practices, hiding under the guise of different names & DBA 's to trick consumers and prosecutors. Please refer this to the FTC and  Attorney General to investigate.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened to sue you for very old debt
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, a message was left at my parents ' home phone number ( a XXXX area number ) that I had a debt that was attempting to be collected. My parents gave me the number ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), and I called them. The number is from XXXX, TX outside of XXXX. A woman named XXXX or XXXX XXXX ( first time I swear she said XXXX, second time I talked to her she said XXXX ) claimed she was with a third-party company attempting to collect a debt for Wells Fargo. She did not tell me in the first call the name of her company. She did not state that the call was being recorded. She had my personal information including my current address and social security number. She asked for me to verify my information, and I refused and asked why she was calling. She threatened that I would be sued if I did not immediately pay back my debt. She claimed that I owed approximately {$200.00} in overdraft fees to Wells Fargo for a bank account from XXXX ( I was a senior in high school that year, and I can not recall if I even had an account with them in the past ). The fees had grown, and my debt was now approximately {$900.00}. She said I had the option to set up a payment plan or pay a reduced negotiated amount of about {$450.00} over the phone that day. She stated that multiple attempts had been made to contact me via phone and by mail.They have not contacted me nor my parents at any time prior to XX/XX/XXXX. She stated that they had sent me in writing the details of the debt in the mail in unmarked envelopes. I told her I'd look into this, and she urged me to call her back in the next 30 minutes. I attempted to call her back twice before XXXX CST on the same day and only heard elevator music for a few minutes, then the call was disconnected. I did my research, and pulled my credit report from XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX and reviewed them carefully. There is absolutely nothing on my credit report from Wells Fargo, ever. I also learned that the statute on limitations for filing a lawsuit on debt is 4 years, and a debt from XXXX ( if it had been real ) is well past 4 years. I also learned that I should have the debt in writing and her company 's information before proceeding with any conversations with her. She called back on XX/XX/XXXX. I asked her the name of her company, and she said she was with XXXX XXXX. I tried to state the information I had found, and she kept talking over me and threatening me if I didn't pay. After I told her to stop talking so I could speak, she hung up on me. After a few minutes, I called the number she gave me back. A XXXX XXXX answered this time. I asked what the name of his company was and for his address. He said the company was XXXX XXXX, and gave me a PO Box address. I asked for a physical address, and he said he didn't have to give that to me. I asked what the nature of his company was, and he stated that they assisted in civil cases. He then very irritably asked me why I was calling. I then asked him if his company 's practice was to call and threaten to sue people. He stated it was not. I told him that someone from his company just did call and threaten me. He protested that he did not, and again asked why I was calling. I told him to have his company desist in calling me and we hung up. I can not find the company XXXX XXXX on the internet anywhere. I am of the very firm belief that this is a scam.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

XXXX XXXX instructed me that rates are going up and that if I completed all the discloses and approvals with the bank, I would a rate of 5.25 % at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX Completed all the e-forms in XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX instructed me that the file would be sent to underwriting.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I sent this collection agency a validation of account letter on XX/XX/19 trying to get information about the original creditors. I asked that they provide me with documentation showing the original creditors, account number, complete payment history. I also requested documentation showing that I agreed to pay the past due amount on this account, any agreements that were granted authorizing them to collect this alleged debt because Ive never had any written or verbal contract with this agency. The only information I was sent was original creditors address, account number, and balance. They didnt provide any clarification showing how this alleged debt was calculated or my responsibility for this account. I disputed the original creditors file on my credit report and when they couldnt provide me with the information asked for they were deleted from my credit report so they decided to give the alleged debt to this collection agency who like I said before Ive never had any sort of contract with to collect on something that they havent provided any accurate information about this alleged debt. This agency is continuously running this alleged debt every month on my credit report damaging my score which isnt fair because they have failed to provide me accurate information. Would someone please assist me in correcting this matter.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, rather than sending one monthly payment, I submitted bi-weekly half payments to United Wholesale Mortgage per the attached document. Couple weeks after the initial payment, I noticed that my online account did not show the payments posted. I contacted UWM to inquire about the account, and at that time I was informed that they don't accept partial payments. UWM refunded the third payment with a check that was cashed, but the first two checks were not received and sat in a suspense account without posting them to my mortgage. Starting XX/XX/XXXX I continued to contact UWM and requested them to transfer the funds in the suspense account to my mortgage to remove the late reporting, but their response was that they were researching the issue and it would take a couple of weeks to resolve. From XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX I continued to call on a weekly basis requesting updates on the resolution to no avail. I requested multiple call backs from supervisors, but they never called. It wasn't until XX/XX/XXXX that I was able to reach a supervisor that cared enough to apply the funds to my mortgage and clear the account. Attached you will find the list of payments they received and how they were posted, and you will also see that nothing is reported late. 
Their failure to apply the funds sooner triggered the late credit reporting, and they are unwilling to remove it. 
This has adversely impacted my credit score and the ability to open new accounts. I can't apply for new credit because I have been turned down.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT is reporting a collection account to all 3 of my credit bureaus that I am not responsible for. In addition, PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT has violated the HIPAA law, by having access to my medical information. According to the HIPAA law a collection agency is only to be provided the following : Name and address, Date of birth, Social Security number, Payment history, and Account number. 

I have no contract or business dealings with PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT. I have never received any correspondence from PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT stating that they owned this debt nor their intent to pursue collection & report erroneously to my credit bureaus. I have tried disputing and getting this issue resolved with PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT for some time. I have requested documentation to include a signed agreement & proof that PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT owns the debt ( along with copies of anyone else who has owned this erroneous debt ). PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT also seem to re-age and change the dates of this erroneous debt to continue to seem to make this a valid debt. 

PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT is in willful non-compliance with the HIPPA & FCRA. Most recently when I tried disputing this debt I expressed the great financial and credit burden on my family. PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT even ignored those facts and continued to ensue the damaging affect on my family. I will continue to document my efforts to get this issue resolved. If this is not resolved I intend to pursue litigation & seek monetary damages. I am confident I will prevail and will not be interested in settling after legal expenses are paid. I believe it will be in PREFERRED COLLECTION & MANAGEMENT 's and my best interest to resolve this issue prior to litigation to avoid unnecessary out of pocket expenses.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX, then Marketing Director of XXXX XXXX, advised me that he could have my book, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, just published by XXXX, republished outside of the US and distributed to foreign countries, He told me not to tell XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX guided me through the process of using my XXXX credit card ending in XXXX ( now defunct ) to set up a PayPal transfer to XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$5000.00} to cover the cost of printing 1,000 books outside of the US. Then on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX directed me to make 2 payments via PayPal to XXXX for the printing of an additional 1000 books, in the amounts of {$5000.00}. and {$1200.00}. The next day, he instructed me to pay {$300.00} to cover the cost of shipping those books via PayPal to XXXX. I have no evidence whether those books were printed or distributed. Efforts to gain information from XXXX   XXXX XXXX led no where. If they were not published or distributed, I want PayPal to return the {$11000.00}. 

A few weeks later, XXXX XXXX told XXXX and me that he thought he could arrange for me to make a personal appearance on the XXXX XXXX show on XXXX. We greeted that news enthusiastically. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX told me that the cost for that appearance would be {$30000.00}. to be paid in three {$10000.00}. installments. I assumed that XXXX was aware of this but I didn't consult with them about it. XXXX instructed me to set up a second PayPal account, using the same XXXX Credit card and then he guided me through the process of arranging for the Transfer of {$10000.00} from that Credit Card through PayPal to XXXX. 

A third scheme was proposed by XXXX XXXX. He wanted to place a full page ad in the XXXX XXXX XXXX for the book, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. When I said the full page ad exceeded the money I had available, he proposed a half page ad for {$10000.00}. When I agreed on XX/XX/XXXX, he walked me through the process of charging {$10000.00}. to my XXXX Credit Card to pay XXXX through PayPal. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX said he had secured two possible dates for the XXXX XXXX XXXX and that another payment of {$10000.00} was necessary to secure them. Again, he walked me through the process of charging {$10000.00}. from my XXXX Credit card account to XXXX via PayPal. 

on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX requested another {$1500.00} and assisted me in the transfer via PayPal to XXXX. 

Finally, in XX/XX/XXXX, when XXXX XXXX sought to extract more money from me, I contacted XXXX and charged him with extortion, fraud and misrepresentation. I spoke with XXXX XXXX and her manager, XXXX XXXX. They told me to fill fraud charges with XXXX and to contact PayPal. XXXX initially accepted the XXXX charges and then rescinded their decision since I was a party to the payments. They were uninterested in the fact that I was defrauded and misled. 

I filed a complaint with PayPal but they only had the last several charges listed and nothing happened.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Need information about your loan balance or loan terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted Navient by phone ( an ordeal in itself to get a human being ) about 3 weeks ago to inquire about my loan interest when I became aware that I was not enrolled on Autopay, which offers a lower interest rate. I recall I had enrolled in autopay years ago and never stopped it. I kept being told that I had made a phone call to terminate autopay ; the first individual told me my interest rate prior to XX/XX/2015 was $ 6.625 % and {$6.00} after I terminated autopay on XX/XX/2015 by phone call to them. I asked to speak to a supervisor, who told me that I had " never had autopay '' that it had been denied because one of my loans was too old to qualify therefore that old ( and smallest of of loans ) disqualified me for the lower rate. She said if I wanted more information, to email them. I did email Navient requesting documents showing my interest rate prior to XX/XX/2015 and after or any changes in interest rate on their records, and proof that I had disenrolled in autopay ( I never, ever called them to stop it. ) I never received information that I had been turned down for autopay because one loan did not qualify due being " too old. '' I could not find information on their website about what qualifies you for a lower interest rate through autopay. The response to my inquiry was exactly the same they told me on the phone, without any documentation showing my interest rate before and after XX/XX/2015 or proof of my phone call, which is a total lie. 
This is their impersonal ( no individual name preparing it ) response to my written inquiry : Our records indicate that you applied online for the Auto Pay program on XX/XX/2015. Your request was approved on XX/XX/2015. You requested to terminate this program by phone on XX/XX/2015. 

I really appreciate your help on this matter. Either Navient engages in fraudulent practices or their customer services staff is outright unqualified. The result for their customers is the same- tremendous frustration and financial loss.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2022 Legal Document notarized and sworn XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX Legal Document is Receipt and Release file # XXXX At Surrogates Court of the state of New York Authorized and accounted XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Attorney XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2022 Estate of XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX legatee XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX funds received in the amount of {$250000.00} on personal check, deposited into XXXX, from Executor/Administrator XXXX XXXX  XXXX in the Estate of XXXX XXXX XXXX as noted above ) Transaction ID XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Originally {$5300.00} released on XX/XX/2022, rest {$250000.00} released on XX/XX/2022 however as of XX/XX/2022, entire hold placed on {$250000.00} until XX/XX/2022 by XXXX EST XX/XX/2022 by XXXX EST Funds became fully available in the account. I moved money between Bank of America accounts ( XXXX ), started to satisfy debts in my name, invest, and book a medical procedure with a {$5000.00} deposit. Fraud department was spoken with at least 6 times in 6 hours, all wanting to verify transactions. I verified all transactions were mine. The last call to XXXX in Texas in the fraud department resulted in a 2 hour hold, which is when restrictions started being placed on the accounts. I then went on to discuss the matter with Client Protection Service. They said the accounts would be closed pending further review due to an altered check. 

XX/XX/2022 This is the day I was told by XXXX the accounts would be closed, and if there were any remaining funds ( there is ) they would be mailed out via cashiers check to the address on file. There were still ACH transactions attempting to process in the account, so the closure was pushed until XX/XX/2022 XX/XX/2022 I called XXXX to follow up and inquire about XXXX tracking numbers they claimed I would receive at that time. Instead, I was told all funds were sent to back office for further review due to a stolen check. No funds being released at this time. The check is not stolen, so that in itself is false, and I am most certainly not a thief but XXXX in Client Protection Services seems to think so since she claims that I have stolen this check. No one else has said anything about the check but her. Everyone else was unwilling to disclose, which I understand is not something the bank is obliged ( disclose ) to do. 

At this time, I am believed to have been committed a crime, whereas here in the United States of America you are innocent until proven guilty in a court of law. I have all necessary legal documentation that backs the authorization and disbursement of this check ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). It is registered in XXXX XXXX in the state of New York. 

The clearing house had more than enough time to verify the authenticity of this check. Thats not the case. 
If the check was indeed reported stolen, this process that Bank of America is putting me through would not be going the way it is. I would have law enforcement officers knocking on my door. The bank would have closed the account immediately and ceased communications with me. Theft is not the case. 
The check is not reported stolen. There are 5 other members in this estate who have all received their funds and started spending them already. Granted, none of the other legatees in this estate are clients of Bank of America. Only me. 

There is something that someone in one of these departments is not telling me or being upfront about, and while the banks policy states you are under no obligation to disclose the immediate reason, there is clearly an error on someones behalf, and it is not mine nor the checkwriters. 

XX/XX/2022 I called XXXX again, just like I do almost every business day. The first person I spoke to had me on hold for a few minutes and came back to tell me she can see two checks being mailed out and they should get there by XX/XX/XXXX. However, while she was saying this, it was almost like someone was listening in and switched lines on us so we could not continue the call. I called back, twice. Both times, they told me there is no further information available. I asked them what about this XX/XX/XXXX date I was just informed about? They state there are no dates and whenever it happens, it happens. Unacceptable.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

TITLE STATUS IS UNDER LIEN XXXX spoke to Kia Finance representative. they confirmed account paid in full and closed. title department will release lien on E-title, send me notarized confirmation the title has been released. Title department only works Tuesdays and Thursdays.

It must be original copy on corporate letterhead and signed to be considered for releasing lien. I brought that requirement up with Kia Special Agents when discussing release letters from that point forward. 
XX/XX/XXXX representative is transferring call to Special Agent Escalation Team based on our multiple calls on the same issue. Title Department experienced non-specific errors in clearing the lien. GA DMV would need to be contacted. Kia 's last recorded entry on the claim file was XX/XX/XXXX.

She will try to have a Lien Release Letter sent to address of record. She will ask title department to follow up with Georgia XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Special Agent stated the release request was rejected. Agent would send an email to Title Department to release title electronically then have release documents sent to home address. Indicating this has not worked in the past, the call was transferred to a supervisor. Supervisor explained no one in the Special Escalation Team has authority to directly contact the Title Department. 
XX/XX/XXXX They had not yet heard back from Title Department from last week 's request. I asked if there was a corporate complaint contact. and was provided a mailing address in XXXX XXXX CA. 
XX/XX/XXXX Representative stated the request from the Special Agent Escalation Team was closed on XX/XX/XXXX. Special Agent Escalation Team expressed my claim has been escalated to the Care Department. I will be contacted within two business days. 
XX/XX/XXXX There has been no contact from the Care Department.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage payment is late, and its largely caused by the actions of Union Home Mortgage. In addition, my mortgage has no provision that permits them to demand future timely payments arriving as guaranteed funds or cashiers checks. Union Home Mortgage making this demand and refusing payments is outside the scope of our contract and is unlawful, unnecessarily burdensome, and causes additional expense, stress, and duress. The emotional turmoil on my end is off the charts. 

I tried to make payments in XX/XX/XXXX, via the online portal and by phone. I was unable because my online portal is blocked. I called on two occasions and could not get anyone on the phone and on one occasion was informed that your system was down. They have locked me out from making payments online, you refuse to take an EFT payment, they refuse to auto deduct my payment, and have refused to post a cashiers check payment sent to them. You have eliminated every option that I have to pay my mortgage. This is unlawful, unnecessarily burdensome, and causes additional expense, stress, and duress. 

I spoke to a member of their team on XX/XX/XXXX in the morning that told me that I could send a cashiers check for {$3900.00} ( 2 of the 3 past due payments ) which I did. I sent a cashiers check, # XXXX, USPS, overnight certified mail exactly as I was instructed.

What Ive been able to determine is that they would not accept this check either and that I needed to send other cashier 's check for {$8100.00} XXXXthe total past due ) today to bring my account current. No one at Union Home Mortgage is able to tell me when and if this guaranteed funds cashier 's check will be returned to me. The new demand from Union Home Mortgage requires a total out of pocket from me of {$12000.00} even though my entire past due balance is {$8100.00} which is unlawful, unnecessarily burdensome, and causes additional expense, stress, and duress. 

The terms of my current forbearance agreement require them to accept partial funds. There is no reason even outside the forbearance agreement for them to not accept two full monthly payments ( 2 of 3 that are past due and the 3rd past due is them not permitting me to make a payment ) in the form of a cashiers check drawn on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. You can not tell me when or even if the cashiers check will be returned to me so that I can use these funds for the lions share of what is past due, but you are unwilling to post the payment to my account. The only incentive for them to not accept this payment is additional fees and costs and is unlawful, unnecessarily burdensome, and causes additional expense on my end. 

I was informed today that my account will require cashiers checks moving forward into XXXX for you to accept my timely not past due payments. No provision in my mortgage gives you them the ability to make this demand with or without notice. I was told today that a letter was sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX that I did not receive. I have a 1-inch-thick package of documents received from Union Home Mortgage and it is not in this information. I need to see what notice could have been sent that would give them the authority to alter the original mortgage contract without my consent. I was told today that I could review this notice online, but I can not access any documentation having been locked out of my portal.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this complaint because my consumer rights have been violated by the involved company. I sent a billing error notice via certified mail # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX. Since that time the company had sent me an email dated on XX/XX/XXXX, stating, " We received feedback regarding your Apple Card account and are looking into it. 
Your dispute has been investigated. We received your request for debt validation on XX/XX/XXXX regarding validation of account history of your Apple card reported by Goldman Sachs Bank USA. We mailed the debt validation packet to you on XX/XX/XXXX. We have reviewed the information being disputed, as well as our records, and determined that your Apple Card account was reported correctly. If you have any questions regarding your account, please feel free to contact us at XXXX. 
If you have any further questions, please reach out to an Apple Card Specialist. 
I then wrote another letter further explaining this dispute on XX/XX/XXXX, which was delivered via certified mail # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX, explaining why the matter was not settled. 

On XXXX XXXX, the company reported that the disputed amount was 30 days past due, which is a direct violation of 13 ( d ) ( 2 ) Adverse Credit Reports Prohibited - ( 4 ) Permitted creditor actions.

A creditor is not prohibited from taking action to collect any undisputed portion of the item or bill ; from deducting any disputed amount and related finance or other charges from the consumer 's credit limit on the account ; or from reflecting a disputed amount and related finance or other charges on a periodic statement, provided that the creditor indicates on or with the periodic statement that payment of any disputed amount and related finance or other charges is not required pending the creditor 's compliance with this section. ( PLEASE SEE ATTACHED ) On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I received the attached " Validation Letter '' ( PLEASE SEE ATTACHED ) which was dated on XX/XX/XXXX, which had to be a typo, and stated that if I do not respond within 15 days the company will report the debt. I then sent another correspondence via certified mail # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, which had not been delivered but I notified the company to note my account that I had a response being mailed. ( PLEASE SEE ATTACHED ) All of my responses have been made in a timely manner to expediate the settling of the matter, however the company violated the procedures of resolving billing error notices and furthermore have caused damage with the furnishing of this adverse credit reporting. 

There was never a resolution, and this is evidenced by the correspondences all lacked and the following language from ( 13 ) g -Creditor 's Rights and Duties after Resolution : ( 1 ) Shall promptly notify the consumer in writing of the time when payment is due and the portion of the disputed amount and related finance or other charges that the consumer still owes.

The company has also violated Official interpretation of Paragraph 13 ( g ) ( 4 ) ( i ) Promptly reports that the amount or account is in dispute ; ( ii ) Mails or delivers to the consumer ( at the same time the report is made ) a written notice of the name and address of each person to whom the creditor makes a report; and ( iii ) Promptly reports any subsequent resolution of the reported delinquency to all persons to whom the creditor has made a report.

Boy, was I wrong, it ended up NOT working again and I had to find a payment location and they finally accepted my payment on XX/XX/2018, which made it 30 days late and they reported to the credit bureaus to my disliking! Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
JP Morgan Chase My bank account was hacked in the early morning of XX/XX/XXXX, my personal information was changed, including email, phone number, and mailing address to an out of state address. Money from my checking account was transferred to XXXX XXXX and my debit card was registered to XXXX for a ride, for a total of {$160.00} in fraudulent transactions. A credit card through Chase was also opened in my name online that day. The {$160.00} has yet to be returned to me as this check was mailed by Chase to a fraudulent address that Chase assured me had been removed from my account and the check was then fraudulently endorsed and cashed. 

background information : I went into Chase that morning of XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX AM to freeze and close my checking account out and to cancel the credit card that was opened. Chase originally failed to close out my account in person, even though I was told it was being closed out, and I had to go back two more times to get them to successfully close the account out. I was assured the second time going into a branch location that my information was successfully updated back to my personal information as I waited for Chase to mail a cashier 's check for my full account amount plus the fraudulent activity of {$160.00}. However, as my mother had a linked account with me at the time she could still see the wrong address showing on my account ( and that the account was not successfully closed out like it was supposed to be ), so the third time I went back into the Chase branch I requested they cut me a cashier 's check for the non-fraudulent amount remaining in my account that day for fear they would send all of my money to this fraudulent address. 

As for the {$160.00} of fraudulent charges that Chase had to process through their fraud department I was told this would then have to come as a mailed check due to my account officially being closed out, which I was fine with and was assured through the branch and speaking over the phone with multiple departments would be sent to my current correct original address on file ( Chase told me it would take about 3 weeks to process a fraud claim from XX/XX/XXXX and then mail a check out ). 

However, after waiting two months I continued to call for updates and was eventually notified that the check was already cashed ( on XX/XX/XXXX ), it was mailed to the fraudulent address from XX/XX/XXXX, and signed and endorsed in my name to a XXXX XXXX XXXX, even after being told by numerous departments at Chase the address issue was resolved. I have yet to receive these funds at this point and Chase sent me a letter on XX/XX/XXXX stating that " the bank that accepted your check is responsible for repayment. We have initiated a claim on your behalf to attempt to recover your lost funds ''. I have yet to hear anything back about this claim. 

Chase failed through multiple departments to correct my address on file that was originally changed online through a hack. I have updated my police report to report that Chase has failed to return these funds as well - the {$160.00}. 

I would also like to note that I received a letter from Chase on XX/XX/XXXX stating that the I was not responsible for the credit card opened in my name and that they would work with the consumer reporting agency to have this removed from my consumer report but as of XX/XX/XXXX the inquiry is still on file with XXXX. 

I then also received another notice XX/XX/XXXX stating another credit card was attempted to be opened in my name, a business visa signature card, through Chase again. All fraudulent activity occurring under my SSN are all happening through Chase. 

There are multiple issues listed above regarding how JP Morgan Chase has handled these events. I have spent countless hours on the phone with different Chase departments, all calls that are stated to be recorded, yet problems continue to be left unresolved. There are major disconnects between Chase departments that they can not even figure out how to mail me a check to my home I have lived at my entire life in IL, but instead sends a check to GA.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In early XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) called credit company to inquire about rewards on travel, was told I did not have to book with them ( credit card ) to get any reward credits, just call upon return of trip and a " statement credit '' would be issued, I was given a contact number - it's a general # for travel. Charged other travel items such as bag fees. 
Upon return called ( XX/XX/XXXX ) went through many representatives at card company, last was a Mr. XXXX Was told that my card did not have a travel reward and I would need to take a cash credit which is 1/2 the value of travel rewards. ie XXXX points for travel is {$25.00}, but XXXX points for cash are required for the same {$25.00}. 

I noted that their web site, under my card #, does not say such and a change should be made to make clear to consumers what the deal is. I consider their web site for my card is a bate and switch scam, and at least false advertising, Here is what the site for my specific card says : " Hello, XXXX. 
Choose the rewards that matter most to you Redeem Points Redemption Value Expiring Points Schedule FAQs View Program Rules Redeem your points. 
XXXX points minimum redemption. 

Travel Cover all or part of the cost of a flight, hotel or car rental. 
XXXX points = {$25.00} XXXX points minimum redemption. 

Gift cards Choose from top retailers and restaurants. 
XXXX points = {$25.00} XXXX points minimum redemption. 

Cash Choose a direct deposit, statement credit and more. 
XXXX points = {$25.00} " Representatives have constantly informed me that my card does not have these benefits, or may if I book a trip through them. Why would I pay 50-70 % more through them. 
AS mentioned I called before trip was told I could do such after trip, if I was told NO the complaint would not have been made.

Consumer complaint narrative:

Right after submitting the transaction, I received an email informing me that the funds will be available on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX. That's 3 days from time of sending. The next day, I called again, and here, I was able to speak to one, and got a vague explanation about partner banks not doing business on weekends. I honestly didn't understand the explanation, nor accepted it. I said okay, I can't do anything about it. They said they'll give me {$10.00} credit for my troubles, with an additional promise that the funds will arrive on the date and time promised ( XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), even earlier. It didn't. So I called them again right after I confirmed that the funds weren't delivered yet. They actually brought a rep from their partner bank in the XXXX The explanation was that this partner bank acted as intermediary to the destination bank, and that the transaction was still on process with the destination bank. I told them to cancel it, then and there, and I'm going with XXXX. This was around XXXX XXXX. I immediately sent the money through XXXX, and as it always has, the funds were there within a minute or so. Around XXXX XXXX, I received an email saying the Remitly transaction has been completed. 

This service does not deliver on their promise. Very frustrating. There are at least 2 promises here : 1. Within minutes - failed 2. The 3 days after date - still failed 3. Request to cancel since the transaction was not complete yet - ignored, they mention somewhere that this is possible as long as the transaction isn't complete yet

Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I went to my local BankofAmerica branch ( on XXXX XXXX, corner of XXXX and XXXX XXXX ) to pay my normal BofA Credit Card bill. And as usual their service at this particular branch was nothing less than atrocious. Then on XX/XX/XXXX I received an email questionnaire from BofA asking me how my experience at BofA was. So quite frankly, I told them they should get out of the Branch Banking business because on ANY day, they have ONE person working their counter and working the drive-thru and the WAIT each day is a joke. So they asked me multiple questions on how my experience was and I very bluntly told them. 
Then on XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Bank of America telling me my credit line had been reduced from {$20000.00} to {$500.00} because of a BAD Credit Score. I then received a letter in mail detailing exactly their comments sent via email. 
Now here is the ironic part. I have had this BofA credit card since XXXX and for the entire year of XXXX, I pay my Balance monthly, XXXX carryover, and I have maintained that relationship in almost identical terms since XXXX ( paying off balance ). Yet BofA went to the 'incredible conclusion ' that my credit score made me a Credit Risk. I was a Bad Customer! 
The part of this explanation which is almost laughable is that I have {$130000.00} in credit lines at XXXX XXXX ( and of yes, Bank of America wanted to know if I had a checking account with them -- which again is incredibly laughable -- considering their Customer Service is so Poor ). 
I now understand why the House Financial Services Committee has barbequed XXXX XXXX as of late. Bank of America should receive the same Scrutiny when you treat 'CUSTOMERS ' such as I with exactly the same disdain. And I would like to repeat, they have been making Money off of my use of their card since XXXX with ZERO interruptions because of use. Not me making money off them. They making it off of me. 
I hope the CFPB will look into this matter. They are a Public company, not Private!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

XXXX OVER THE RIGHTFUL ACCOUNT HOLDER AND ALLOW THE FORWARDING OF REPLACEMENT CARDS AND STATEMENTS TO HIS OFFICE ADDRESS, WHICH IS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX MI XXXX. 

IN ANY CASE, MY BEST RECOLLECTION WAS THAT THIS CARD HAD A XXXX BALANCE AT THE TIME IT WAS TAKEN OFF MY CHARGE BY MR. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good afternoon! 

I am an XXXX XXXX Service Member in the XXXX XXXX. I have paid my student loans for approximately 12 years and have never once missed a payment. I deal directly with XXXX XXXX for my student loans. I started making qualified loan payments towards the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program in XXXX. For the next four years I submitted the annual employment certification form documenting my military service and continued to make payments under the standard re-payments plan. I sent emails to XXXX XXXX a couple times a year asking for a cumulative report of payments I made so that I could verify they were tracking what I was. Never once did I receive a reply. In XXXX, after graduate school, I received a letter stating I needed to be in a particular repayment program to qualify and everything up until that point would not qualify. Never once in four plus years did XXXX XXXX send me a letter, an email or a phone call to tell me this information even though they were processing my employment verification letters annually while ignoring my emails asking for verification. Further conversations with XXXX XXXX have yielded zero results and extremely poor customer service with them stating there is no way to appeal or rectify the fact that I was misled for four years about my repayment. Had XXXX XXXX   informed me in a timely manner then I could have years worth of qualifying payments towards PSLF and be close to applying for forgiveness. The plan set forth by congress fixed the issue for those whom already made the 120 payments but did nothing to help fix the underlying issues in which I, and many others, find ourselves today. Nothing has changed at XXXX XXXX. They are still as immoral and unethical as they were since the first day I did any business with them. I thank you tremendously for your time and attention in this matter!

Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Talked to a third-party about your debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received an email from this company, claiming to collect a debt for a payday loan. Not knowing what this was about I called them. Right, away, they said they were going to send the police and have me severed and possible jail time if I didnt take care of the debt. I am being scared and not knowing what to do, gave the person my contact, mailing, and email information. Just my own no one elses. 

The person ( XXXX XXXX ) told me that he was going to send me an email that same day right after we got off the phone and a letter to my home address. A few days go by and I did receive the email. I called the number on the letterhead and it was to a construction company, I then tried to locate the company online and contacted the BBB and no one has ever heard of this company. 

I called again but at a different time then the first time calling, and XXXX XXXX answered. I told him I didnt receive the email or the paperwork. He did finally send the email. In giving him my contact information, I had given him my debit card information after looking on the FTC websites and reading about scams I canceled and not knowing this company and not finding out any information about it. I thought it was best to do so. 

I called the original place I got the loan from and they told me that they have never heard of this company and told me they sold it to another company for which they gave me the information too. 

This was not the company ( on letterhead ) that was stated to me. In the interim of canceling the debit card, they had started calling my parents they did not get their phone number from myself. Telling my parents that the police are going to come and arrest me and arrest both of them too. I called them and told them not to call my parents. Both my parents are very ill, my mother is recovering from a double XXXX transplant and my father had a small XXXX XXXX in early XX/XX/2019. 

I told XXXX XXXX again when I called that I still have not received the paperwork that was supposed have been mailed to me. 

I called today XX/XX/2019 and again asked him why do they keep calling my parents and Ive asked you not to that you have my contact information and again that my parents are very ill, those calls are upsetting to both of them. 

I also ask for proof that the company was real because I have no way of knowing this and he got very upset with me in my asking. I don't know who this company is and they are not professional at all. But, most importantly I don't want them to call my parents anymore I'm so afraid that something will happen to them because of their harassing phone calls.
