Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative: I have held my credit card for over 10 years with the same company. I went on vacation last week. I have used this same credit card while vacationing before at the same destination over the years. I came home to a call from the company telling me they are questioning some of the transactions on my card and to contact the company. I have now been on hold for a total over 6 hours to speak to someone in regards to this matter. The first day I tried calling the customer service number and wait times were over 30 min. I tried again the next day and I was able to get a customer service rep. after waiting 1 and half hours yesterday. He was unable to verify who I am due to the questions he asked me. I was not able to wait at home while on hold and did not have access to some of the answers ( my statements ) I explained to him that it was the company who called me and I was returning their call and he would not try any other way to verify who I was. I went to work today and the only way I am able to pay for parking is with my credit card it was declined. I have a long drive to work and I am unable to find parking elsewhere. I need to pay for my parking daily. I came home from work again today and waited on hold for over 3 and half hours to speak with someone. I finally got a rep. and he told me there was nothing he could do for me and was unable to access my account. So the time I spent on hold was totally wasted. There is a note on my file ( account ) that I am to go into the company with 2 pieces of ID to discuss this matter. I work Monday to Friday XXXX the same as the companies hours. I am not about to take a day off work just to speak to someone when I know there has been no strange activity on my credit card. XXXX 's ATM banking system was down when I was on vacation and I had to utilize my credit card for all my purchases until the ATM system came back online. The company should be aware of this. I only have XXXX credit card and I need to use it tomorrow when I go to work to pay for parking. I have no idea what to do about this issue. The company should be able to call me directly and speak with me in regards to the purchases that were made. I should not have to take off work just to go to the company to discuss this. XXXX  should be able to deal with this issue directly. There should be customer service representative from either the company or XXXX  who can deal with this matter with me over the phone or after hours. I am 99 % sure that it has to do with the ATM going down and the purchases I made- not some fraudulent charges on my card. The company is not handling this situation well at all. I am ready to cancel my card due to the outrageous customer service I am receiving over something that is so trivial. I would like to hear back from XXXX  as well as my company in regards to this matter. There has to be a better way in our day and age to do business and to keep customers. I do not nor will I go online and deal with my transactions in regards to the credit card. I don't need someone hacking my account. I have always called and discussed matters over the phone with my company about my account and it has never been an issue. My main complaint is how my company is handling this issue total disregard for me at this point.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative: Someone has been trying to get capital one cards in my name for years and they will not take the inquires off my credit report. I have been disputing my inquires with them for years I have been sending my dispute letters to XXXX Capital one XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  where all 3 credit bureaus say to send disputes. After calling Capital one dispute department they say I have been sending letters to the wrong department and that I need to dispute the inquires with the 3 credit bureaus. The address I was supposed to be sending disputes to is capital one XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I was told by the capital one employee. Capital one credit card applications are confusing some say they will not affect your credit and and some dont mention that they will do a hard credit pull. The XXXX Capital one credit card applications that I applied for business credit does not state anywhere that they will do a hard inquiry on your personal credit. I look for the fine writing and I can not see it anywhere on the application even though they say it is there, the place where they ask you to put your social security number they only say it is for identification purposes only it says nothing about a hard credit pull. You shouldnt have to read a book or search for something that can lower your score. That should be in big bold letters on all applications so a customer is well informed because some applications dont affect your credit but they are from the same company and you can not tell them apart.

a XXXX XXXX was assigned to the account well over amonth ago, he finailly reached out to borrwoer rep the other day, we hav elost so much time and now carrington states foraclosure to be put in paper XX/XX/2019/thsi was caculated ,2 weeks went by and i asked XXXX XXXX why has not gotten back to me and stated he was sick, then no calls twoweeks now forclosure, this is very disengenious.demand is madeborrwoer have formal discussion on loss mitgation options!! this is and unfair business practice.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX. I received a call from XXXX on this morning. She is employed at XXXX XXXX XXXX. She contacted me in reference to a debt in my husbands name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Called me on my cellphone number which is XXXX. I am curious to why she called my number instead of my husbands cellphone number. 
I was told by XXXX that my cellphone number is also associated with the loan. I contacted XXXX after receiving a debt collections letter in the mail. I explained to XXXX that XXXX and I had married and divorced on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX and I were married on XX/XX/XXXX and we divorced later that year in XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX and I remarried on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX and I lived apart until XX/XX/XXXX. I resided at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX resided at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. There were other people in and out of his home at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
I moved in with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and we were remarried on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I am curious to why my cellphone number is associated with this alleged credit card account. I am always curious to why XXXX called me on this morning versus calling my husband at his cellphone number which is XXXX. 
After XXXX and I divorced in XX/XX/XXXX, I kept my married name XXXX. XXXX and I married and divorced the same year, XX/XX/XXXX. We applied for another marriage license the same year and were remarried 4 years later. I am in no way associated with this account yet the Collections Agency contacted me in reference to the account. I do not want this account to be charged against me in any way. My husband has been a victim of identity theft in the past and he alleges this is not his account. 
At the time the credit card was acquired, I was unemployed. 
XXXX and I have requested, information from XXXX credit in reference to the account. I am afraid that my name is associated with the account and it could potentially show up on my credit report. I am requesting that my name is completely removed from the account and I am requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX never contact me again. The account has been sent to the fraud department. 
Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Creditor : Simms Associates XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX DE XXXX Current Creditor : XXXX Balance : {$4300.00} Account : # Ending in XXXX Charged off : XX/XX/XXXX Origination Date : XX/XX/XXXX Charge Off Amount : {$4300.00} Total Interest Since C/O : {$0.00} Total Non-Interest/Fees Since C/O : {$0.00} Total Payments Post C/O : {$0.00} The Collections Agency will not tell me how they acquired my cellphone number. I am requesting to be held harmless and totally removed from this collection debt and I am requesting that XXXX XXXX never contact me again. My husband has requested the loan application with signature and all charges that were made on said credit card to be mailed to our home address. A friend of XXXX and her sons were living in and out of his home in XX/XX/XXXX. The Lady has a home in XXXX XXXX and she runs a transitional safe house in XXXX XXXX. My husband denies having applied for a credit card with XXXX XXXX and we are anticipating a court case.

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover Bank closed my savings account. Account number ending in XXXX on XX/XX/2022. After, I called Discover Bank to verify my identity. The Discover Bank banking specialist told me that my Discover bank savings account balance would be mailed by XX/XX/2022. On XX/XX/2022, I wrote a letter to Discover Bank & dispatched by Certificated Mail to mail a check for the balance. 
On XX/XX/2022, I mailed a letter by Certified Mail to XXXX XXXX, Vice President, Discover Bank Customer Service, asking that my check be mailed. 
On XX/XX/2022, I mailed a Priority Mail Letter to XXXX XXXX, President & Chief Executive Officer, asking that the balance in my Discover Bank Savings Account be sent to me. I still have not received the check for the balance in my Discover Bank Savings Account for {$3600.00}. 
I must have these funds by XXXX to pay my Property Taxes.

This is the phone # on the back of my card - XXXX these are the dates I've tried to contact them, all to no avail - contacted : XXXX @ XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX. 

XXXX  XXXX XXXX, I went online and found a different # - XXXX XXXX - and called at XXXX. AGAIN I get the message that the fraud line is unavailable and I can NEVER talk with a person. This is beyond frustrating and inappropriate action on their part regarding my card, hence my money. I have no doubt they would abruptly fine me if I'm late with a payment however I CAN NOT USE THE CARD OR SPEAK TO A PERSON!

Consumer complaint narrative: I have tried to contact Lightstream ( the lender ) on numerous occasions to ask how much I still owe on the loan I took out several months ago. A recording gives me a phone number to call but the number just rings and rings! So, I re-dial and get a recording that tells me to hang up and try again! This ridiculous situation has been going on for days now and I'm extremely frustrated! Would you please tell them that they must make it easy ( not harder ) to get answers to their clients questions! Thank you very much.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2019 we contacted US Bank regarding the amount of interest on a cash advance which we have no record of initiating. We were advised by the customer service agent that they can only go back 7 years and after review, can not locate any cash advance transaction on the account.  US Bank was requested to go back prior to 7 years and research any such activity. It is out position that we did not make such an advance and the charge must be fraudulent. On XX/XX/2019 US Bank responded that they could not find any record of the cash advance. This letter does not state they only went back 7 years to review. We asked US Bank to go back to the inception of the account. On XX/XX/2019 we requested an interest adjustment to this account for any and all interest or fees imposed since the initiation of this transaction. To day we have not received a written response to this letter. In a telephone conversation with a supervisor today we were informed that since US Bank could not locate the cash advance and that since we could not prove we did not make a cash advance they were not providing any interest adjustment on the account. It is our position that an adjustment in interest applied should be made.

The old account should have ended on the XXXX and a new account should have started but, on the XXXX chase withdrawal {$470.00} as if I still owed them money. It is now XXXX th XXXX and the money is still not back in my account. Plus money is owed from coverage of the last car policy ending early that has not been payed. I live on a fixed income and need the money returned asap which I explained to several people. Why are banks allowed to hold money until they feel like refunding it and consumers are not. Any bank transaction that take place can be reversed but, they are holding my money without a reasonable explanation in my opinion. I need my money

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Today, XX/XX/2022, I was applying for a loan with AmOne on their website. www.amone.com After I entered all my information it took me into the account of a different individual that I do not know. None of my information was connected to this person.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions

Consumer complaint narrative:
Caliber bank sent me incorrect modification documents, and they are aware the AZ HUD ( HAF ) is paying {$25000.00}. to reimburse expenses Caliber incurred due to missed payments as per the Cares Act/ forbearance during Covid. Caliber is extending my mortgage by 14 years, or nearly {$170000.00}. more in payments, because they will not receive the money ( {$25000.00} ) from the state of AZ for approximately 3 weeks, yet advised they still plan to keep the money from the state of AZ upon receipt. 

I am forced to sign the modification documents that they actually mailed to an incorrect address, and so had to e-Mail to me shortening the amount of time I had to review. I am told I must sign these papers, and increase my mortgage payments to Caliber by 14 years, from the 26 year balance to a new 40 year loan they never discussed with me or advised me of, even though I am now aware of a potentially fraudulent act on the part of my mortgage servicer. 

The {$25000.00} that I applied for assistance to the state for was to be used to make up for the payments not made during the forbearance period. I did not intend for the state to send that money to Caliber to have them collect it in addition to collecting 14 more years of payments from me. They are doing this with full knowledge that they are being paid twice. As they told me about this, I feel they have now made me a party to their unjust enrichment/fraudulent acts. 

The paperwork that they provided me with states that the unpaid amount of mortgage payments was approximately {$20000.00}. They advised State Of Arizona That the outstanding amount due is in excess of XXXX. They have also quoted other outstanding amounts in the area of {$26000.00}. Each time I speak with them there is a different dollar amount quoted, which is very disconcerting.

I have not been able to access my account online at Caliber bank website for nearly 2 years. They have limited access to anyone who is part of the Forbearance program. I switched to electronic access to my account just before the forbearance program/Covid struck. As such I am flying blind in this regard and can not obtain an accurate assessment of my account. I was told to send three trial payments in to Caliber bank beginning in XXXX and I have done so. I made the first payment in XX/XX/XXXX. I sent those by mail as instructed. I have made five mortgage payments, in full, with the last being made online through my bank on XXXX XXXX. 

I cant be a party to Caliber Banks plan to keep the money, but Caliber Bank has only given me until XX/XX/XXXX to mail the modification documents back to them, or are threatening foreclosure. This was per my conversation with XXXX at Caliber bank today. 

Yesterday, I spoke with a XXXX at Caliber Bank who asked me to provide her with proof that the state of AZ/HAF is/will be making the payments and approved my application for assistance. I emailed her a PDF version of the approval letter from HAF as well as a PDF print out of the XXXX1 payments being made in the amount of {$2000.00}, and one payment in the amount of {$2000.00}. The total of this is {$25000.00} being paid to Caliber bank. Regardless, I was told today that they are accepting those payments but still modifying my mortgage as if the payments are not being received. They told me I have to EITHER accept the payment from the state OR accept the modification but not both. I confirm that if I accept the payment from the state, which wont be a receipt for three weeks, they will likely put my account into foreclosure status so thats not an option. The payment from the state is not going to me its going to Caliber bank anyway. Accepting one or the other which is not even possible in my case. Yet, they are doing BOTH, taking the payment from the state of Arizona and taking 14 additional years of payments from me.

They are well aware of this yet are continuing to tell me that these are my options. I have no options. Theyre forcing me to sign the modification knowing that they intend to take the states money and keep it even though its not legal for them to do so. 
This is not only reimbursement from two different individuals/entities for the same loss but the bank is knowingly involving me in this, when I applied for assistance from the state, but never to assist Caliber in committing fraud.
I dont have any good option in this case, as Caliber is forcing my hand. 

When I repeated this back to XXXX today at Caliber Bank and asked her if this is truly what they expect of me and intend to do, she said basically yes, the only other option is my account will go into foreclosure status, I was appalled. 

I need assistance, please! 

Are they doing this to other homeowners in my same situation?
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I am XXXX XXXX submitting this complaint against Lvnv Funding LLC and there is no third party involved. Lvnv Funding LLC did not provide me with sufficient documentary evidence such as tracking number or some type of signed delivery slip by me the consumer, proving that I received and was made aware of collection activity of this alleged debt, this alleged debt had been fraudulently placed onto my consumer report with forethought and malice to being harm to me and my financial reputation.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I was trying to buy a grill for my husband 's birthday at XXXX when I saw their app showing a special saying, " Get {$75.00} with a new Apple Card. When you spend $ 75+ with Apple Pay at XXXX XXXX stores, online, or directly from the XXXX XXXX app. Must open by XX/XX/30 '' I thought it was a great deal and applied for the Apple Card. I was immediately approved. I bought the grill ( {$590.00} ) and was happy to get {$75.00} back. After a couple of weeks, I didn't see the credit reflected in my account, so I contacted Apple Card customer support. On XX/XX/XXXX, the specialist XXXX said they opened a dispute for the {$75.00} after I explained the situation and sent the screenshots. I never got any answer. Last Friday ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I contacted them again, and the specialist XXXX said they couldn't see any dispute in my account. I feel extremely disrespected because I should never be wasting my time fighting for something that is my right since I followed all the instructions and did all steps for this special. It's ridiculous, and I would NEVER have opened an account with Apple Card if it wasn't for this {$75.00} bonus. I had multiple chances before and didn't even consider it ; this was the first time because I thought it was a great deal and opened one just because of it.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am requesting DELETION of the collections from AFNI, INC On XX/XX/2019 and XX/XX/2019, I returned equipment that we rented from XXXX that is worth approximately {$550.00} in balance ( could be {$540.00} according to the XXXX phone representative ). XXXX received the equipment and told me in the store on those dates that any balance owed to XXXX is now a XXXX balance and that they will make sure that my account reads XXXX balance to all associated departments. 
2. On XX/XX/2019 I received an alert from XXXX and XXXX that a Collection from AFNI was added to my credit file for a debt owed to XXXX for {$550.00}. I also saw that it was reported by them on XX/XX/2019. On the debt they reported that is owed to XXXX it stated that the balance date was XX/XX/2019. That is at least thirty-five days ( 35 ) after I returned ALL equipment to XXXX XXXX in XXXX GA store and have a XXXX balance in the XXXX location. 
3. This ERROR in their system that caused this problem occurred within their system. 
4. I received no warning that after I returned the equipment to XXXX that this collector named AFNI Inc. would post a debt that does not truly exist toward XXXX on my credit file with the Credit Bureau. Even to, there is NO debt owed to XXXX on and AFTER XXXX XX/XX/2019 because all equipment was returned to them in and AUTHORIZED EQUIPMENT RECEIPT LOCATION, an XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX - ( XXXX ) XXXX ), as evidenced by the receipts ATTACHED and the correspondence from them that I include. I have ALSO included the business cards of the representatives I dealt with PERSONALLY in the store. I have, with due diligence, recorded all communication with XXXX and my attempted communication with AFNI Inc . The attempted communication with AFNI Inc. proved useless, but it is recorded, and they were not helpful. XXXX conceded that it was XXXX ERROR / fault and I have it on recording conversations between themselves at the store in XXXX GA and XXXX customer service. They are also sending more information to me in connection with this apology and have stated that they will try to correct it also. It has caused me significant damage for the report of a recent collections on my credit file to my business dealings of such an insignificantly small amount of money that represents such recent activity of fiscal irresponsibility.

I left numerous voicemails or they could not direct me specifically to her. I was then given her " direct line '' XXXX X XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX nothing ) .I called XXXX, the main line, they did't even know who this person was, but let me put you through her voicemail, nothing. Since I hired a lawyer, I was told, anything Shellpoint sent, send it to the lawyers. He never called. This is still pending. 
Try calling Shellpoint at XXXX, you won't get thru to them and they will tell you " oh, she/he is not in this building '' I'll send you to the voicemail. Nothing.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I ask that the CFPB compel AES the servicer to respond to my XX/XX/XXXX feedback from my initial CFPB complaint # XXXX. 

And today I report two separate events that have occurred since the initial complaint. These events demonstrate the servicers continued pattern & practice of : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX loan modification terms that are in the servicers economic benefitnot the borrowers Modifying loan terms without borrower consent. 
Servicer disregarding borrower instruction then using their discretion to modify the loan terms. 

1. In XXXX of XXXX there was a presidential order pausing student loan repayments. AES the servicer contacted me making me aware of this option. At that time I was working and continued to pay my monthly obligation. Then I became unemployed in XX/XX/XXXX. At that point I contacted AES via phone call informing them that I was now unemployed and would not be paying utilizing the presidential order. They accepted my communication, and my payments were paused. I discovered more than a year afterwards that they place the loan in a Unemployment Forbearance instead?!?!?! 

2. This Unemployment forbearance was to end in XX/XX/XXXX. That fall I was required to reapply for the annual XXXX XXXX payment recalculation which was completed timely and correctly. I learn after the XXXX deadline that they did not underwrite my file. This accelerated the payment amount to be {$1700.00} for the XXXX XXXX monthly payment. On a phone call in XX/XX/XXXX, I corrected them ( which had no material differences from my initial submission ) so they could complete the processing of my XXXX application. They did process my paperwork and adjusted my XXXX to a new 2022 monthly payment of {$390.00}. At that moment AES was requiring me to pay the XX/XX/XXXX {$1700.00} payment. I spoke with an AES client services manager to correct the XXXX payment to be the corrected XXXX payment of {$390.00} vs the {$1700.00} amount. That manager responded that he would call back with a resolution. I received no calls or communication until late XX/XX/XXXX when I called in to AES. Then I learned that my XXXX payment was added to the outstanding principal via an Administrative Forbearance which added that XXXX payment to outstanding principle Additional thoughts Why am I not being disclosed nor required to consent to their terms? E-Signature technology is commonplace and should be utilized for all correspondence with the servicer. To this point I contend that their disclosure does not meet legal requirements and should void the loan.

Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a mortgage with Mr. Cooper, formerly NationStar Mortgage, several years ago they were incorrectly reporting my mortgage payments as being missed or late. Since I purchased my home I have been on an equity accelerator program where one half of my monthly payment is drafted directly from my bank account every 2 weeks. Approximately 3 years ago upon checking my credit I saw that Nationstar had reported that I had missed 12 mortgage payments, which was completely false. I tried to work with NationStar to get this corrected, as you can imagine what is was doing to my credit, all attempts failed. I was unable to refinance with another lender as my credit was trashed, not only as a result of Nationstar reporting incorrectly but had gone through a nasty divorce. It has now been approximately 2 to 3 years since this occurred and I have been working very hard to improve my credit. In XXXX of XXXX upon checking my credit I found that there was no mortgage reporting on my credit at all. I contacted Nationstar now Mr. Cooper and asked that this be corrected and that my mortgage be reported to the 3 reporting agencies and was told that this would be taken care of. Well it is now XXXX of XXXX and nothing, In XXXX I again called Nationstar which was now Mr. Cooper and tried to get this taken care of and was told that the credit reporting agencies were the ones requesting that it not be reported, and that I needed to send a letter to Mr. Cooper requesting that my payments were once again reported, which I did in XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX. After thinking about this I contacted all 3 of the agencies to see why they had requested my mortgage not be reported and was informed that it was Nationstar that asked that the reporting cease. When I discovered this I again called Mr. Cooper, this time I was informed that it was the equity accelerator program that had made the request. I finally got to speak with a supervisor, XXXX who was very kind and said that she would look into the matter and try to get to the bottom of it and gave me a date of XX/XX/XXXX. I then received a letter from Mr. Cooper asking me to send them a letter requesting that they begin reporting my mortgage. I once again contacted XXXX. She tried once again to be helpful and told me that the original letter I sent in on XX/XX/XXXX was on file and did not understand why this letter was being asked for again. XXXX told me that she was going to get to the bottom of this and was also going to attempt to have the matter expedited. We are now coming up on the end of XXXX and still this matter, despite my letter and numerous requests is still in the same situation it was when I asked it be corrected last XXXX. I do not understand what it is going to take to resolve this matter, and therefore am looking to you for help. I have worked hard improving my credit and I know that having never missed or been late on a mortgage payment if my mortgage was being reported as it should my score would increase dramatically. I want nothing more than to get away from Mr. Cooper, but until they start reporting to the credit bureaus I'm stuck. Any assistance you can give in this matter will be greatly appreciated.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase has allowed merchants using cards that were closed for fraud to charge against my current account number. 

They failed to properly investigate fraudulent transactions. Made claims after getting statements in writing that there was nothing they could do as the window had expired. The reason the window of eligibility expired was due to their mishandling. 

I have submitted documents, spent well over 4 hours on the phone with completely inept personnel who simply repeated information in the face of overwhelming empirical data contradicting their statements. 

I have over {$2500.00} in charges that need to be removed from my account. These were made without my authorization on stolen cards or on cards that Chase had closed and replaced per their procedure. 

Their executive staff claims to investigate these issues, yet I have no way of contacting them. I am left with no recourse except for civil action.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Don't agree with the fees charged
Consumer complaint narrative:
The issue is my student loans should already be paid off. Instead, I still have a {$37000.00} balance. 

The very first payment on all my student loans was set up wrong by AES. Ive requested information but have never received it. Ive requested an override but have never received it. AES is charging me 7.375 % and I should be paying between 1.75 % to 3.15 %. 

AES says my interest rate couldnt be dropped because I missed a payment. For 20 years my loan has been on auto draft and Ive not missed a payment. Online it shows I missed my very first payment. Ive asked AES to provide me documentation on this matter for over 10 years now and not once have they sent me any information. 

AES failed to set up my auto draft properly and is punishing me for it. Had my loans dropped to a lower interest rate my loans would be paid off at this point. Instead, I still owe over $ 30k of principal between 2 loans.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to alert the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau of a collections company that is violating my rights and not using proper communication methods when showing up on my credit report. I need the CFPB office to please look into my case. This account ASSETCARE XXXX balance {$3600.00} has just popped up on my credit report without ever communicating to me. There was no written letter to me or calls to me so I can explain that they have the wrong person. They have recently just popped up on my credit report and I am not familiar with how they got my information or how they have my social security number. I do not owe this company and I Right now I am getting an alert on my XXXX XXXX and credit monitoring service saying my credit score has dropped tremendously. I can furnish the images of this alert showing the collections company. They are hurting me financially and this is a really big issue. To my understanding they must be compliant with laws and regulations that say they must write the consumer within days of the first communication. They are using my credit to communicate with me yet they NEVER wrote me before.If they don't write me then how could send me a right to dispute or explain my rights? Please review the original paperwork for this account. I request they send me a copy of this information to my address. I also request the original contract signed showing my signature long with all other pages of the original agreement. I am suffering damages because of this error. I have been a victim of ID theft before and I monitor my financial affairs very closely.To me this seems like an instance of debt parking that I read about on the FTC website. The Federal Trade Commission has taken action against debt collection companies that allegedly placed bogus or highly questionable debts onto consumers credit reports to coerce them to pay the debts. They label this as DEBT PARKING.The Federal Trade Commission recently took action against a Missouri collection company and its owners, alleging that they collected more than {$24.00} million from consumers, largely by placing bogus or highly questionable debts on their credit reports. The defendants used this illegal debt parking to coerce people to pay debts they didnt owe or didnt recognize, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of the F.T.C.s bureau of consumer protection , said in prepared remarks about the agencys settlement with the company, ASSETCARE. I DO NOT HAVE ANY BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP WITH THIS COMPANY and I am concerned they have unethically acquired my information and they are acting unethically with their debt collections. There is a process in law that protects consumers from these illegal actions. This account is lowering my credit score and if I am declined for anything, I will seek financial remedy by talking to an fdcpa lawyer.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I applied but the adverse information came from a non reporting consumer agency.

In XX/XX/XXXX I purchased a property in XXXX through Loan Depot. I hired a bad contractor and 203k consultant. Loan Depot paid the contractor over 96k and the contractor failed inspections with the City of XXXX. Lon Depot did not ask for a city inspection until i fires the contractor. That seemed very strange that they waited until they paid the contractor XXXX to ask for a city inspection. This has put me in a real bad stressful situation. I had to pay for things, twice, to get corrected and up to code which prevented me from finishing my property. Ive been struggling to get things done in my building and pay my mortgage for the last year. I had not missed any payments until XX/XX/XXXX. I was able to get a forebearance in XXXX because I work for the government and did not know if I would be affected greatly by the government shutdown. Now Im struggling to make payments because I have to make repairs to my home due to it not being completely renovated. For example my pipes burst due to the Polar Vortex in XXXX which cost me a lot to repair. The pipes froze because I dont have any walls up in my first unit. I had about 13 or more busted pipes. I called Loan Depot on XX/XX/XXXX to see what options I had. I was told I could extend my forebearance and they sent me a modification package which I have not received. Today XX/XX/XXXX I called to extend the forebearance and i was told I couldnt. I cant believe I was lied to. I am so upset that Im struggling due to their negligence and they wont help me. I also begged Loan Depot last year to close my fha case so I could refinance they said they would and did not do so. I am paying way more in interest than I should be and cant even refinance to save money to finish this renovation. I cant get help from other banks because my building is not completed. This has been a really bad experience. Im upset that my credit score may decrease as well. I have all of my emails from Loan Depot if needed. I also have pics of the work from the contractor that failed. I also have all my docs from the complaints I made about the contractors and consultant. I hope I can get some help!!!

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
There was one large transaction on XX/XX/2021 at XXXX XXXX totalling XXXX AUD. 
I wrote two dispute letters to Coinbase Company, and both were denied without a clear explanation. 

Their response is, well, not very good, in that it is based on just blatantly incorrect understanding of what I have to say. What amazes me is just how difficult it has been to find soundness in it. Their analysis, for instance, doesn't engage with the actual history of my account and a significant portion of related data that may contradict their position has been conveniently ignored. 

I have great respect for rational and honest discussion but no respect for misrepresentation. I detest the lies and distortions associated with their administration. They have failed to exercise due diligence and duty of care to substantiate their claims. 

This complex issue has caused substantial harm to me, and if not appropriately addressed, will continue to cause substantial harm to others, we must therefore conduct an in-depth and comprehensive review of all the contributing factors that have led to an outcome as horrendous as the one described herein.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: My mortgage was sold/transferred from XXXX XXXX  to Select Portfolio Servicing in XXXX of XXXX. I have made mortgage payments to Select Portfolio Servicing without missing a payment since this transfer although I was under Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy since XXXX of XXXX. I was discharged from the Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy in XXXX of XXXX. I began receiving phone calls from Select Portfolio Servicing that my mortgage payment was 30 days delinquent. I informed them that I had been under Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy but my mortgage was not under the bankruptcy and I had continued to make mortgage payments throughout. I forwarded 2 years of payment verification to them and they responded in writing on XX/XX/XXXX, stating they had received my information and was researching my account. Next they mailed me a letter stating the there was a payment due XX/XX/XXXX and it had not been received and they were charging a late payment of {$12.00} to my account. I then phone them and request a manager, I was connected to a supervisor and I explained my problem. The supervisor when over all of the payments that I made since the account was sold/transferred to Select Portfolio Servicing and discovered that a part of the payment I sent for the XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$470.00} had been applied to {$420.00} in foreclosure fees. The supervisor said the foreclosure fees came over with the account from XXXX XXXX. I informed the supervisor that my mortgage had never been in foreclosure, but that I was aware that XXXX had tried to submit a claim through the Bankruptcy Court that I had missed 3 payments in XXXX. I explained that I had never missed a payment on the mortgage and that I had documentation from Bankruptcy Court that the motion was withdrawn after I provided payment verification to the Bankruptcy Court. The supervisor advised me to forward submit my documentation, which I did on XX/XX/XXXX. Select Portfolio Servicing then responded to me by letter stating they received my correspondence, researched my account further and removed the fees. They also included a corporate advance history for my account documenting that {$420.00} in fees listed as a beginning balance had been charged to my account on XX/XX/XXXX and that a credit in the amount of {$420.00} had been applied on XX/XX/XXXX. The corporate advance history also showed 3 other fees had been charged to my account, {$420.00} in FC ATTY Fees on XX/XX/XXXX ; {$270.00} in Bankruptcy Costs on XX/XX/XXXX ; and {$150.00} in Bankruptcy Fees on XX/XX/XXXX. This same letter also informed me that my account was still delinquent and due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment, although I had mailed a payment in the amount of {$510.00}, which was credited to the account on XX/XX/XXXX. I phone Select Portfolio Servicing again on XX/XX/XXXX and requested to speak with a manager and after explaining my problem, I was told that the fees came to them with the account and that a manager was not available at that time and someone would return the call to me. I have not received a call from anyone from Select Portfolio Servicing as of date. My mortgage has not been in foreclosure and there was no claim from XXXX nor Select Portfolio Servicing listed in my Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX, consumer, am submitting this communication to inform Navy Federal Credit Union that by law, you do not have the right to report inaccurate information knowingly or not without my consent, pursuant to 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ). After viewing my credit report, it shows derogatory accounts that I question. In accordance with my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act I am disputing this account and requesting for validation that you have proof of debt. 
In accordance to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify - through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract any and all accounts you post on a credit report. 
I am requesting VALIDATION. Provide me with evidence that I am obligated to pay for the derogatory accounts listed above. 
If your company fails to comply or respond to this letter within the allotted time of 30 days from the date you receive this letter, this account must be deleted and removed immediately from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
We had a loan with Ditech ( Loan Number XXXX ). Our previous servicer was XXXX  XXXX XXXX. We endured a hardship beginning in XX/XX/XXXX and started the loan modification process with XXXX XXXX XXXX. We completed all of our paperwork and submitted it to XXXX   XXXX XXXX. During the review process, we received a letter from XXXX   XXXX XXXX stating our new servicer would be Ditech Financial, LLC effective XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke to XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding the modification status and was told that our modification was going to be handed by Ditech. I followed up with Ditech between XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX regarding the loan modification. During this time, I kept being told our application/documents were either old or incomplete. I submitted paperwork 3-4 times to Ditech. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter stating the modification could not be processed because of incomplete paperwork. I called Ditech to find out what paperwork was incomplete. I was told the REAL reason why the modification is not going though is because we already had more than 1 modification and have reached our limit. This was news to us! If this were true, why were we offered the modification by XXXX XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX and continued to go through the modification process through XX/XX/XXXX? In XXXX the following payments were made in an effort to catch up as best as we could : XX/XX/XXXX - {$1900.00} XX/XX/XXXX - {$1900.00} XX/XX/XXXX - {$1900.00} XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - {$3800.00} ( via money order ) + an additional {$3800.00} ( via money orders ) In XX/XX/XXXX a check in the amount of {$1900.00} was made to Ditech but {$1900.00} was cashed according to the bank. 

In XX/XX/XXXX we were offered a Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement wherein we were to pay {$2800.00} a month beginning XX/XX/XXXX and continue through XX/XX/XXXX. Once completed, we would be current. Even thought there was an additional $ 900+ above the {$1900.00} we were already paying, we agreed to the repayment plan in an effort to make things current and avoid foreclosure. We received the Supplements Repayment Plan which explained all of the terms, the amounts to be paid with due dates, etc. Ditechs agreement specifically stated that if we make the supplement repayment payments on or before the due date Ditech will not initiate foreclose proceedings or, if foreclosure has already been initiated, we will not proceed to foreclosure sale. We made our first payment in XX/XX/XXXX for {$2800.00} and our second payment in XX/XX/XXXX for {$2800.00}. When we made our payment in XX/XX/XXXX my bank confirmed the check was not cashed. On XXXX XXXX my check sent in XXXX was returned to me. On XX/XX/XXXX I called Ditech at XXXX and spoke to XXXX at XXXX  XXXX regarding my returned check sent in XXXX. She explained our check was returned because we are going through foreclosure. I explained we are under a Repayment Plan Agreement offered by Ditech. When I asked to speak to a Supervisor, I was placed on hold. XXXX came back to the phone and only told me that her Supervisor said the foreclosure status was removed and that I can send in my check in XXXX. I mailed my check for XXXX to Ditech on XX/XX/XXXX. Again, my check was never applied to the account and was returned to me on XX/XX/XXXX. Although I received letters from Ditech stating their moving forward with the foreclosure was in error and to resend the check, they continued the foreclosure process. When we received our XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX statements, they showed an outstanding balance of {$19000.00}, Corporate Advances of {$81000.00}, etc. 

Ditech breached its Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement by not accepting our agreed upon payment of {$2800.00} in exchange for not initiating foreclosure proceedings. As we were adhering to the Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement, Ditech initiated foreclosure proceedings which is dual tracking and in violation of the California Homeowner Bill of Rights. 

A certified Qualified Written Request dated XX/XX/XXXX was sent to Ditech referencing their breach of the Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement, dual tracking, discrepancy in payments made versus monies owed, a request for the breakdown of monies as noted in our XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX statements, a request for forbearance, and a request to come up with an amicably feasible amount between both parties in light of Ditechs unfair and unlawful handling. Ditech was advised that under Section 6 of RESPA they were required to acknowledge my request within 20 business days and resolve the issue within 60 business days. The certified letter was signed by a XXXX representative on XX/XX/XXXX. Ditech NEVER responded to our QWR letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. Instead, we received a NOTICE OF SERVICING TRANSFER dated XX/XX/XXXX advising that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was going to be our new servicer effective XX/XX/XXXX. 

Not only did Ditech breach the Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement and underwent dual tracking which is in violation of the California Homeowner Bill of Rights, Ditech also failed to meet the duties of responding to the Qualified Written Request as defined in the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act by ( 1 ) not providing a written response acknowledging receipt of the correspondence within 5 days ; and ( 2 ) not providing a substantive response/making appropriate corrections in the account of the borrower to include any and all credits/conduct and investigation/provide the borrower with a written explanation or clarification which states the reasons the servicer believes the account is correct within 30 days. 

Our loan is currently with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Loan Number XXXX ). We have requested answers as to the discrepancies regarding the misapplication of monies versus amounts owed as well as an explanation as to why our Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement was breached by Ditech. Even though XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has taken over the handling of our mortgage, they maintain the position that they had nothing to do with Ditechs handling of our loan yet they ( 1 ) denied our request for a new Supplement Repayment Plan, ( 2 ) denied our request for a loan modification based on the fact that we did not have enough income and we have too much equity in the property, and ( 3 ) are moving forward with the foreclosure initiated by Ditech while we were involved in a Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement. 

Due to the inconsistent amounts owed, monies paid and not applied to the account, outstanding interests, late fees, Corporate Advance charges, etc., we are unable to pay the {$80000.00} plus arrear amount. Therefore, XXXX XXXX XXXX has recorded a Notice of Default on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Although we became delinquent due to an unforeseen injuries and death, we attempted to make better the situation by aggreging to a Supplement Repayment Plan Agreement in order to avoid foreclosure and become current. Instead, Ditech unlawfully initiated foreclosure proceedings, made various violations pursuant to the California Homeowner Bill of Rights and RESPA, resulting in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX proceeding to foreclose on our home where we have lived in for 19 years and started a family consisting of XXXX daughters. 

Our goal is and has always been to keep our home and continue making payments. We are seeking your assistance in making right the wrongs and coming up with an amicable solution that will allow us to continue to make payments and keep our home.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX at the age of XXXX I was allowed to get a credit card from Navy Federal. 

According to Section 611 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am requesting that you re-investigate those items indicated, and promptly delete any unverifiable, inaccurate, or outdated information from my credit report. 

Also, according to the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure Act of 2009 : ( 8 ) APPLICATIONS FROM UNDERAGE CONSUMERS. ( A ) PROHIBITION ON ISSUANCE.No credit card may be issued to, or open end consumer credit plan established by or on behalf of, a consumer who has not attained the age of 21, unless the consumer has submitted a written application to the card issuer that meets the requirements of subparagraph ( B ). ( B ) APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS.An application to open a credit card account by a consumer who has not attained the age of 21 as of the date of submission of the application shall require ( i ) the signature of a cosigner, including the parent, legal guardian, spouse, or any other individual who has attained the age of 21 having a means to repay debts incurred by the consumer in connection with the account, indicating joint liability for debts incurred by the consumer in connection with the account before the consumer has attained the age of 21 ; or ( ii ) submission by the consumer of financial information, including through an application, indicating an independent means of repaying any obligation arising from the proposed extension of credit in connection with the account. 

I was not 21 years of age when I was duped into having a credit card, I did not have any income, and my parents did not co-sign for me to have a credit card. I filed a dispute with Navy Federal but did not have the issue resolved.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX received FIFTH THIRD BANK adverse letter dated for XX/XX/2022. It stated I was denied due to the inaccurate information received from the consumer reporting agency/agencies : XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 

Pursuant to 15 USC 1602 ( f ), The term credit means the right granted by a creditor to a debtor to defer payment of debt or to incur debt and defer its payment. In regards to 15 USC 1602 ( f ), CREDIT IS MY RIGHT AS A CONSUMER!! 

On XX/XX/2022 I initiated a credit transaction with FIFTH THIRD BANK, where I applied & extended Credit by utilizing my Credit Card, as defined under 15 USC 1602 ( l ), The term credit card means any card, plate, coupon book or other credit device existing for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit, card number ending in XXXX Credit was extended to FIFTH THIRD BANK with my Credit Card, card number ending in XXXX, in return for me obtaining a mortgage loan or better defined as money under 15 USC 1602 ( l ) to purchase my future home with. Unfortunately, FIFTH THIRD BANK has violated my Consumer Right and failed to complete the credit transaction by not granting me the Right to defer payment as defined under 15 USC 1602 ( f ).

In result of this adverse action, FIFTH THIRD BANK has also committed a federal crime by violating 15 USC 1602 ( p ) -The term unauthorized use, as used in section 1643 of this title, means a use of a credit card by a person other than the cardholder who does not have actual, implied, or apparent authority for such use and from which the cardholder receives no benefit. FIFTH THIRD BANK in-fact utilized my Credit Card, card number ending in XXXX, on XX/XX/2022, and XXXX XXXX XXXX, the cardholder- received no benefits from FIFTH THIRD BANK unauthorized use of XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card on said date and credit transaction .

In conclusion, pursuant to 15 USC 1691a ( 3 ) - Activities constituting discrimination, ( 3 ) because the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under this chapter, FIFTH THIRD BANK shall not discriminate against me because I have in good faith exercised MY RIGHT to Credit as defined under 15 USC 1602 ( f ).

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX has breached their fiduciary duty and acted in bad faith. For numerous months, I begged XXXX to conduct a reasonable investigation into the accounts mentioned below. I was told on numerous occasions that the accounts were verified by the creditor. XXXX has gone as far as to say they will no longer investigate this matter. I have reason to believe XXXX had actual knowledge that the following organization induced me into adhesion contracts and was unjustly enriched because of it. I was unaware of any legally binding contract I had with any of the mentioned organizations due to the fact there was no mutual accent. I received no benefit from these credit transactions. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$27000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$25000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$12000.00} XXXX BANK XXXX XXXX {$7400.00} DISCOVERBANK XXXX {$11000.00} XXXX XXXX {$4800.00} I have reason to believe my financial institution targeted me because they knew I wouldnt be able to understand the contents or procedures for opting out of a contract. My nonpublic personal information was used against me under false pretenses to coerce payment on these extensions of credit. I was never explained how to opt out of the disclosure any negative information that would jeopardize my consumer reputation if I didnt adhere to the terms. 

Upon further investigation, I uncovered that I was induced into an unconscionable adhesion contract that I feel would have been uncovered by XXXX if a reasonable investigation would have been conducted. I was told by these organizations that I would be receiving an cardholder agreement and loan disclosures of terms I had to adhere to. I was never given an option to opt out of anything. I would never knowingly agree to terms and conditions that would adversely affect me my right to operate in commerce and force me into peonage. Given the option, I would have chosen another financial institution. The mentioned organizations have engaged in racketeering activity by taking action to enforce these adhesion contracts and XXXX was knowingly complicit in this conspiracy to engage in human trafficking. 

This fraudulently furnished information violates TILA, FCRA, GLBA, the Sherman Antitrust Act, Robinson-Patman Act, Clayton Act , FTC Act, CFPA and RICO Act. In accordance with TILA, the finance charge is the sum of all charges. The above-mentioned financial institution included a provision in their agreements to embezzle my monthly credit balance. I would have never agreed to that provision if I was made aware that it existed. All payments made on this account were a result of threat, duress, and coercion due to undue influence. 

I explicitly disaffirm any alleged contract, whether, implied or explicit, between I and the financial institutions mentioned above. Due to unauthorized use of a credit card due to the above organizations acting in bad faith, XXXX was unjustly enriched. 

I am requesting copies of documentary evidence of the obligors indebtedness to the above-mentioned financial institutions. Until the requested documentation is received, this request for documentation shall be treated as a billing error and an erroneously billed amount under section 1666 of title 15. The above-mentioned creditors may not collect any disputed amount. As a federally protected consumer, who does not need to pay, the creditor can not restrict, accelerate payment, close an account and or make or threaten any adverse reporting to any person about the consumer 's credit standing without resolving the billing error. 

I disaffirm any alleged agreement or provision, whether implied or explicit, with XXXX that allows the furnishing of negative information to nonaffiliated third parties. I would never knowingly consent to the furnishing of any negative information that would jeopardize my consumer credit reputation with other financial institutions.

Sub-issue: Banking errors
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am almost XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX  months ago. My husband took care of most financialmatters in our household. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a phone call from a man I did not know and he demanded in a very stern/angry voice I pay him back his {$9000.00} that was transferred into my Chase bank account in error. He told me to look at my bank account online and I would see the online transfer made to my account. I looked and sure enough there was almost {$15000.00} as my account balance including the {$6000.00} that I had in the account. He starteddemanding that I give him his {$9000.00} or he was going to send somebody to my house ( he knew my address and that I had {$15000.00} in the bank ). He then told me how to get him the money by mailing it to an address in XXXX, Nevada. He wanted his {$9000.00} in cash, I was so scared that I immediately went to my Chase Bank in XXXX XXXX, CA. and got {$9000.00} in cash from a teller. People have asked me if the teller questioned the large amount of cash because there are so many seniors in the area that may have fraudulent activities happening. The teller did not question it. I then went to the post office and mailed the {$9000.00} dollars to XXXX ( I have a post office receiptfor the envelope ). 
I was relieved that it was over until I received a letter from the bank a couple days later indicating my account was overdrawn by {$3000.00}? When I looked at my account it indicated that it was {$3000.00} overdrawn because Chase processed a {$9000.00} an online Debit Return transfer on XX/XX/XXXX. I went to Chase and reported the incident to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, he closed my accountand told me that because I withdrew the money I was responsible for the loss of the {$6000.00} that was in my account plus I owed the bank {$3000.00} for the overdraft. My son XXXX XXXX has been trying to get Chase Fraud group to take responsibility for this fraud because the bank updated my bank account with the {$9000.00}. With my permission he has requested information from the bank such as what bank initiated the original deposit and the credit. Was it a XXXX XXXX or a foreign bank? What internal controls does Chase have in place to ensure a wire is valid before posting it to an account? Why was thereversal processed, we read that once a transfer was made itrarelyis reversed? Did Chase investigate why the reversal was processed? We getno answers!! There is a certain amount of due diligence we expect from the banks to protect an individuals money and when it comes to wire transfers at Chase bank we don't seem to get it.

I went to the FBI and they indicated that there was nothing they could do. If somebody goes into Chase bank and robs it, theFBI is all over it but an individual loses money theFBI does not investigate anything. The Chase Fraud group requested the post office receipt and other information, I gave it to them and haven't heard anything. Now Chase is threatening me that if I don't give themthe overdraft amountby tomorrow they are going to write it off and report it to the credit bureaus and to the IRS as income.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I made a purchase of {$1600.00} from my Chase Business Debit Account to the merchant XXXX. The transaction was successfully processed and the funds were taken from my account. I was supposed to receive delivery of the product on XX/XX/XXXX but then the company informed me that it would take XX/XX/XXXX for the items to be delivered. However even after waiting several months I never received the product. On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted Chase Dispute Department about the {$1600.00} charge and how I did not receive the merchandise I ordered and how the merchandise has passed the expected delivery window. The Chase Claims representative assured me that the issue would be investigated and that I would receive provisional credit until the investigation was completed. A few days later I found out that my claim was denied because I had to report the claim dispute within 60 days of the transaction being posted. However, this is incorrect because the XXXX Chargeback Consumer Disputes guide section 13.1 Merchandise/Service Not Received. clearly states that : " The processing time limit is 120 calendar days from the last day the cardholder expected delivery ( not to exceed 540 days of the original processing date of the transaction ). '' In conclusion, I spent {$1600.00} with the merchant XXXX and never received the product I paid for. Furthermore, the {$1600.00} charge was successfully posted and the money was immediately withdrawn from my Chase Business Account. Furthermore, I contacted Chase Bank, informed them of the dispute and successfully filed a claim with them. Unfortunately, Chase Bank illegitimately declined my dispute claim with the merchant. Chase states that the claim was denied because I did not file the claim within the right timeframe, however, this is incorrect because according to the governing XXXX Chargeback Guidelines I have 120 days from the LAST DAY OF EXPECTED DELIVERY ( not 120 days from the date of the transaction posting ) to file a dispute claim. Now Chase Bank will not allow me to speak to the assigned agent on the claim to rectify this issue. Furthermore, they are not allowing me to reopen the claim or allowing me to see how they arrived at their decision. Its really annoying because I know this claim should have been approved according to Chase and XXXX 's own guidelines on chargebacks and disputes. Its even more irritating that they claim that the dispute was denied properly and within guidelines when the guidelines clearly state otherwise. I think Chase Bank is acting grossly negligent and is denying me of my rights as a consumer.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a business credit card with a promotional 0 % interest rate for 9 months. Card was issued on XX/XX/2019 and email indicated the promotional rate of 0 % was good for 9 months. There was no fine print in the email confirmation I received indicating their terms would require the total outstanding balance of the 8th monthly statement would have to be paid to avoid incurring interest charges. I should have had until the due date of that 9th statement ( XX/XX/2019 ) before any interest was charged. 

However, with the 9th statement on XX/XX/2019 ( less than 9 months from when the card was opened ), the company charged me interest on the ending statement balance. When I called, they advised me that the fine print of the promotional literature I should have received in the mail indicated I had to pay off that balance on or before the due date from the 8th statement, not the 9th ( meaning pay it off by XX/XX/2019 ) which is actually less than 9 months, and that there was no additional grace period. 

I called to get the issue resolved, and the company did agree to credit back the interest charge, but would not correct the grace period end date. 

I've dealt with 0 % interest offers from a number of other credit card companies, and they always offer that interest rate through the due date for the payment due associated with the 9th statement, not the 8th statement.

Sub-issue: Fee problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking institution I currently have a checking account with, JP Morgan Chase, has been charging my account exuberant overdraft fees that put my account minus - {$600.00}. at one point!

I do understand that some of those fees I am responsible for but to blatantly over charge my account up to the point of over drafting it is, honestly, unprofessional to the point of shocking! In addition, to add salt to injury ( so to speak ), I have been paying these fees further straining my finances and was only resolved when I called an agent to ask for additional time to pay down my overdraft account ( - {$600.00}, it was much higher before ), unbeknownst to me that most of that was due to overdraft fees of the bank itself. 

The agent I spoke to was polite and actually reversed 29 fees at {$34.00} each! My account was - {$600.00} before I called and after the reversal of fees my account now sits at {$380.00}. How is this fair business practice when the bank was charging me {$980.00}. in fees alone!? 

Although the issue was eventually resolved and my account is now positive I still feel cheated by the bank I trusted to safeguard my money. This is not fair and, how many other instances and customers is this bank over charging their accounts and simply letting these fees accumulate to outrages amounts that solely benefits the bank itself!? 

Again, please imagine that a bank ; an institution that is designed to serve customers and safeguard their money ends up charging you {$980.00}. in overdraft fees alone. Irregardless of the fact that I didn't manage my account properly it still stands that this type of fee hiking is not acceptable.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2019, Franklin Collection Service ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MS XXXX ) marked a collection on my XXXX and XXXX credit reports, severely damaging my credit without any notice nor proof shown. I NEVER received a single letter from Franklin Collection Services,  and when I called them to validate the debt, they claimed to have sent 3 letters to an address in XX/XX/2019. I have not lived in that address for over THREE years, and there is absolutely no way for me to ever receive this mail. The did not notify me of the debt, nor did they notify me of the collection. 

Further, I then sent a letter on XX/XX/2019, via Certified USPS mail ( Tracking :  XXXX ) to Franklin Collection Services requesting immediate validation of the debt they claim I owe. This debt has never been validated, and I have seen absolutely zero proof of the validity of this debt. 

In my letter, I asked Franklin Collection Services to provide me with this validation of the debt. They have been non-responsive and ignored my letter ( which I confirmed with USPS was delivered on XX/XX/2019 ), and continue to report the collection on my credit report, which is having a highly negative effect on my ability to obtain credit. 

I believe that Franklin Collection Services is using the negative impact of the derogatory remark on my credit against me in an attempt to make me pay them money for the debt that have failed to validate. This is a direct violation of my rights. Moreover, the lack of response and providing validity of this debt they claim I owe, then proceeding to severely damage my personal credit file is in direct violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 { b } and the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 { b }, it is my right to dispute the claim and request validation. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, it is in direct violation to severely damage my credit with a debt that has NOT been validated. 

This collection agency has over 100 complaints with the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) and is clearly operating illegally and/or unethically. Please investigate this issue as soon as possible.

The person I spoke with told me that the auto withdrawal info had not transferred and that letter was an error but not to worry I would not be charged a late fee I could make a payment online for XXXX which I did. A payment of {$2100.00} came out of my checking account on XX/XX/XXXX. This was from the automatic payment I had with XXXX that I was told would NOT occur. On XX/XX/XXXX a second payment came out of my account for {$1800.00}. This was the payment I set up because I was told the other debit would not happen. I spoke with them today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and had them cancel the auto payments that I had set up with XXXX. They said nothing would debit from my account in XXXX because I had ( without my consent ) made two payments in XXXX. Is this legal? An expected {$2100.00} out of my account is more than problematic for me and I'm sure any other people it happened to.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, We previously had a credit card with Capital One in my wife 's name, 'XXXX   '. We had some difficulty and fell behind, then the account went to collections. We received a letter in XX/XX/XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX offering a settlement on behalf of Capital One for account ending in XXXX ( Ref # XXXX ). The original amount of debt is {$1900.00}, but they were offering a settlement in the amount of {$990.00} in 12 monthly payments of {$82.00}. We started making payments in XX/XX/XXXX. Since then we have made three payments and the fourth is currently in the mail. The letter stated at the end of this process they were going to provide a letter stating our debt has been resolved. We have not received any other communication from either XXXX XXXX XXXX or Capital One since we started making payments. 

On XX/XX/XXXX we received a summons from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of Capital One ( File # XXXX ). The Summons and Complaint is seeking the full {$1900.00} minus {$82.00}. Now we are confused. We have been making payments and the checks have been getting cashed or cleared for three months. The fourth payment is in the mail. Suddenly, we receive this summons. There is definitely something deceptive or unfair about this process, either from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or Capital One. 

XXXX we tried to call Capital One, but was routed to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and spoke to a representative from XXXX XXXX XXXX, 'XXXX ' on XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX for File number XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) . We explained our situation and he said he could not provide any legal advice. We let 'XXXX ' know we would like to submit a complaint about this process and the treatment we are receiving. We also asked if maybe a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau may be warranted as well, but 'XXXX ' could not give us any guidance on that. He said he would route our complaint to Capital One right away and he would get back to us on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. He did not call so I tried to contact his office, but was placed on hold and then to a voicemail. I left a message and then went to the CFPB site to file this complaint. 

As a follow up to this, we are submitting our letter as well as a screen capture of the checks in the amount of {$82.00} being cleared by our bank. 

Ideally, we would like this summons and complaint to be cleared, and we would like to continue on the agreement and terms we are currently executing or the debt to be cleared by Capital One. Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Synchrony Bank/XXXX closed my account for my credit card for no reason, reasons I believe are predatory and unfair for all consumers. I have had this credit card for only 5 months. I paid it on time each month IN FULL. I have never held a balance. I went to XXXX XXXX and come to find out my card was closed for no reason. I had recently bought a car because I was in a severe accident. I can not believe my account was closed without warrant. What makes the matter worse is there was no communication, either by phone ; email or USPS advising me of my cards status. 

I am beyond disappointed that someone can make payments on time and use the card responsibly and a company can be so predatory in its lending practices that they close the account because my score dropped a few points. I understand they can probably close an account at any time, however, why do so if the open account does not harm your bottom line and there is no negative information on the established account to otherwise warrant a closing of an account? It makes you wonder what kickback is Synchrony Bank getting out of the initial account opening, that they would close an account only 3-4 months later? An account that has established positive everything? WITHOUT even considering the positive account history and on time payments. Not only does this affect ones utilization ratio, which influences my score, Synchrony Bank has now closed a newly established account causing even more of a negative impact to my credit rating. In addition, after they closed the account after 3 months, they are still reporting information to all credit bureaus on my behalf and have a derogatory remark, Closed by grantor I want my account restored and credit repaired. Any corporation, who misuses consumers trust to maintain its business, shouldnt be allowed to operate and continue to practice predatory lending. They too should be held to the same fair lending practices as any other bank.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: DEBT BUYER HAS PLACED A DEBT ON MY CREDIT REPORTS THAT I DO NOT OWE.

Guaranteed Rate, Inc. ( " GR '' ) is my mortgage lender for the pending purchase of a house. This complaint involves the following GR employees XXXX XXXX ( VP of Mortgage Lending ) ( " XXXX '' ), XXXX XXXX ( Loan Coordinator ) ( " XXXX '' ), and XXXX XXXX ( " XXXX '' ) ( Production Manager ). 

After a number of other mishaps during the pre-closing process, we were first told that XXXX finally submitted our application to the real lender this past Friday ( XX/XX/XXXX ). We were scheduled to close today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). Despite assuring us on Friday that we were " on track '' to close on time, XXXX and XXXX failed to disclose of mistakes delaying our close. They then failed to answer direct questions -- on Friday, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday -- about when documents were sent so that we could evaluated whether closing needed to be moved and seek and extension from the sellers. Finally, at XXXX Wednesday XXXX -- hours before we were scheduled to close -- XXXX told me via a phone call that XXXX had mistakenly sent documentation to XXXX rather than the investor, XXXX XXXX, and that it lead to the delay. She then promised to provide me details in writing by the next morning so that I could assuage the sellers ' concerns and obtain an extension. 

On Thursday ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I received a call from XXXX informing me that the information provided by XXXX -- which I had shared with the sellers as we tried to work towards delaying the closing at the last minute -- was incorrect. In fact, no information had been sent to XXXX. Rather, when the XXXX XXXX underwriter had returned the file to GR on XX/XX/XXXX, it had done so with a direction that the property appraisal be sent to collateral underwriting. GR ignored that direction until it finally sent the appraisal over to collateral review on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX. This was not disclosed to us until my call with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX. 

On that same call, XXXX assured me that there would only be a 3-4 hour turnaround once approval from XXXX XXXX was received because our filed would be in " rush '' protocol for GR. Coincidentally, XXXX XXXX sent over approval by collateral review just after our call, around XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX left me a voicemail that afternoon indicating they had received approval and would " work on a closing for tomorrow on a rush. '' Despite those promises, as of XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX the file is still " in line '' to be reviewed by underwriting. The sellers are now threatening not to extend the contract. XXXX is backtracking on his promises yesterday, saying in a XX/XX/XXXX XXXX e-mail to me that " I never once said we were closing today. '' GR is refusing to take accountability, refusing to fix the problem, and refusing to make amends for their errors.
