Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
We have a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX issued by American Express, which has an annual fee of {$550.00} plus {$200.00} for my wife 's card. One of the purported benefits for the card is a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which claims to be " valid for one round-trip First Class, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Select or Main Cabin Companion ticket with the payment of applicable taxes and fees detailed below and the purchase of certain adult round-trip fares on published routings within the 48 contiguous United States. '' This certificate offer is fraudulent.

The complete terms and conditions of the certificate are below. The certificate terms and conditions state that tickets are available in I and Z classes of service for First Class travel, only available in P, A an G classes of service for Premium Select, only available in W, S class for XXXX XXXX XXXX, and only available in L, U, T, X, V classes of service for Main Cabin travel. We tried to book flights on every day of a month that showed available seats in these classes of service but were told by XXXX that they were sold out, even though XXXX 's website specifically shows that seats were available in the listed classes of service. In fact, the flights we were looking to book are essentially empty. 

We called XXXX and American Express and told them we were not being allowed to redeem our certificate in accordance with the terms and conditions. Neither XXXX nor American Express resolved the issue. These certificates essentially are worthless and their promotion in connection with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is fraudulent. It appears that there have been dozens of consumer complaints about the fraudulent promotion associated with these certificates. 

The complete terms and conditions of the card are : Eligibility : Eligible on XXXX, XXXX XXXX carrier and XXXX XXXX flights only ( excludes all other XXXX codeshare flights ). Companion certificate is valid for one round-trip First-Class, Delta Comfort+ or Main Cabin companion ticket with the purchase of certain adult round-trip fares on published routings within the 48 contiguous United States. Each year, the XXXX XXXX will be made available for redemption on XXXX in your renewal month. Companion ticket requires payment of applicable government imposed taxes and fees which vary and depend upon the number of flight segments included in the itinerary and are no more than {$75.00} for roundtrip domestic flights ( for itineraries with up to four flight segments ). Reservations are only available at XXXX. Companion certificate terms and conditions may vary each year of Card Membership. Additional restrictions apply. 
Restrictions : Redemption is available only on XXXX. The certificate can not be combined with another offer or discount including, but not limited to, web fares, sale fares and eCoupons. Both passengers must be booked at the same time, in the same class of service and in the same record. Tickets are only available in I and Z classes of service for First Class travel, only available in P, A an G classes of service for Premium Select, only available in W, S class for XXXX XXXX XXXX, and only available in L, U, T, X, V classes of service for Main Cabin travel and may not be available on all flights or markets. Companion Certificates are eligible for XXXX Complimentary Upgrades which are subject to availability and may not be eligible on all flights. Medallion Members traveling with one companion will be eligible for Complimentary Upgrades to both First Class and XXXX XXXX based on the status of the higher-tiered Member, as long as the companion is a XXXX  Member, XXXX  Member or partner airline elite member, traveling in the same reservation. Most fares require an advance purchase of up to 14 days, a XXXX night minimum stay and a XXXX maximum stay. All fare rules, restrictions, advance purchase requirements, and availability are per rule of Primary Ticket fare purchased. Companion tickets are not transferable. Primary Ticket and Companion ticket must be purchased with your XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Both passengers must be booked on the same flights and dates, at the same time. Travel for Companion certificate must be booked and completed by the date on the front of certificate. Validity is not based on calendar year. Primary ticket will accrue miles. Companion ticket will not accrue miles. Tickets are eligible for XXXX or XXXX XXXX Certificates but not eligible for mileage upgrades. XXXX XXXX is void if reproduced, altered, counterfeited, obtained or used improperly, or where prohibited by law. XXXX XXXX has no value except when redeemed in accordance with all terms and conditions of this offer. XXXX XXXX is for new purchases only and can not be applied to the cost of miscellaneous charge orders or previously issued tickets. XXXX XXXX will be deemed fully used once tickets have been issued and will not be returned or replaced. XXXX XXXX is the property of XXXX XXXX XXXX and must be surrendered or returned upon request. Fares, fees, schedules, offers and rules are subject to change without notice. Terms and conditions of this offer are as written and can not be altered, modified or waived unless authorized by a corporate officer of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX All Delta XXXX program rules apply. To review the rules, please visit delta.com/memberguide, opens in new tab. 
Routing/Blackout Dates : Stopovers, open jaws, and circle trips are not permitted. Blackout dates subject to the rules of the primary ticket fare purchased. 
Taxes/Fees : The fare for Companion tickets includes government imposed taxes and fees of no more than {$75.00} for roundtrip domestic flights ( for itineraries with up to XXXX flight segments ). Taxes and fees depend on the itinerary. Basic Card Members ( not Additional Card Members ) with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are eligible to receive the first checked bag fee waiver on XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX flights. {$40.00} fee for second checked bag. These allowances are subject to size/weight limits. Contact a XXXX agent or visit delta.com for details. Subject to the fare rules of the primary ticket, the value of the primary ticket and any fare difference, may be applied to future travel. Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently sold a house that was under mortgage with Wells Fargo. At the time of the sale, my remaining mortgage was approximately $ XXXX from an original loan balance of $ XXXX ( 65 % XXXX ). Despite the fact that my mortgage had fallen below the value of 78 % XXXX Wells Fargo continued to charge XXXX XXXX  XXXX up to and through the date of the sale of the property. Wells Fargo had sent us multiple documents identifying the approximate value of our property with the most recent one showing a value over $ XXXX. 

Wells Fargo has sent me letters throughout the multiple years that I have had my mortage through them informing me that our PMI was subject to cancellation once the value had reached 80 % ( by request -- which we had done and were denied ) or automatically at 78 % ( which was never completed by Wells Fargo ). 

Due to Wells Fargo 's lack of consistent controls I have experienced potential financial harm as payments were continually applied to PMI that should have gone towards principle and that would have reduced the total amount of interest that the bank collected over the course of my loan. 

PMI is generally applied to lower income families as a method to protect the bank from financial harm upon default by a borrower. The lack of Wells Fargo detective and preventative controls may be causing harm to a large quantity of consumers, many of which may experience financial hardship as a result.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
TODAYS DATE:XX/XX/2019 ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT COMMONWEALTH FINANCIAL   XXXX Your company have violated FCRA 615 ( f ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( f ) ) ( f ) Prohibition on sale or transfer of debt caused by identity theft You have not responded to my request to provide me with an investigation report. 
I need this resolve, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence ( 1 ) In general No person ( company ) shall sell, transfer for consideration, or place for collection a debt that such person has been notified under section 1681c-2 of this title has resulted from identity theft.

( 2 ) Applicability The prohibitions of this subsection shall apply to all persons collecting a debt described in paragraph ( 1 ) after the date of a notification under paragraph ( 1 ).

( 3 ) Rule of construction Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prohibit -- ( A ) The repurchase of a debt in any case in which the assignee of the debt requires such repurchase because the debt has resulted from identity theft ; ( B ) the securitization of a debt or the pledging of a portfolio of debt as collateral in connection with a borrowing ; or ( C ) the transfer of debt as a result of a merger, acquisition, purchase and assumption transaction, or transfer of substantially all of the assets of an entity. 
A person that furnishes information to any consumer reporting agency shall have in place reasonable procedures to respond to any notification that it receives from a consumer reporting agency under section 1681c-2 of this title relating to information resulting from identity theft, to prevent that person from refurnishing such blocked information.

Carrington Mortgage Services has employed accounting practices that maximize the interest accrued on my mortgage rather than paying down my principal. I intentionally pay extra every month in order to minimize the interest I am paying, but Carrington 's policies and practices will not allow this by default. 

This mortgage was originated in XX/XX/XXXX and has always been current and in good standing. 

Details : Carrington Mortgage Services purchased my mortgage from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Since then I have made 3 payments of {$3000.00} each on XX/XX/XXXX ( due XX/XX/XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX ( due XXXX   XXXX ), and XXXX XXXX ( due XX/XX/XXXX ). Each of the {$3000.00} payments sent to Carrington included ~ {$1100.00} excess funds which should have been applied to my principal when each of the payments were received.

However, Carrington did not apply the funds as expected. 
( 1 ) for the XX/XX/XXXX payment, Carrington applied the funds as expected with excess payments being applied to principal. However, this payment was reversed and reapplied on XX/XX/XXXX with the excess payment ( {$1100.00} ) being swept into " unapplied funds ''. Carrington only applied the MINIMUM payment to my principal for the bill due XX/XX/XXXX. 
( 2 ) for the XX/XX/XXXX payment, Carrington also only applied the MINIMUM payment to my principal for the bill due XX/XX/XXXX. The excess payment ( ~ {$1100.00} ) was swept into " unapplied funds ''. OnXX/XX/XXXX, the balance in " unapplied funds '' was then used to pay the mortgage bill due XX/XX/XXXX. Again, the MINIMUM payment to principal was made. 
( 3 ) for the XX/XX/XXXXpayment, Carrington swept the entire payment to " unapplied funds ''.

Under my former lender, my principal decreased by ~ {$1200.00} per month but under Carringto
n they are only allowing my principal to decrease by {$450.00} per month. 

I have called Carrington weekly to try and understand the situation. Carrington has been able to explain their practices, which are the root cause of this problem. The only solution that Carrington has to offer is to watch the account and then call them if I do not agree with how they have applied my payments. 

It is clear that Carrington is applying my payments in a manner to maximize the interest accruing on the account while leaving my extra payments in a non-interest-bearing " unapplied funds '' sub-account. Basically, I get no value from sending extra principal payments and they get all reward.

I have explained what has happened so far and gave the Claim number for reference asking them to refund my money. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
My Name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I live at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL. 

On XX/XX/2022 I was provided what I believed to be accurate wire instructions intended for use in the sending of closing costs for the purchase of my new home. I am aware closing costs are typically wired at closing, however with Hurrican Ian impacting my town on the day I recieved these instructions, I believed there to be an urgency in getting the money sent ahead of the storm. It should be noted, my scheduled closing date was Friday, XX/XX/2022. 

I initiated a wire transfer in the amount of {$15000.00} on Wednesday, XX/XX/2022 via XXXX Online Banking, around XXXX XXXX. I promptly lost power, data and cellular service as a result of the storm. 

On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX I was able to recieve an email from what I believed to be my closing agent asking where the funds were. I called my closing agent directly and was informed the instructions had not been sent by them. I promptly engaged XXXXXXXX XXXX and was advised that the team I needed ( Wire Investigations Team ) could only be contacted via the Secure Message Center ( SMC ) in XXXX Online Banking. Based on this information, I reached out to said team via the XXXX. 

On Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX, I recieved a response from the XXXX XXXX Investigations Team ( via the XXXX ) confirming the details of the wire and requesting my conscent to recall that wire. My conscent was provided. 

On Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX, I recieved a follow up message from the same team via the XXXX stating that the recieving bank ( Navy Federal Credit Union ) had flagged the transfer as suspicious and that the funds had not yet been released to the recipient account. Furthermore, the XXXX XXXX Investigations Representative advised that I could visit a local banking center and work with a Banking Center Manager to submit a Hold Harmless Letter ( HHL ) to Navy Federal Credit Union so that the funds could be returned. 

As this was recieved after business hours, I set out to visit a local branch on Friday XX/XX/XXXX. The Banking Center Manager was not familiar with the requested HHL and spent the next 3 hours on the phone with her internal support teams. Eventually she was able to reach a teammate that was familiar with the HHL. This teammate advised that the form was no longer used HHLs at XXXX and when it was in use, its intent was to cover bank employee errors and not intended for client use. 

In an attempt to assist, the XXXX Banking Center Manager reached out to Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ) on an internal line. She explained the situation to a representative of NFCU - that the wire was submitted via fraudulent means, that she had issued a recall and that the funds should be returned to my account. The representative from NFCU advised they would be unable to return the funds without an HHL, to which the XXXX representative advised that her institution no longer supported/issued these forms. NFCU advised there was no plan b, and when asked what would happen to the funds, the NFCU representative advised they were not at liberty to disclose nor should I ( as the client ) have been made aware that the funds were not yet released. 

The XXXX Banking Center Manager apologized profusely for the situation and filed a formal complaint on my behalf. 

On XX/XX/2022 My legal counsel sent a letter to NFCU requesting the immediate return of the funds. 

To date NFCU has not replied to the letter from my attorney. 

In the interim I attempted to engage XXXX 's Wire Investigations Team via the Secure Message Center. My initial note was responded to within XXXX hours. I have engage them now 3 times requesting an update and have each time recieved automated responses advising me that a response would be recieved within XXXX business days. 

My complaint is two-fold. 

Complaint One : The fact that XXXX Bank 's Wire Investigations Team is only availible via Secure Message Center is unacceptable. When it comes to fraudulent wire transfers, or any fradulent activity for that matter, all actions to investigate and potentially recall funds is time sensitive. Clients should not have to submit a message, recieve an auto response and wait XXXX hours ( or XXXX business days ) to be contacted by a representative. Submitting a claim against fraudulent activity is my right as a client, and XXXX limiting my ability to file a claim in a timely manner is unacceptable. 

Complaint 2 : Navy Federal Credit Union has now been advised by myself, my banking institution and my attorney that the transfer was sent by fraudulent means and should be returned to my account. NFCU themselves flagged the transaction as suspicious. The fact that the funds have not been returned to my account is not acceptable
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Sub-issue: Cashing a check
Consumer complaint narrative:
I got a {$2800.00} dollar check from a girl named XXXX XXXX that I met on a XXXX XXXX XXXX who was going to take over my apartment lease. I also got a photo of her Drivers License so she could prove she was real. It was from XXXX XXXX XXXX and looked like a legit check from the outside. She said the money was from her company to accommodate housing and moving fees. She said she need {$1800.00} to pay off the movers and the rest would be used for the first months rent. She asked if I could deposit the check and use part of that money to pay the movers for her as she wasnt able to get XXXX separate checks for me and the movers. I deposited the check and saw the money in my account. However, I still called WellsFargo and asked them in the money was in my account and ready to use. They confirmed they saw the deposit and told me everything was fine. They gave me now warning about the check possibly bouncing. I went ahead and paid the movers through XXXX. A few days later, all the money from the check was removed from my account. I could also no longer contact XXXX. I called WellsFargo and they said it was a bad check and took no responsibility for the initial call when they confirmed the money was in my account. If they had given me the slightest warning that once the money is in, it can be taken out, I would have never sent the money. This means that since it was a bad check, I paid the movers {$1800.00} dollars of my own money. I have been taking to WellsFargo for months trying to get the money back as it was sent thru XXXX, which is ran by them. However, after filing claim after claim, they told me it wasn't possible because I knowingly sent the money. I have so much proof that this girl was a scam and all I asked is if they look into the account this money was sent to but they won't even do that. Now, they are saying there is no way I can get my money back. 

There are so many incidents of scammers using XXXX to get money from people. I was as careful as I could be and trusted my bank which now I realized is where the problem was. I just want WellsFargo to be held accountable for not giving the proper information to their customers and not helping them when dealing with scams.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/19 I was at a restaurant in XXXX with a co-worker. We were given a bill of XXXX XXXX ( approximately {$45.00} USD ). We decided to split the bill between the two of us and we gave the waitress both of our cards with instructions to split the bill in half and charge each card appropriately. As soon as she swiped our cards, both of our phones alerted us to a possible fraudulent charge via our mobile banking apps. As soon as I received this alert, the app asked me if this charge was legitimate. I pressed " NO '', which I assumed declined the charge. 

The waitress than came back with my Bank of America card and a receipt that showed a charge of XXXX XXXX ( approximately {$490.00} USD ). I refused to sign the credit card receipt and informed her I understood this to be a scam. I then paid her {$60.00} for the bill in US currency and left the restaurant. 

My co-worker 's XXXX XXXX app also alerted him to a potential fraudulent charge and he was not charged by XXXX. 

I followed up with Bank of America the next day and confirmed it was a fraudulent charge. They canceled my card and sent me a new one. 

On XX/XX/19 I was contacted by Bank of America and told that because it as a " verified chip transaction '' they were probably going to decline my fraud dispute and charge my card the {$490.00} that was fraudulently charged. I again explained the events to the transaction to the Bank of America agent I spoke to agreed it sounds like a legitimate fraud claim. 

The next day, XX/XX/19 I received a letter from Bank of America verifying they did in fact decline the fraud claim and charged my account the amount of {$490.00}. The letter states that I either signed the receipt or supplied my pin at the time of the transaction. In fact I did not sign a receipt or supply a pin number. 

I contacted Bank of America regarding the decision and was told they would forward my case to the billing dispute department. In my opinion, and the opinion of the Bank of America agent I spoke with, this is a clear case of fraud but they refuse to acknowledge.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Sub-issue: Non-sufficient funds and associated fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
I did a mobile deposit on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$5000.00}. It was a check from my Home Equity Line of Credit from XXXX XXXX that I was depositing in my Checking account for credit consolidation/ Home Improvement. 
I went in the Bank on XX/XX/XXXX and deposited a check in the amount of {$10000.00}. I gave this check directly to the teller. It was a check from my Home Equity Line of Credit from XXXX XXXX that I was depositing in my Checking account for credit consolidation The Teller informed me ( it was Friday ) that the funds would be available on Sunday the XXXX. I told her that is great since I was using it to pay off a credit card on Tuesday the XXXX I made the payment on the XXXX and everything looked like it was available in my bank account. 
On Thursday XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter stating that Wells Fargo received a debit from XXXX ( a credit card that I have paid many times via my checking account ) will not be paid because of insufficient funds and possible fraud. 
I called their customer service and after escalating it to a manager. I was told that the checks were not being paid and they were not sure about the funds being available. I asked her to contact XXXX XXXX and she informed me that this isn't how it works. She then told me that I need to contact XXXX XXXX because XXXX did NOT pay out the checks. I gave her the benefit of the doubt and contacted XXXX XXXX. They informed me that both checks were cashed ; on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. So not only were they cashed by Wells Fargo and should be readily available for me to use as per the teller at the XXXX XXXX  Wells Fargo but as of XX/XX/XXXX ( and checked again on the XXXX and XXXX ). 
I contacted the Branch Manager of Wells Fargo XXXXXXXX XXXX  and told him that I was not happy with this and that I contacted XXXX XXXX and that the funds were cashed already by Wells Fargo. I was paying interest on the Home Equity Line of Credit and that we were cashed XXXX  days ago and XXXX days ago and that I wanted to know WHERE the money was. He informed me that there is nothing he could do and that he will put in a report to have this reviewed by upper management or a department that handles this. He was rude and told me that the funds were being held due to Regulation CC. I was not familiar with this and did some research on this law and from what I was reading ; Regulation CC was created to protect the consumer. Basically checks were now able to be cashed electronically oppose to needing the hard copy check so that it would save time. This seemed almost Ironic that he mentioned this and that the funds were indeed cashed and they were not releasing the funds. 
I contacted XXXX XXXX and both the teller and the branch manager told me that Wells Fargo can contact them to verify the funds are available and have been cashed. The Branch Manager of Wells Fargo told me that he won't do this and that there is nothing he can do to help. 
I called Wells Fargo Customer Service AGAIN and was talking to a much nicer representative. She was not able to help but she did tell me that the check was being held due to potential fraud. So now I have 3 different reasons given to me from Wells Fargo. 
I am not sure why it is considered or being held because of Fraud. I am not a new customer. I never had any issues with my bank account in the past. I checked my activity in my wells fargo accounts and everything seemed normal activity. 
So bottom line that I wrote a check from my Home Equity Line of Credit and then paid out a credit card that I have paid many times I have checked my account today XX/XX/XXXX and the funds are reflecting that they were in my account on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX which is a lie. My XXXX XXXX payment that was bounced was resubmitted by Wells Fargo and did clear. But this was a disaster and handled terribly by Wells Fargo and I am annoyed that I had to go thru all of this. What were they doing with the {$15000.00} during that time? Why was it being held? I got 3 different reasons for the hold up. 
I am closing my account with Wells Fargo in the near future because of this incident. Because I feel like true fraudulent activity that was being done was due to Wells Fargo and that they were holding my money hostage.

When I called, I was told that a credit card company by the name of Midland Credit initiated the action and that I should have received a summons notifying me that I was being sued for {$1900.00}. I told her that I have never received any summons by mail or any other method. She then read off my address and said that the summons should have been sent via Certified Mail. While my address was correct, I again repeated that I had not received any communications from anyone, particularly not from a court and that I had not heard from Midland Credit for easily two years. I shared that the debt seemed accurate ( although I would have to check my records ) but that I would need to confirm. I also stated that the action left me in dire straits as both my husband and I have significant health issues ( he is on XXXX  and is XXXX XXXX ) and this " hold '' resulted in us having no money to access for food or medications. She told me that there was no way that the hold could be released and that it could take several business days to be released. She also shared that it was currently a " one time  hold '' and that any expected deposits to that account would be free for my use. She gave me a phone number to contact ( XXXX ) and told me to contact Midland in an effort to resolve the issue. She also gave me what she thought would be the case number I should reference when I call. I wrote to Midland online but have not heard back yet.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount

A debt of {$100.00} dollars for services performed by XXXX XXXX XXXX was referred over to CONTINENTAL CREDIT CONTROL. CONTINENTAL CREDIT CONTROL has been trying to collect on the debt and adding interest charges to the amount. I confirmed with XXXX XXXX XXXX and they informed me that they do not collect interest on unpaid balances nor does any of their documentation state that unpaid balances are subject to interest fees. 
As a general rule, the addition of any interest, services fees, collection costs or other expenses incidental to the original debt is permitted when such amount is expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 15 U.S.C. 1692f ( 1 ) [ 808 ( 1 ) ].

In this case, it was not authorized by any agreement.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2019 I applied for a Home Equity Line of Credit with Chase Bank and was given a loan number. The process got underway and over the next several weeks I provided all the documents required for the approval process to move forward. I provided several years of paycheck stubs, W-2 's for the last 2 or 3 years, last 2-3 years of official Tax returns as well as homeowners insurance, property tax statements, investment property documents among many other things. All along the same time my Tax Attorney & Tax Accountant ( CPA ) provided me guidance and gave me no reason why I would not be approved for a HELOC. The home was appraised at over {$630000.00} and I owe just over {$310000.00} on the home to the bank which gives me just at 50 % equity in my property. I was approved by Chase for {$180000.00} HELOC which is roughly what was allowed by lending guidelines for me to get as a loan. Long story short is that I was contacted by the bank on XX/XX/2019 and was told by XXXX that they could not extend me a HELOC due to my income to debt ratio. I make about {$130000.00} per year in income from my employer, have about {$8000.00} in rental income each year and have equity in my home as well as all my other investment properties are completely debt free. I have no other debts, no credit card debt, no automobile loans at all and have a FICO credit score of XXXX. When XXXX contacted me about this and gave me the news that Chase could not extend me a loan ; I pushed back and disagreed with the decision. I pushed back even further and told her that if Chase could not extend me a loan then I needed Chase to send me a letter stating such and why as well as send me all the paperwork that went into the decision as to why I was being denied the loan. I then got a call from Chase today XX/XX/2019 where they further explained their decision but after further review they were going to extend me a credit line of {$28000.00} or so. I find this really hard to believe that with my credit score & equity in home that the bank can not provide me access to my own equity in my home. I believe I have been deceived by Chase Bank as their own employees can not agree on what I qualify for by changing their position after I pushed back at the initial decline of credit. I have not received a loan decline letter yet but should receive this shortly. I am not sure if why they would not loan someone with great income, impeccable credit score and no debt other than my primary residence a loan but something is not right about this. Is it because I am a Veteran, is it because of my age, I don't meet their " quota ''? I plan on finding out the answer and will not pursue this matter to the fullest extent of the law and will spend money to prove it to myself or them as to who is right or wrong.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I received a notification that my credit score went down by two points. Upon my investigation I noticed a reason for the decline in score was because a balance on one of my installment loans increased by XXXX dollars. I proceeded to contact the finance company to inquire what was the reason for the increase. The finance company had no knowledge of a XXXX dollar increase and stated the balance the credit bureau was reporting was not accurate. 
I filed a dispute with XXXX XXXX credit bureau. The reason for dispute was in accurate balance. I gave a brief description as to why I was disputing the balance. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I received another notification stating that this dispute had been satisfied after reviewing the results I noticed that my credit score was now lowered by three points. 
When I seen what was the factor for lowering my credit score it was because they deleted and removed the disputed account from my file. I am immediately contacted XXXX XXXX and spoke to a customer service representative by the name of XXXX. 
XXXX informed me that the report was removed at the request of the creditor. 
I then spoke to a supervisor by the name of XXXX from XXXX XXXX who stated that they removed the account from my file because it was being disputed. I then asked him to please inform me where on the XXXX XXXX website is there a legal disclaimer stating that they have the authority to delete or remove a active account from a consumer file. He stated there is no such disclaimer and they removed it because I disputed it. I proceeded to inform him that my dispute was not to remove the account but it was for them to reach out to the creditor to get a accurate balance. I asked him to provide me with verification of proof that the creditor authorized him to remove my account from my file he stated there was no verification that he could provide me with. I went on to explain to him that they could not just remove a file without any authorization. I proceeded to inform XXXX XXXX that I would be filing a complaint with the fair credit Act, And I will also be seeking an attorney. 
After my conversation with XXXX XXXX I spoke to the creditor, Personal finance company. I spoke with XXXX the branch manager. I informed him of the situation and what occurred with my report and XXXX XXXX. 
Per XXXX they can not reinstate my account with XXXX XXXX. He directed me to file another dispute with XXXX XXXX informing them that my personal finance company  account was not being reported with their bureau. 

After I completed my conversation with the finance company I proceeded to contact the fair credit act too log an official complaint. 
I would like to add an addition to this, XXXX XXXX has consistently provided inaccurate balances on my accounts that are being reported with their bureau. 

Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX-XXXX-XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I live in XXXX, Florida and we were hit by hurricane Irma on XX/XX/XXXX. I had to make a costly evacuation to northern Florida to evade the storm. I suffered significant damage to my property and was unable to work for a month due to the aftermath of the storm. 

I received an email from my lender, Ditech Financial LLC which I still have, stating that they would be offering assistance to those affected by this storm. Specifically, as well as other kinds of assistance, they offered repayment plans and forbearances for up to 6 months. 

I immediately contacted them and provided all the paper work they required. They verbally said I was approved for a forbearance and would provide the necessary documents to conclude it. 

By this time I had not paid my mortgage for 4 months ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ) for a total for slightly over {$10000.00}. I began to pay my mortgage in XX/XX/XXXX when I was told to do so. 

I was led to believe that this would be a forbearance but to my dismay it turned out to be a subordinate mortgage funded by FHA. I only realized this when I went to refinance my existing mortgage with Ditech, and they turned me down because of poor performance on my loan. The problem is that Ditech reported my mortgage payments late to FHA which was inaccurate. 

I can no longer get an FHA loan due to their deception and inaccurate reporting. My credit report shows no delinquent or missed payments to this lender which makes this more frustrating.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Sub-issue: Fee problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2019 I noticed a fee charged to my account for a XXXX charge of {$48.00}. I was confused because my balance left was {$40.00}, and after charging me. I first spoke to an agent named XXXX who was extremely condescending who explained to me because the card authorization made my available balance negative. I was then transferred to a Manager named XXXX. 

The issue stands here. I was charged an overdraft fee because of a pending authorization which was a mistake by the vendor and has not posted. So I was charged an overdraft fee based on my available balance and then I would be charged another overdraft tomorrow when this authorization posts. 

I spoke with XXXX extensively and he let me know that I would be charged fees based on my available balance availability even if a transaction never posts. Meaning, that if an authorization was a mistake and the vendor never collects Bank of America will leave that fee on my account. I found 5 fees like that in XXXX. I found multiple other fees like that in the past 6 months. Where Bank of America charged me overdraft fees, for authorizations and then when that authorization posts. 

I then went to page 10 of my client disclosure packet. None of these parameters were documented in that packet at all. Nothing about being charged fees based on available balance. It only said balance. Nothing about being charged for an authorized item and then again when that same item posts. There are already {$240.00} in fees including the one for XXXX which will post tomorrow. I calculated another {$700.00} in fees the last 6 months using this abusive tactic. 

I went into a deep dive in managing my account in order to avoid this issue. I would like all my fees reversed. I would like a letter of apology for this abusive behavior. I want my account to go without any banking fees for the next 6 months as a show of good faith, that I will not be taken advantage of again. 

I also want Bank of America to make full disclosure of these fee practices in the client disclosure booklet. Because even when I read it to been, he said it agreed with him. But the booklet makes no distinction between the two balance and available balance. Nor states we can be charged two times for one transaction. 

I was even told I wasn't charged for my transaction, but was charged because of my available balance. This is convoluted and seems like an abusive ploy to get fees.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2019 my American Express Blue card was closed. Shortly after it was closed by American Express ; about 2-3 months after it was closed I begin receiving called from a debt collector stating that American Express had turned over the debt to them. I amount stated was several thousands more than my authorized charges. I immediately did two things- I notified the debt collector that the debt was not mine and that the amount reported was higher than any amount I ever used. I suspected fraud. I notified them both verbally and a couple days later in writing. I further sent them a debt validation letter per the Fair Debt Practices Act formally requesting that the collector validates the debt and clearly stating my dispute of this debt. Additionally that same day I contacted American Express and communicated the same thing to them. I was told that they no longer had the account and that I should only communicate with the debt collector to resolve it. After a few months of waiting on the debt collector, I received another call from the same debt collector demanding payment. I asserted again that I had previously sent a debt validation letter ( the amount that was claimed was and is still in dispute ). After speaking with a supervisor I was informed that American Express had not yet responded to their request in order to provide me the information as required by law. I was further told that they were going to send the debt back to American Express and I would not receive any more calls or letters from them. Per their word, I never heard from that debt collector again. However, about five months later a different debt collector hired by American Express began contacting me. I again informed them verbally and by mail within the required 30 days that the amount of debt was incorrect and I sent them a formal debt validation letter per the Fair Debt Practices Act formally requesting that the collector validates the debt and clearly stating my dispute of this debt. Again, I heard nothing for several weeks. I again called American Express who again said that they no longer had the debt and that I needed to discuss my account with the debt collector. After several weeks I called the debt collector and was told similar to the first debt collector that American Express had not responded to their request and they had nothing to provide me. Apparently that debt collector sent the account back to American Express. I never heard from them again. Sadly this process would happen once more ( now for the third time with again a different debt collector ). Again, the same request and again American Express did not respond to apparently the debt collector they hired to collect on this debt that was not mine. After the third debt collector sent the debt back to American Express I heard nothing else from any additional debt collectors hired by American Express, nor did I hear from American Express in over a year.

American Express has reported to all three major credit reporting agencies this debt, in spite of knowing for several years that I disputed the debt due to fraud. American Express had refused to comply with federal laws governing debt reporting and fraud investigation request by a consumer. Instead American Express had used three different debt collection agencies to try and ignore the requirements of the Fair Debt Collection Act. The have bluntly violated the requirements by hopping from debt collector to debt collector knowing full well that the debt is not mine, and making no attempt to follow the requirements of the FDCA. I am asking that a full investigation into their blatant violation and disregard of the Fair Debt Collection Act, be opened. As of todays date American Express still has not opened a fraud investigation, nor communicated the results of this fraud, and in spite of four requests for validation of the debt- choose to ignore all three and instead hop from debt collector to debt collector instead of complying with FDCA .

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Card opened as result of identity theft or fraud
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Fl, XXXX Portfolio Recovery Associates XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX Bank Dear Sir or Madam : I am the victim of identity theft. I recently learned that someone used my personal information to open an account and make purchases with XXXX XXXX. This debt is not mine. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, I request that you stop collection proceedings against me and cease communications with me about this debt, except to comply with section XXXX15 ( g ) ( 2 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as described below. I further request, pursuant to section 615 ( g ) ( 1 ) of the FCRA, that you notify XXXX XXXX that the debt is the result of identity theft. 

I Never opened a credit card with XXXX  XXXX, and never will. My personal information was used to obtain credit in my name, which I am not responsible for. An identity theft report will be included. Also a police report is in the process of being filed in regards to this matter. 

Enclosed is a copy of the Notice to Furnishers of Information issued by the Federal Trade Commission, which details your responsibilities under the FCRA as an information furnisher to credit reporting agencies. The Notice also specifies your responsibilities when a credit reporting agency notifies you under section 605B of the FCRA that information you provided to it may be the result of identity theft. 

Section 615 ( g ) ( 2 ) of the FCRA requires debt collectors to provide identity theft victims with documentation about an account if the victim asks for it. Please provide me with the following documents related to this account : 1. Application records or screen prints of Internet/phone applications 2. Statements or invoices 3. Payment/charge slips 4. Investigators summary 5. Delivery addresses 6. All records of phone numbers used to activate or access the account 7. Signatures on applications and accounts 8. Any other documents or records associated with the account Please send me a letter detailing the actions you have taken to : 1. notify the original creditor that the debt is the result of identity theft ; 2. stop collection proceedings against me ; 3. cease reporting this information to the credit reporting agencies ; 4. provide me with the information I am requesting ; and 5. take all actions required of you as a furnisher of information to credit reporting agencies.

Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Enclosures : I have attached to following documents FCRA 615 ( g ) ( 2 ) FCRA 605B FTC Notice to Furnishers of Information Identity theft Report Identity Theft Letter to debt collector Police Report ( Pending Deputy Signature )

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX we advised Freedom Mortgage of our intent to utilize a recast of loan XXXX and paid a {$250.00} processing fee towards that end. On XX/XX/XXXX we forwarded {$200000.00} as a pay-down amount. Freedom provided settlement documents - which contained one or more serious errors. Upon being advised of these errors, Freedom agreed to promptly replace the documents with accurate information. Those documents did not arrive as promised. We made several calls and sent multiple letters to Freedom in the ensuing weeks - receiving no response. Eventually, we began paying the new recast monthly amount ( after being unofficially told via phone of the new recast amount ). ALL payments were made on a timely basis.

Freedom then considered the account to be delinquent, and inundated us with automated calls and written material geared towards delinquent accounts. In the meantime, Freedom sent us conflicting information relevant to the escrow account affiliated with the loan, and refunded monies to us without explanation.

Only after contacting the CEO of Freedom ( XXXX ) via registered mail did we receive any action. Eventually, Freedom acknowledged grossly mishandling the escrow account, and the recast itself ( and acknowledging the account was always current ).

Freedom ignored multiple suggestions that our mortgage interest expense for XXXX would not be accurately reported to us. In fact, not until XX/XX/XXXX did they provide what appears to be an accurate Form 1098 - several weeks after such information can be used for reconciling XXXX taxes. 

Freedom has not responded to our request for a new amortization schedule pertinent to the referenced loan, and has failed to respond to our request for copies of any negative information Freedom may have provided to credit reporting entities.

Freedom has also ( on XX/XX/XXXX ) billed us for a Property Inspection Fee,  which is not provided for in the loan agreement - but which is consistent with practices of some mortgage companies when they consider loans to be delinquent.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
Diversified Consultants Inc. contacted me via phone about a debt owed to XXXX XXXX XXXX. After repeatedly requesting them to verify the debt as the account in contention was opened in error on the behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX, they refused. I submitted an online dispute for both companies and received the below response from XXXX XXXX XXXX. DCI simply responded back stating the debt was valid even though the original debtor states that it was not. This error on both of their parts has resulted in a 80+ point reduction in my credit score and I am unable to resolve with the DCI through normal means. 

I called in back in XXXX of XXXX to add a line for my son and get him a new XXXX. At the time I was offered a promotional deal where we could buy one XXXX XXXX XXXX and get one for free ( on the same call ). The agent processed the order after I repeatedly inquired whether or not I was eligible for this promotion or not. Within a few days I received the phones and called again since the number on the box was not my own. I was told that that was a mix up and that I could simply use my existing SIM card and should be good-to-go. 
After a month or so, I received a letter stating that I needed to pay my XXXX XXXX XXXX bill for a phone number that I was unfamiliar with. I disregarded until I received a second bill stating that I owed for the entirety of the balance for the phones. I called Customer care again and explained the situation and was informed that the issue was resolved. I even received a letter stating the account had been closed. 
After another couple of months I began getting calls from a company called Diversified Consultants Inc. claiming they were working on your companys behalf to collect a debt. I again, called Customer care and was told the account was cancelled and that it would update on their end in the near future. 
The week of XX/XX/XXXX I received numerous phone calls from DCI and after repeated attempts to get them to re-verify the debt, a derogatory remark was placed on my credit causing a 80+ point drop. I attempted to call DCI to no avail and have yet to be able to get in touch with anyone to rectify the situation Below is the email from the Office of the President at XXXX XXXX XXXX stating they have corrected the error. 
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- XXXX XXXX <XXXX> wrote : Subject : XXXX XXXX XXXX Case XXXX To : XXXX Hi Mr. XXXX, I have removed the account from being written off with an OCA and also adjusted the balance owed on the account. I am still working to rebuild the installment plan on your line.Thanks again for your time and have wonderful week. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX Office of the President XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX. 
o XXXX ext. | XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, received a call from a representative who was working on behalf of HSBC to tell me I owed money on a credit card that I opened in XX/XX/XXXX. I had 90 minutes to respond to the initial call or they would proceed without speaking to me. The initial amount was {$880.00} and was now at {$6600.00} due to interest and late fees. I advised that I did not open a HSBC card in XX/XX/XXXX and the only ones I did have were included in my bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX ; which they knew about, but this card was not a part of that. The card in question ended in XXXX. When I searched old credit reports, this card does not appear on any credit report. They advised it wouldn't be on a credit report as it was put on hold, then transferred or sold to XXXX XXXX. The only HSBC card I had that was transferred, was in XX/XX/XXXX and included in my bankruptcy. They wouldn't listen, they were just trying to do their job and collect my debt. They were willing at this time to offer me a settlement of {$1300.00} ; yes or no, couldn't think about, had to decide at this time. I also had to provide them with a credit card to pay. I advised I didn't have a credit card with me, they said they would put a hold on my bank account until I was able to provide my credit card info but I had to respond by XXXX. I advised I wasn't going to give them any bank or credit card info over the phone. I also advised I had never received anything in writing and they said I was lying, they have sent out multiple notices to me regarding this. When I asked them what address they sent the notices to, they asked me to verify my address, I again asked them to verify my address and they refused. When I refused to pay and they refused to send me notification in writing, they advised they would pursue a judgement against me, have my wages garnished and possibly arrested for credit card fraud.

I have already mentioned to them that I need proof of this debt and simply presenting an agreement between them and the original creditor is not proof. NCB Management only provided me with an agreement between NCB Management and XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX. NCB Management took the risk of owning that debt and it is now their responsibility. I do not have a contract or agreement with NCB Management. They are not prohibited to attempt to make me pay a debt I did not agree with them. They are also not licensed to collect a debt in the State of Florida. You can see that copy attached, so they must by law, cease and desist all collection of this debt and zero out the balance along with deleting this information from all major credit bureaus. NCB Management claims they sent me communication when the alleged debt was first transferred over to them but I never received it and I haven't received a copy of this alleged letter either. This has taken so much energy out of me. I was trying to purchase a home, but this is stopping me from doing so. I am mentally, physically, and emotionally drained from working on this matter to make a better life for me and my family. Per Social Security Administration, NCB Management would need to provide me with an SSA-89 government form giving them permission to use my personal information and if they do not have that form with my signature, that is identity fraud.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for a home equity loan on XX/XX/XXXX. In the initial screening, I was asked if I had a money market account, and I said yes. Discover Home Loans, reached out to me for all the required documents, but did not ask for my money market statement. I called XXXX and asked about my status and they said it was finishing in underwriting and all was good and it would process the following week. The following week, I noticed that my loan was denied. I called Discover and they said the loan was denied because I didn't have sufficient liquid assets. Apparently you need 2x your monthly mortgage in your checking account. I was never advised of this. I could have moved money from my money market. Also, no one ever called me to discuss the denial even though the website says my personal banker would be reaching out to me. When I spoke to a different banker on XX/XX/XXXX, they explained the denial and said someone should have called me with a counter or to request the money market statement. Then he arranged for a supervisor to call me and said it would be that day. I never received a call from the supervisor. He said I could reapply with the money market, but I would have to start all over again. I had all the required documents and liquid assets to obtain this loan, but due to poor communication on the part of Discover employees, I was denied. In my opinion this is bad business. I hold a Discover credit card, they sent me the info to apply for the loan and then didn't do their part to close the loan properly, nor did they follow up with me when I called to understand why. I especially have a problem, with a supervisor not following up.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Tx, XXXX XX/XX/2022 NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM XXXX Naturally XXXX XXXX XXXX, Ga, XXXX Re : XXXX Dear NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM FAIR DEBT COLLECTIONS PRACTICES ACT ; NOTICE OF DISPUTE OF DEBT This is a request for VALIDATION submitted pursuant to the above-mentioned Title and Section, not for " verification '' or evidence of my mailing address. I respectfully request that your offices supply me with competent evidence that I am obligated to pay you under Federal law.

You have received this NOTICE in compliance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Under the FDCPA, I have the legal right to demand proof of the alleged debt NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM claim is owed to NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM. I'm demanding evidence that I am the party you're asking to pay this debt, and that I am obligated by some contractual responsibility to pay this amount.

Why NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM thinks I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred.

When NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. 

Can NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEMS provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 

If NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM is asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The amount and age of the debt, including : State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 

If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 

If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 

Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due Have NATIONAL CREDIT SYTEM made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM determined that.

Details about NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM authority to collect this debt.

Does NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

If NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM is contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 


I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM to make an informed decision about NATION CREDIT SYSTEM claim that I owe this debt. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us.

Thank you for your cooperation. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem related to refinancing
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I went to XXXX looking to purchase a vehicle. I decided on a XXXX XXXX XXXX that had nearly over 100,000 miles on it. I was told by the salesman that I after making 6 months of on time payments I would be able to refinance my auto loan for a better interest rate. After 6 months of on time payments I was denied the ability to refinance my car loan because the vehicle had over 100,000 miles on it. Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I took out a high interest rate loan with the company XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/2017. That company closed suddenly and without notice. A couple of weeks later I start getting collection calls from World Finance   claiming they purchased the contracts from XXXX  XXXX and I owed the debt to them. World Finance had already put a late fee on my loan even though I had no idea who this company was. I worked with the company trying to make arrangements to pay as their collection calls were coming in at least 3 times a day every weekday. If I didn't pick up the phone, they would call my friends and relatives whom I had listed as references on my XXXX XXXX accounts. 
I finally wanted World Finance to prove to me that I owed them the debt from the other loan company. They sent what was claimed to be a " court document '' to prove they bought my loan. It was just a typed up document with no official markings like a judge 's signature or a docket number. 
When I informed World Finance that I would be a filing an official complaint against them, the manager became more aggressive and demeaning ( even yelling at me ) insisting I was just trying to get out of my debt. He then informed me he would put it on my credit report if I didn't pay. After about 6 months of harassing me, my friends and family, I was able to block all of their phone numbers. Unfortunately my friends and family were not able to do so. 
I pay debts that are mine, but they are expecting me to pay a random company I have never done business with just on their word. 
I have included some of the collection notices and a copy of my original contract with XXXX. It appears to me from the language in that contract that my debt from XXXX XXXX was nullified if the company went out of business. Even if that is not correct, I am not just giving my money to a random company that says I have a debt with them.

( The section where I list the last 4 of my Social on this system keeps giving me an error. I included the account number from XXXX XXXX as none of the correspondence from World FinancXXXX has an account number listed. )

Consumer complaint narrative:
A company, XXXX XXXX, charged my card 3 times on XX/XX/2019 in the amount of {$190.00} each time. JP Morgan/Chase approved the charges. I received a call from XXXX XXXX telling me the charge did not go through on my account and asked for an additional credit card. Before providing another credit card information, I checked my account and found the 3 charges. I requested XXXX XXXX to reverse the charges and to cease charging my account. I informed them, in writing via email, that I revoke any authority of charging my card. 

I contacted JP Morgan/Chase at XXXX and spoke with a representative - XXXX. She refused to help me so I asked to speak with a supervisor. XXXX in XXXX, MO answered the line and refused to help. 

Chase 's solution is to allow the fraudulent charges to complete on my account and then I am to contact Chase to again dispute the charges and they will review the situation at that time. 

I informed XXXX that the charges are fraudulent and should be removed. He said that he can not do that. I explained that he was supporting fraud and NOT protecting his client. His response is that he understands but he can not do anything. 

In the interim, I must allow a company to charge my card, receive fraudulent funds, and then dispute the charge with Chase Bank. 

With this type of service, it is not surprising thieves thrive. 

I am very upset about Chase 's response to reported fraudulent activity - and their refusal to protect their clients.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is regarding : EOS CCA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MA XXXX Phone Number : XXXX Website : http : //www.eos-cca.com/ I was reached by telephone on XX/XX/2019 in regards to a legitimate debt that I was unaware of at the time for approximate sum of {$2000.00}. The debt collector explained to me that he's collecting a debt, etc ... 


I asked the representative multiple times if this currently, or will, reflect on my credit report. He explained clearly that it will not as long as a payment plan or payment was received. 


I told the collector that I was willing to pay the debt in full to prevent any damage to my credit, however, if I could set up a payment schedule of {$500.00} per month, I would prefer it ; again on the terms that it will not reflect on my credit report. He explained clearly again that it will not reflect on my credit report. I agreed to the plan and have been paying by the terms since. 


On XX/XX/2019 I received multiple credit alerts that there was a derogatory collection account posted from EOS CCA originating from XX/XX/2019 for the sum of {$1500.00}. This was explicitly a violation of the terms and agreement that the debt collector explained to me. In addition, the first payment of {$500.00} was not posted until the next day of origination ( the XXXX, during the call ), so the balance shown in collections was already post-payment ( not the original {$2000.00} balance and which also shows an invalid date of XX/XX/XXXX, not the XXXX ) which shows that the debt collector issued this credit hold after explaining the terms of the payment plan and setting the agreement that this would not be reflected on my credit report. 


After calling EOS CCA on 3 separate occasions on XX/XX/2019, they initially found no record of a conversation with a previous representative, but acknowledged the fact that a payment plan was in place and that there must've been contact. They also explained that there should have been no agreement with the representative and that they would never strike a deal to " not '' inform the credit bureaus. They explained that they would review the tapes and that I was supposed to call back within 48 hours to speak with a manager. 


EOS CCA misrepresented, misinformed and mishandled me and my information. Without transparency and releasing of the tapes they have on file of my conversation that set the agreement with their representative, I am at the mercy of EOS CCA and their managers, despite of holding my end of the agreement up, giving them the chance to further mishandle and manipulate me.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
on XX/XX/2022 I, XXXX XXXX, was notified by HSBC USA N.A via mail that my credit card account was being sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX effective XX/XX/2022. Later I received notice that this change was postponed until XX/XX/2022. 

on XX/XX/2022 I, XXXX XXXX, sent a check from XXXX bank to HSBC USA to pay off the remaining balance of my credit card account, in the amount of {$2300.00}. 

on XX/XX/2022 My HSBC USA account showed a credit for the amount I paid via check, and my account balance was XXXX cents. That same evening, XX/XX/2022, The credit was reversed and my balance was back to original amount. 

XX/XX/2022 My account was charged a Return Check Fee. 

XX/XX/2022 I called XXXX bank and there was no evidence of a check submitted by, or returned to HSBC USA. XXXX advised me that the check was never submitted to them by HSBC USA and no check was denied by XXXX bank. I then called HSBC USA and was told multiple times that the check was returned by my bank and denied. I then proceeded to make a conference call with XXXX bank and HSBC USA on the same phone call, and was then told by HSBC USA that the check was first denied for unknown reasons. XXXX told HSBC USA that the check would clear with them, but they show no record of a check being submitted to them from HSBC USA. I was then told on the same phone call from HSBC USA that a " back department '' would need to accept the funds and my account would be paid off and the return check charge be voided. I was promised a call back within 24 hours and verification that my account was paid off and check accepted. 

XX/XX/2022 I received no phone call within the 24hr period and my account still showed the original balance. Called HSBC USA and was " disconnected ', which I believe hung up on, multiple times after explaining my situation with a new representative. Was then notified by HSBC USA after being on hold for 2 hours that they did not have the check and I would again be contacted when they research the problem and find a resolution. As of today, XX/XX/2022 my HSBC USA account still shows the original balance after a check was sent from XXXX bank in the full account balance amount, and HSBC USA is refusing to accept the check i submitted to pay this account off in full.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
When I opened the small business credit card account reacting to {$750.00} marketing cash back offer at {$7500.00} spent within 120 days, I was told that the company will honor the offer. Since the credit limit was sent at {$1000.00} per statement ( despite having a XXXX credit rating and no debt ) I was told by the US Bank Executive team member that in order to overcome the {$1000.00} limit and still meet the required spend I have to keep making payments at {$1000.00} intervals to free up credit for the transaction. This worked until XXXX when all of the sudden and without warning the US Bank decided to transfer the payment to a central payment escrow account thus freezing the available credit at {$1000.00} regardless of positive balance exceeding it. I attempted to work with the bank using following : 1 ) close the other US bank credit card account to increase the available credit : denied 2 ) increase the credit limit available : denied but available after 180 days review period which will put it behind the XX/XX/2022 {$750.00} marketing offer expiry 3 ) requested to have the offer to be extended to XX/XX/2022 ( an additional billing period so the billing spent can be met ) ; denied. 
4 ) requested the payments to be made to the card directly instead of the central payment escrow account : denied. I was told that the transfer of the central credit payment to direct credit card payment will take 1-2 billing cycles thus it will take place after the expiry of the XX/XX/2022 deadline making it useless. 

I was also not informed why the central bill pay is mandatory at the US Bank as the company is actually holding the money in escrow instead of applying it the very day it received it but I was informed that it is done " automatically. '' This is despite the fact that I didn't ask for the billing to be done this way and contrary to my wishes. Subsequently the bank also denied a confirmation that the transfer of the central pay escrow to direct card pay will not affect the points already accrued on the account as result of the transactional activities. 
So in the last pay period I have had the following totals ( since XX/XX/2022 ) : {$300.00} positive balance {$1000.00} payment {$630.00} payment {$1000.00} credit limit {$2900.00} ( that if direct pay should be more than enough to meet the {$7500.00} spend ( as of XX/XX/2022 : $ XXXX XXXX {$7600.00} ). 
However as of today the card despite reaching an overall limit of spend at {$7000.00} ( {$480.00} more to go as of XX/XX/2022 ) the transactions going forward are being rejected : XX/XX/2022 {$90.00} XXXX XX/XX/2022 {$14.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/2022 {$54.00} XXXX It is obvious that the US Bank is blocking these transaction on purpose and keeping the payments already made in account pay escrow so the {$7500.00} is not met thus the offer 's terms will not be met by XX/XX/2022. 
After the offer deadline passes the US Bank will apply the credit to the account however it will be too late to collect what is owed. It is very disappointing that the US Bank will be playing games such as these and structuring its credit products in bad faith so the customers are not made whole. I attempted to be flexible and offer the bank several ways to address this issue but not to avail. It also appears that the advice given to me in XX/XX/2022 to address this problem by the US bank executive office was given in bad faith as shortly after my payments were stopped being credited to the account and sent instead to the central pay escrow.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2019 I requested validation and verification of a bankruptcy with Lexis Nexis that has been reporting to the credit bureaus. After 30 days I received a response from XXXX stating this was verified. They did not give me the procedure used as requested. According to the FCRA credit reporting agencies are required to provide to the consumer the method of verification and proper validation upon request. This includes the name, address, and phone number of the verifying individual. Lexis Nexis violated the FCRA by not complying with its guidelines. Furthermore, I also contacted the local courthouse to verify if Lexis Nexis verified with them. I was told by the court clerk that they DO NOT give any information to any of the credit reporting agencies including Lexis Nexis. I do not know how XXXX or Lexis Nexis received PROPER verification and validation if it did not come from the source of the information themselves. This is a direct infringement of my rights under the FCRA. I am asking that this bankruptcy be removed.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I logged into my paypal account to check on a transaction for a roll of stamps I had ordered previously.When I got to my account there was a notification that my account was temporarily blocked due to suspicious transactions.I navigated around to get to PayPal security and the first guy whose name I don't recall was unable to do much so he transferred me to a level 7 security person, whose name was XXXX XXXX XXXX gave me his employee id number and phone number and then reassured me he could get these transactions backed out and restore my account.He then asked me to share my computer via an app called XXXX.Apparently that didn't work so he asked me to download something called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and that didn't work either.He then tried Venmo and that also was unsuccessful.He then decided it was being interfered with by my XXXX account, which he then disabled.He asked for my PayPal login/password.I gave it to him since I thought he was security with Paypal.He then proceeded to do several transactions. " backing the charges out of PayPal '', when in fact he was buying cryptocurrency with my checking account which was linked to PayPal.He then asked me if any other accounts seemed off and my cryptocurrency account seemed off so he asked me to log in to that and then he requested XXXX which I entered.He proceeded to make many crypto transactions in the name of backing out the charges.He then told me that my computer had been compromised and to not log in to any of my financial accounts for 5 days.I spent about 7 hrs on the phone with this guy and he just kept reassuring me that the money taken at PayPal would be fully restored.Then he began calling me on XXXX XXXX, once again assuring me that the transactions would take a while and questioned me whether I had gone back into my financial accounts.He then said that they suspected that someone at my bank had compromised my accounts and that they needed to do a XXXX XXXX to find out who the hacker was.He put me in touch with the head security officer at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX who told me I needed to help them catch this person and we needed to complete a wire transfer to a dummy account as the transactions on PayPal would go through at XXXX XXXX.It was around XXXX XXXX  at that time.So I went to my bank, asked to do the wire transfer and gave them the account particulars that they had sent to me.They asked for the receipt for this transaction.The next morning I felt uneasy about what had transpired so I called PayPal and they said there was not an employee by the name of XXXX XXXX and that their employee would never give their last name or id number or phone numbers I went to the bank, told them that I had been scammed and tried to stop the wire transfer.I then found out that multiple transactions with bitcoin had taken place thru using my bank account that was tied to PayPal and multiple transactions were made to XXXX as well.In all over XXXX was removed from my XXXX account and about XXXX from my checking account.I changed all my passwords, cancelled my bank accounts and opened new ones, bought a new computer and I phone because I didn't know how much information had been hijacked from my computer.The only data I transferred on my phone was my contacts list, but the next day this XXXX XXXX guy was calling me on the new number.I have subsequently filed disputes with PayPal , XXXX, and made a police report and an FBI report.

They never did a fair investigation according to the 15U.S.C 1681. 15.U.S.C 1681 section 603 ( 3 ) ( E ) states ; The term " investigative consumer report '' means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumer 's character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he/she is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such reporting information shall not include specific factual information on a consumer 's credit record obtained directly from the creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer. They also violated my rights numerous times. The credit bureau violated my given rights under 15 USC 1681 According to 15 USC section 602A I have a right to privacy According to 15 USC 1681 section 604 A section 2 it also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions. According to 15 USC 1681S-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting wit the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.
