Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2022 I found out that my Celsius Network digital asset account was frozen, and they would not allow me any access to sell, buy, swap, transfer or withdraw any funds, coins, collateral or rewards, essentially locking me out from accessing my property. At that time, my assets inside my Celsius account totaled roughly {$1.00} million in equivalent US Dollar value, and were comprised of XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and others. 
Just days before the freeze, the CEO of Celsius XXXX XXXX was boasting that all assets were completely safe and that everyone has complete access to their assets. Indeed, for years XXXX constantly boasted about how Celsius was safer than a bank -- suggesting that our assets were not only completely safe, but that we'd be utter fools to use banks instead of Celsius, especially with that " sweet yield '' we were earning. After XX/XX/2022 as an accredited investor I moved assets into CUSTODY to add an extra layer of safety to some holdings. Holding assets in CUSTODY meant that the assets were not earning any yield, and they could be readily accessible at any time. 

In early XX/XX/2022 I pledged approximately {$400000.00} in XXXX from CUSTODY to become collateral for a {$100000.00} USDC loan against my digital assets. This four to one ratio of collateral to debt ( 25 % LTC ) enabled me to gain some capital access at 2.95 % annual interest rate and most prominently allowed me to access some of the value of my appreciated coin valuations without selling any assets and incurring taxes.

In summary, I have coins held in the EARN account, in the CUSTODY account, and pledged as collateral on a LOAN, which I would gladly pay off to rightfully recover possession of my digital assets.

Not only is it now readily apparent that Celsius LIED to us extensively by taking massive undisclosed risks with our assets and covering up the truth of their beleaguered financial status, but after being exposed they are now using OUR assets to seek compensating themselves and paying attorneys to help exonerate them from their gross negligence and heinous acts of mismanagement and perhaps, extensive fraudulent and 'Ponzi scheme ' related activities. We find this to be terribly disturbing and blatantly illegal in many ways and feel it warrants a thorough investigation and prompt legal attention. 
Thank you for your ardent consideration in this serious matter.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you without properly notifying you of lawsuit
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, XXXX, I received a notification from a credit monitoring app that a new collections account was listed on my credit report with the name, " ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV '' collecting the amount of {$19000.00}. This is the only reason I have any awareness the collection agency, as they have made absolutely no attempts to contact me directly. I have been working with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to help me negotiate debt settlements since XX/XX/XXXX and I immediately notified them of this new account. They contacted your ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV to try to settle this collections account several times. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX failed to deliver a certified letter, that I can only assume was sent from ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV, because I was traveling to support family members with COVID-19 infections. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from the Superior Court of Arizona regarding case XXXX. The plaintiff ( ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV ) entered a Ex Parte Motion on XX/XX/XXXX to Allow Service Under Ariz. R. Civ . P. 4.1 ( k ). The motion stated Defendants are evading service of process but the plaintiff provided no evidence to support the allegation. The court denied the motion as the fact the Defendant ( me ) lives in a secure building does not constitute evading service. 

Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has worked on my behalf to make several offers to settle this debt, with no response from ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV. This collections company has failed to contact me directly about this matter since acquiring the debt, and it has become clear to me that they would prefer to abuse the Arizona courts system, using it to intimidate and harass me and waste taxpayer resources. 

I am trying to arrange funds and have good intentions of paying off as much of my debts as possible. I have emailed them directly, including the attached letter regarding my recent financial hardship for their consideration, assuming it acts as valid proof that I have attempted to settle said debts. ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV has made no attempt to contact me directly or respond to my numerous attempts to settle this debt without the Arizona Courts. I am submitting this complaint because ABSOLUTE RESOLUTIONS INV is abusing the Arizona Courts to harass and intimidate me. 

Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Ive had the JC Penney credit card for several years before they closed my account. Four years ago I lost my full-time job so I was struggling with keeping up with payments. Up to this point I didnt have any problem paying the bills on time. 

Ive contacted the company several times during my financial hardship and kept on stressing that I do not want the account closed, but that I would pay off whatever was on it ; there wasnt a lot. I told them I would keep sending money in, and not use the card, until it was paid in full. Consumers are always told to stay in touch with the creditor, and I did. They kept on assuring me that I was doing the right thing by staying in contact with them, sending in payments even if it didnt cover the monthly amount, and that my card would not be cancelled. 

A few months after I had gotten my balance down to XXXX, and paid off everything ( even the late fees, etc. ), they send me a letter that they cancelled my card. My credit score was climbing back up, and I get hit with this! They gave me the form letter about my credit report saying that I have too many derogatories and too many accounts past due. Now my credit score has gone down because of the nonsense these companies are allowed to create. 

They lied, their business practices do not keep the consumer in mind, and something should be done to them!

Recently it has come to our attention that our student loan through Wells Fargo has been increasing the amount of our remaining loan principal despite making payments monthly. The initial loan amount for one of the loans was {$17000.00} and that went into repayment on XX/XX/XXXX. The interest rate on this loan is a variable interest rate and is currently at 11.24 % interest. However, in nearly 7 years of making payments the balance on the loan as of the last statement for XX/XX/XXXX is {$17000.00}. We believe that this is a result of predatory lending. On the statement it even shows that we have paid a total of {$20000.00} with {$6000.00} of that supposedly going towards principal. 
Our second loan also went into repayment on XX/XX/XXXX but that initial loan amount was for {$8000.00}. The variable interest rate on this loan is currently 5.25 %. As of the XX/XX/XXXX statement it has said that we have paid a total of {$5800.00} with {$3300.00} of that being principal. However the remaining loan principal on this account is {$6100.00}. 

We believe that both of these loans were included in the XXXX predatory lending case, but were never sent any information about a class action. 
Wells Fargo will not talk to us as the primary acou t holders and ONLY contact the co-signers. 
Just going off of simple math, we shouldnt still have balances that high.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am asking for a few minutes of your attention. Please. I am coming to you as my last hope of being heard. I am frustrated. I have looked for help in different places : HUD, FHA, CA-HOPE to name a few of those places, as soon as I started telling them that I needed help with my mortgage lender, who ended up selling the property at an auction sale. I can no longer continue when they tell me that everything is already lost. In pain I have already learned to live, in frustration I am afraid to live. 

It's not fair this, impotence, with sadness that I feel seems not to move anyone.. More empathy for each other. Please, all of us, in one way or another, share the same pain that covid left us. XXXX  took my father away from me, a little earlier I had lost my younger sister, the mourning process led me to a deep XXXX that prevented me from working and unfortunately I missed payments on my mortgage. in my vulnerability and ignorance it did not allow me to avoid being scammed by fake people promising to help me with the loan modification that I did not have to talk to the bank. They took money from me and made me waste my time. The bank started the foreclosure process with a sale date on XX/XX/2022 a few days before. I contacted the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. They told me that they would stop the sale so that the bank would give me the opportunity to reach a settlement. 

I do not intend to get rid of my payments. I want the property returned to me. I am working. I can show that I can continue with the payments. I also applied for Mortgage Relief. It is pending. I need legal help as soon as possible to see everything from the sale of the property and review the loan contract. I feel that something is wrong with the contract because they started the loan with a 9.99 % interest rate for just one year. They raised the interest rate to 20.87 %, the rate they never mentioned to me when signing the contract. Today I only heard it say that I had already lost the property. I need help, please, somehow recover the property. I can show that I will not have problems with future payments, but the bank did not listen to me... Please help me with information, with a lawyer with something to help me. Do not ignore me. I beg you to help me. It is a plea for help. 




If someone speaks XXXX it would be better but if not, it's fine I can understand everything, because of my accent it's difficult for me. Thank you again.

I disputed this transaction to recover my {$44.00} since the credit card company never got the money from paypal. I have record showing I never got the {$44.00} refund. I expect paypal to undo the notice of debit.

On Q Financial, Inc solicited me for a mortgage refinance. I worked with a loan officer named XXXX XXXX who provided me with a loan estimate. Based on the financial information presented in the estimate, I decided that the savings I would see each month in my monthly payment from the lower interest rate and lower PMI it would be worth my time, money, effort, and hit to my credit score. He quoted me a PMI of $ XXXX/month. I filled out the loan application and provided all of the requested documentation. While waiting for conditional approval of my loan, I started receiving email communications from a few other employees regarding my loan. A new loan officer had taken over my loan and I had learned that XXXX was no longer with the company. I then emailed my new loan officer, XXXX XXXX, to ask if it were possible that I might be eligible for a lower interest rate or pmi than I was quoted based on the fact that my appraisal came in XXXX higher than anticipated. He said he would look into it. His response was a closing disclosure that had a higher pmi and a higher loan amount. In discussing the disparities in cost between the loan estimate and the closing disclosure, XXXX told me that he could not figure out how XXXX came up with XXXX for the PMI. He concluded that he must have entered the number manually and that he shouldn't have done that. I explained that the only reason I decided to proceed with procuring the loan was because of the savings I was quoted. XXXX said that the best rate he could find me was XXXX. He said that he was pretty sure that his company was going to have to eat the cost of the difference. He also said that underwriting was still taking a look at it to get it fixed on my disclosure. After a few days had passed I got a phone call from a VP at On Q to tell me they could not honor the pmi I was quoted and that my only 2 options were to either accept the new loan terms or cancel. He said that he couldnt legally pay the difference of my pmi. 

I believe that he is trying to prey on my ignorance of financial laws and regulations. I don't believe that an increase in pmi is justified when I didn't ask for any loan adjustments and my appraisal actually came in higher than anticipated. I have a feeling that I was duped into pursuing this loan by being quoted numbers that would sway my decision. Please help, thank you.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to inform about PayPals unprincipled business practices. On XX/XX/2019 I sold a {$400.00} gift card for the amount of {$380.00} on XXXX. I received an email from both XXXX and PayPal, informing me about the sale. The buyer subsequently wrote asking for the gift card in order to use online. At this time, I confirmed that the username messaging me through the XXXX  messaging system matched the user name listed on the PayPal transaction and email. ( Please see attachment labeled username ). As you can see, the username I wrote to on XXXX, matches the username PayPal gave me. At this time the person via XXXX  confirmed receipt ; they left positive feedback confirming that they spent the gift card ( please see attachment labeled positive XXXX feedback ). As you can see there is no question that the username PayPal provided me used the gift card. On XX/XX/2019 I received an email from PayPal stating that the transaction for my gift card was unauthorized, siting that there was suspicious activity on the buyers PayPal account. PayPal then took the money out of my account leaving me with a negative balance of {$380.00}. Outraged, I called PayPal asking what they problem was. They told me that the buyer did not authorize the charge and because it was a nontangible good, ( since I messaged the person the gift card number via XXXX secure messaging system ) I am not protected under seller protection, and I am therefore responsible for the unauthorized transaction. How am I, the XXXX seller responsible for PayPals poor security? I am not asking to be protected under seller protection, I am asking PayPal to be held responsible for their security mistake. This does not make any sense that I would be held responsible for a mistake made my PayPal. It is PayPals responsibility to ensure accounts are secured, and if they dont, they need to be held responsible for their mistakes. The innocent XXXX seller should not have to eat the money, as I have nothing to do with their security practices, or in this case, lack thereof. When I was on the phone with the PayPal representative, I asked her what suspicious activity they found. She told me that the purchase was either made in a different state other than the account holders address, or an unrecognized device was used ( XXXX instead of XXXX or vice a versa ). This brings me to personal stories exemplifying PayPals poor security. I recently made a trip to XXXX XXXX XXXX ( I live in Maryland ). I attempted to purchase a subway card for just {$10.00} using my XXXX XXXX debit card. My card was declined, and minutes later ( unlike PayPal ) I received a call from XXXX XXXX asking if this was an authorized transaction. If this purchase was occurring in a different state, why was the buyers transaction ( for much more money ) declined until they could either say yes, the charge was from them, or no the charge was not authorized. It is PayPals responsibility to flag suspicious purchases ( quickly, not take weeks, especially ones as large as mine ) and require customers to secure their accounts. Second, I have a credit card with XXXX. I always login to XXXX via my XXXX. I marked my XXXX  as an authorized device. Occasionally I will use my desktop to login. Because my desktop is not an authorized device, XXXX sends me a text message to the phone number I have on file, with a security code to allow me to login on the unrecognized device. I wanted to test to see what would happened if my brother, who lives in a different state than I do, logged into my PayPal using his XXXX phone. I gave him my username and password and asked him to log in and try to make a purchase. He had no problem not only logging in, but also was able to make a purchase from another state. As you can see PayPal has terrible security, and fails to protect customers account. I should not, under any circumstances, be held responsible for someone cracking into this users PayPal account. It is PayPals liability to ensure that transactions are being made by the account holder, and if they do not, as in my case, they should be out the money, not the seller who has no ability to improve PayPals security. I need PayPal to give me the money I earned for selling the gift card, as I see this as fraud since they are making me pay for their mistake.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

Sub-issue: Billing dispute for services
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was charged a total of {$600.00} by XXXX XXXX ( One Technologies LP ) consisting of 15 charges of {$39.00} and 1 charge of {$1.00}. The {$1.00} charge occurred on XX/XX/XXXX and each subsequent time ( x15 ) was charged {$39.00}. The last charge occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. These charges were on a small business credit card. I would have continued to be charged had an audit not been performed by myself ( owner of the company ). I immediately cancelled the credit card associated with this company on XX/XX/XXXX. I submitted a fraud charges dispute with my bank ( XXXX XXXX ). I received notice from XXXX  XXXX that the charges from this company were legitimate despite me never giving personal information to them. So my claim was denied. I then called XXXX XXXX XXXX to immediately close whatever membership I was signed up for. The company confirmed the 16 charges amounting to {$600.00}. I made a complaint to this company that I did not voluntarily or knowingly sign up for their services. I never provided an email, billing information, or personal information so I have no idea how they received this information or who sold them this information, or who they partner with to get my information.. 

I requested a full refund from them on XX/XX/XXXX. I was granted a single refund for {$39.00}. I called back on XX/XX/XXXX and then again on XX/XX/XXXX. The 2nd call resulted in another refund of {$39.00}. The 3rd call resulted in 2 refunds of {$39.00} after speaking to a supervisor who was " authorized '' to give 2 more refunds. The phone rep said he was not authorized to provide any more refunds and that the remaining charges would be sent to the " billing '' department in " corporate '' and that they would review my account and make a determination in 3-4 business days. Of course 3-4 business days has passed and no contact has been made with me regarding the outcome. Over the phone, their responses confirmed that they could not be trusted because I used logic and sequence to reason with them, and they could not provide a logical response. Another reason why they can not be trusted is because they claim to have sent me emails regarding my account, which over the years of having my email account, I never received a single email until I contacted them and told them to send me emails to make sure they they tell me on the phone is on paper in email. The phone reps just constantly give me a runaround and provide no meaningful response when I ask a straightforward question. 

I made a 4th call on XX/XX/XXXX and they referred my case to the " legal '' department and said they could no longer help me over the phone. A member of the " legal '' team would call to assist me in 1-2 days. I told the rep that someone from billing in corporate was supposed to already have called me, as was stated to me in earlier phone calls. And as expected, no one from corporate called. 

This company has a history of questionable practices/scam. A XXXX lawsuit filed by the Illinois and Ohio Attorney Generals and the FTC on behalf of customers who were duped into this shady credit monitoring company. The settlement amounted to almost {$20.00} million being refunded to customers as of XXXX per FTC. An internet search of XXXX XXXX XXXX complaints results in numerous complaints that parallel mine exactly, and the litigation is public knowledge on FTC.gov. 

I am also a victim of this scam. It just so happened I was scammed starting in XXXX and not when this lawsuit was filed and settled.

To Whom It May Concern, I'm writing today to ask your assistance in helping my wife and me secure an equitable loan modification that will allow us to remain in our XXXX home. We simply dont know where else to turn, as you will understand after reading our story. 

For the past 10 years, weve lived with the knowledge that our home is in pre-foreclosure status despite our best efforts to secure a loan modification from XXXX, XXXX XXXX, EverBank and now TIAA Bank. Full disclosure : We did renege on a previous modification that was unfairly handled by the banks ; for two years, we made monthly payments of {$2400.00}, but we simply could not afford the inexplicable 50 % increase to {$3600.00}.

Weve been told various different reasons why we dont qualify, creditworthiness, financial, not enough equity and the investor, who we've been told is XXXX XXXX but supposedly is XXXX, just won't approve it. The first time about five years ago was supposedly due to our credit, despite the fact that we had credit scores over 700 ; we have no car, student loan, or credit card debt ; and our small business has experienced exponential growth over the past few years, significantly improving our financial situation. 

We are taxpayers, members of the XXXX XXXX Chamber of Commerce, and supporters of our military and veterans as well as many local charities. Were assets to our community, even with the potential of losing our home hanging over our heads. It has also been a huge stress on my wife 's senior mother who we help out by having her live with us. 

We have an excellent accountant whos been helping us with the loan modification paperwork and has quite a bit of evidence to support that weve been given the run-around by the lenders. He also has two other clients in our same exact situation but different banks and he was able to get them both a loan modification. Weve paid thousands of dollars in legal fees over the past 5 years to prevent a foreclosure, but are truly stumped over what to do next. Were not even sure who owns our loan, as it was securitized. It was transferred to XXXX by a confirmed robo-signer and now XXXX XXXX claims ownership out of thin air. 

Its important to note that had a modification been approved 5 years ago, the money that went to our attorney and accountant would have gone toward paying down our loan. Instead, our arrears have increased, making it harder to get the loan modification and putting our house in a negative equity position. 

Can you help? We would really appreciate it.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have several auto leases with American Honda Finance, I have always paid this on time. After the return of the vehicle XXXX XXXX which was returned XX/XX/18 the account was closed out paid in full. I did get a bill for mileage overage which is a separate agreement from the lease - with separate payments and therefore should not be reported under the lease account!

Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I leased a XXXX XXXX  XXXX at XXXX XXXX located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX. Upon closing the deal, F & I Manager XXXX XXXX sold me XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Agreement # XXXX   XXXX for {$430.00} and another one called Appearance and/or Windshield Protection for {$350.00} both for 4 years. On my 3rd year of leasing, I noticed I never got a policy to read at all. So I called XXXX and inquired to where I can call about the service agreement about a dent repair because someone or something scratched my car. I even went there beforehand to inquire how I can get it repaired using my Service agreement. That was the only time I was told that it has to be a size of a credit card and therefore, it does not qualify for repair. This was not explained to me when I was sold the product. I called the company called XXXX and asked for the policy to be cancelled since I feel that I got decoyed into buying it believing that if my car get scratched, I'm insured. XXXX told me it's not refundable and emailed me the policy which I don't understand why now I can't find it among my email inbox. On the 1st week of XXXX I emailed XXXX XXXX, Manager of XXXX XXXX discussing my situation that I am on BK XXXX and that will the dealership allow me to extend or lease another vehicle. XXXX XXXX responded and met with him XX/XX/XXXX. I filled out an application and submitted my W2s only to find out they turned me down because of BK XXXX So I gave up. Went to XXXX XXXX XXXX to get another car because my XXXX lease is expiring in XX/XX/XXXX. They agreed to help me even with BK XXXX and possibly pay the last 2 months of my lease. Unfortunately, they are asking for payment history. I called XXXX XXXX   Account # XXXX at XXXX to get my payment history but they refused to email me the payment history but only to my lawyer. I do not understand this. I ended up losing the deal with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Up to now, XXXX XXXX does not want to give my my payment history and I don't understand that since it is my own record. From the very start, they decoyed me about selling useless service agreements and which I'm not allowed to cancel. Now, the XXXX fXXXX is giving me a hard time getting my own record so I can apply at another dealership for a replacement car. I had been faithful paying XXXX XXXX in the past. I filed for BK XXXX because I had been in and out of the hospital and was forced to retire due to my illness. Now I am stuck and after I turn over the XXXX car, I have no car to go back and fort to the specialists since I could not even get my own record from XXXX XXXX.

Last month when I called to make my payment they said the amount due was {$380.00} which I paid. That shows that I have been paying more than the loan amount otherwise it would have been more. My car payment is {$570.00} per month. A couple of examples of my payments .... XX/XX/XXXX paid {$910.00}, XX/XX/XXXX paid {$700.00}, XX/XX/XXXX paid {$700.00}

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I looked on my account in the end on XX/XX/XXXX when I got a email stating my score changed. I went on and found Transworld Systems ( TSI ) had put a supposed debt collection on my XXXX report. It stated the account was opened in XX/XX/XXXX although it didn't show on my report until XX/XX/XXXX. It shows it is some kind of medical debt although I have insurance and haven't been without insurance since I was a child. I also did not visit the doctor in XXXX other than an urgent care. The debt total is {$1000.00}. I find this interesting because some time ago my husband had a medical bill go into collection with them totaling {$1000.00}. Which was open on false pretenses. The bill was paid through charity care and should never have gone into collection in the first place. We also got some kind of letter from TSI. It was unclear what the name was as it had a XXXX and our last name, but didn't make up a full name. We just assumed they were trying again to get my husband to pay so we sent a letter with his info on XX/XX/XXXX through certified mail. The certified postcard was signed and sent on XX/XX/XXXX. We didn't even consider me as I hadn't been to the doctor and the debt total was the same as what they tried to collect from my husband. After it showed up on my report I sent a letter also on XX/XX/XXXX through certified mail also. The certified postcard was signed and sent on XX/XX/XXXX. The only thing I can come up with is TSI is trying to get their money they paid to purchase the debt, which we do not owe them and never did. We thought this was resolved after it was removed off my husbands report. But it shows now on mine. We contacted them and asked them to remove the debt but they have not sent anything back in response. It has now been 2 months and it is still on my report! I am also curious how did they get my information?! Please help us!

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America sent a letter in regards to my account ending in XXXX. Stating that " We've received notification that you've filed a petition for bankruptcy, case number XXXX. As a result of the filing, we've closed the above account. '' The bankruptcy mentioned in the letter has absolutely nothing to do with me ( or anyone I know or am acquainted with ) and was erroneously tied to my account by Bank of America. This is the second time in the past 3 years this situation has happened with Bank of America. 

I am not filing for bankruptcy and never have. 

In XX/XX/XXXX I received a very similar letter, but it did not state my account would be closed. After conducting my own research in XX/XX/XXXX I learned that an individual in Florida who is also named XXXX XXXX filed for bankruptcy, and somehow Bank of America tied it to my account. 

If Bank of America had proper procedures and steps to verify the identity of their account holders and data they receive from third parties, it would have been clear that the bankruptcy should not be tied to my account. 
After speaking with a Bank of America representative on MXX/XX/XXXX, she informed me that this most recent letter is still part of the same bankruptcy filing from XX/XX/XXXX ( case # XXXX ). 

In both 2016 and this most recent situation in XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America has documented my account that the bankruptcy filing on my account was placed in error. 

However, Bank of America has still closed my account. 

Now this situation has negatively affected my credit due to the closed account, and they will not reopen my account without requiring me to reapply as if I'm a brand new customer. Even though they claim responsibility for the error. 

I refuse to have to go through the reapplication process because the hard credit inquiry will further negatively affect my credit. 

I have been an excellent customer for the past three years with excellent payment history, and my credit is being punished due to an error on their part. 

I request that the account ending in XXXX be reopened as it was before because Bank of America has accepted that it was an error on their part of having the bankruptcy filing on my account. Twice.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: We began the application process in XXXX of XXXX and went under contract on XX/XX/XXXX with a closing date of XX/XX/XXXX. Weve provided all necessary documents and statements within a timely manner. On XX/XX/XXXX, my husband and I inquired about options to reduce our monthly payment and on that day, our Loan Originator provided us with the options- a rate buy down OR a 5 % down payment. After discussion and finding out that both options would only afford a minimal reduction to our monthly payment, we decided to keep things as is. On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX - 4 days before closing, we were advised that we now have to put down a minimum of 5 % which equates to an additional $ XXXX that we have to bring closing in just 3 days. The reason for the increased down payment is due to our lender advising us incorrectly that we could put 3 % down for a conventional loan, even though we were pre-approved for and the initial loan estimate disclosed the 3 % down payment, and this is not a result in change of circumstances on our end. At this time, lender has only reduced the origination charge by a minimal amount to remedy this situation. We sold our home on XX/XX/XXXX and are now being forced to bring this additional money to closing due to the lenders error, without any clear explanation as to what changed. Updated closing disclosure shows that we increased the down payment amount, which is not true.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Sub-issue: Frequent or repeated calls
Consumer complaint narrative: I've been getting several phone calls everyday by this company Portfolio Recovery to all the phone numbers I have as in work, emergency contact, home and alternative contacts. Myself and my emergency contact told them, to stop calling and that we're not even sure of what debt they're even talking about as I've had multiple XXXX XXXX accounts since and before XXXX but disputing it didn't do anything. I don't know what else to do. I have attached just a few of the calls to my main number.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
About seven years ago, I was persuaded by a Citibank teller to open a {$50000.00} " Custom Credit Line. '' He told me that there were no fees or expenses for opening or holding the account and that I would receive more " Thank You Points '' from Citibank for having this type of account in addition to my pre-existing checking and savings accounts. I opened the account and, within a couple of years, I began receiving annual fee statements. ( I have never used the account and I don't need a personal line of credit. ) At various times, I contacted Citibank over the phone and explained the situation and they agreed to remove the fee. Nonetheless, I have recently been receiving fee statements every month and now my phone calls and written letters to Citibank have been ignored. The most recent fee statement shows a balance of {$50.00}. Again, I have asked for this account to be closed and for all fees to be waived, but there has been no response and the fee statements continue to arrive. 

I am requesting that Citibank close this account and remove all fees. In addition, I would like the bank 's practices to be investigated, as I suspect there may be pressure  on tellers and employees to induce customers by fraudulent statements to open " free '' accounts that will ultimately incur fees.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Problem making or receiving payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a small business owner, and one of my clients issued a bill pay check from Wells Fargo to pay an invoice. Upon receipt, the check was damaged ( See attached scan ), making all identifying information illegible except for the Wells Fargo contact information and the routing numbers on the bottom of the check both of which are legible. If I am unable to determine the amount of the check or the issuing individual, I can not contact the person and let them know that I have not been paid ( I am unable to deposit the check ). 

It is my understanding from Wells Fargo that they immediately remove the funds from the individual account and deposit it into a Wells Fargo account, so from the individuals records, it would appear that the monies have been withdrawn and the invoice satisfied. Wells Fargo has refused to issue a new check or to attempt to contact the individual who issued the funds. This was relayed to me by Wells Fargo staff at their corporate office as well as an individual who works at the XXXX branch in a meeting on XX/XX/XXXX. As of today, Wells Fargo has monies owed to me in their possession, and my client ( whoever that may be ) has no idea that they have an outstanding invoice.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a victim of illegal collection practices from Pioneer Credit Recovery. This agency is garnishing my wages without ever trying to attempt to talk it with me. This agency went straight to my employer with false letters to demands that payments be made to them from my paycheck. I had previously submitted 2 complains in regards to this issue and today I am submitting another to report a scam as this agency refuses to speak with me about this debt and will not provide statement about payments towards the balance. The Department of education has not sent me any notification indicating that payment are being received and against the debt. Pioneer Credit Recovery is garnishing my wages without a court order. I have informed them to stop collecting in this way since they have never worked with me and they said that they will not stop the garnishment. This is in violation for the Fair debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

As of this complaint, my employer has given Pioneer Credit Recovery {$6600.00}.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, My name is XXXX XXXX. During the evening of Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX, I visited my local XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, VA to workout. Unfortunately, when I finished working out and was walking out of the gym, I had discovered that my car was burglarized including my right back passenger door window which was broken into, along with purse which was stolen throughout this process. I reported the break-in to the local XXXX XXXX Police Department by immediately dialing XXXX. The local police who were assigned to the XXXX, VA Police precinct were then dispatched to the gym. I then took immediate action to lock both my Wells Fargo checking and savings accounts online by using the Wells Fargo online banking website. I then took immediate steps to call Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . directly to ensure that my checking and savings accounts were officially locked. I further requested that my stolen debit card be immediately canceled and specifically asked that a note be placed on my account alerting I was a current victim of identity theft. The representative on the call then confirmed that my checking and savings accounts were locked through a hard freeze which would prevent any withdrawals or check/transfer deposits from taking place. I received confirmation numbers for both the checking and savings accounts and was asked to follow up in person at a local bank branch office near my home ( XXXX, VA ). I was instructed by the representative on the call that in regard to the stolen or theft of my debit card, I would need to be assisted by a banker in-person to open a new checking and saving accounts. 
On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, I visited the Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX VA. Per my scheduled Wells Fargo in-person appointment, I was attended by a personal banker by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was able to assist with closing my old savings account and opened a new saving account per my request. I requested that my new savings account be protected by remaining locked to prevent any withdrawals. I was assured that my savings account would be protected at the time of this actual request. XXXX XXXX stated that there would be no need for alarm or concern and that no estimated amount of money could be withdrawn by anyone ( specifically the strangers or thieves who are still in possession of my drivers license and Wells Fargo debit card ). XXXX XXXX could not assist me further with closing my checking account as there was a pending deposit. I was requested to return back to the branch on Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX to see if this request had been processed and/or completed. 
As requested, I visited the Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX XXXX the next day, Saturday at XXXXXXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX completed the same steps with closing and opening a new checking account. Once again, I asked that my new checking and saving accounts be protected against any withdrawal activity. I was assured that all correct steps were taken by Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . and I had no need to worry. 
On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXXXXXX XXXX, I received a call from a personal banker, XXXX XXXX XXXX, from Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . in XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX asked if I had recently authorized to have money withdrawn from my account. I acknowledged that she was speaking with me and clearly stated NO, I DO NOT AUTHORIZE WITHDRAWAL OF MY FUNDS. I immediately informed XXXX XXXX about my car being burglarized, including my drivers license and debit card being stolen. I informed XXXX XXXX to inform her manager and the banks XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX division to place a note on my checking and savings account. This would alert bank tellers to take note of the attempted withdrawal of my account. XXXX XXXX informed me that her XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, assisted and did not authorize the withdrawal. However, she apologized, that even though I informed her of the theft of my identify, my drivers license and debit card were returned by her to the thieves prior to reaching out to me via phone call. 
After two hours of speaking with XXXX XXXX, I accessed my online Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . accounts and learned of the immediate withdrawal activity that was taking place in the estimated amounts below. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX {$2300.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX {$3500.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX {$3500.00} I immediately rushed to the Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, VA and was attended to by banking representative, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX assisted to place a hard-freeze on my checking and savings account. The accounts were locked but in the process of locking the accounts, another withdrawal of {$3500.00} took place and XXXX XXXX was unable to stop this withdrawal, but notified the Wells Fargo security/alert banking division and stated that someone was falsely representing me by presenting my stolen drivers license and debit card. This was when an additional total of {$9300.00} was immediately withdrawn from my savings account. 

At this point, the fear of having more issues caused by Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . due to negligence and failure to protect my funds, I requested XXXX XXXX to withdraw all remaining funds from my checking and saving accounts and issue official cashiers checks in the remaining amount of {$45000.00}. XXXX XXXX was not willing to comply with my request due to the time being past XXXXXXXX XXXX eastern standard time. XXXX XXXX did schedule an appointment for me to meet with fellow Wells Fargo branch representative, XXXX XXXX XXXX the following day. I left the bank with XXXX XXXX providing me with a newly issued Wells Fargo case number for the claim of the stolen amount of {$9300.00}. I was assured funds would be returned to me in 10 business days, due to this being Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.s mistake, and by them failing to stop withdrawals. 

On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX, I visited the Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, VA and was attended to by Wells Fargo personal banker, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX successfully withdrew the remaining funds from both my checking and saving account and issued official cashiers checks. I was informed that the funds were immediately available and could deposit the amount into an alternate banking institution of my choice. I asked XXXX XXXX several times if it is correct that the cashiers checks were not an issue for me to deposit into an alternate banking institution and that Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . will not prevent me from depositing funds into another banking institution. XXXX XXXX confirmed once again this wouldnt be an issue. I further questioned XXXX XXXX if indeed Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . was going to return my {$9300.00} that the bank teller gave to the party who fraudulently tried to represent me with my original drivers license and Wells Fargo debit card. XXXX XXXX apologized and said it is not likely that the funds will be returned because there may be additional investigation and that I would need to wait to receive communication by mail. I asked once again why I am to wait for my funds to be returned. Funds that were freely given to the fraudulent thieves who had stolen my drivers license and debit card. 

XXXX XXXX said she did not know and all she could say for me was to wait but the odds of receiving the stolen fund amount of {$9300.00} within the next 10 days from Wells Fargo Bank, N.A would be pretty slim. I asked further if anyone working as a bank teller or cashier or personal banker can see the notes and find that my account was on alert watch. XXXX XXXX said it is hard to say because some bank staff do not read the notes and do not follow the correct process. 

My next issue occurred when I tried to deposit my newly issued cashiers checks from Wells Fargo into my alternate banking institution named XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX informed me that funds would be available the next day. However, when I checked this account online the next day. I had discovered that the funds were not available and immediately called XXXX XXXX to inquire. I reached out to Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . by calling the XXXX # and filed a complaint, which was escalated so I could speak with the Wells Fargo executive office . I was informed that even through Wells Fargo Bank, N.A, issued me an official cashiers check. Wells Fargo still placed a hold on the newly issued cashiers check, and there is no guarantee that the funds would be released to me now within the expected time frame of 5 days. 
At the moment, not only did Wells Fargo Bank, N.A fail to protect my funds from theft. They also gave my funds without my consent. I am now left without any money and am at the mercy of Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . to fix this issue and address the failures that took place. I am deeply discouraged and exhausted which is due to me needing to call repetitively and speak with representatives with no assurance of when my stolen funds will be distributed back to me. In addition, to putting a hold on the cashier checks, which is my money. 

I respectfully request for your immediate assistance to address this complaint as it is not only I who has experienced this mishandling or negligence on the behalf of Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . and their staff. I was present when another customer walked in to the Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, VA and asked that her account be immediately closed because her funds also being taken. This bank institution is not doing their part to protect our money, nor do they have strong security practices set in place to prevent these kinds of thefts.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: 5 years ago I took out a personal loan and my vehicle was used as collateral for the loan. A Lien was placed on the title. I paid off the loan XX/XX/2019 and the Real Time Solutions still has not released the lien on my vehicle. I have contacted them several times and get the run around, with the last contact being today. I am trying to get them to release the lien they placed and they avoid doing it.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative:
I paid off my car loan in less than 2 yrs. ( XXXX, 2022 ). The dealership had added on some type of additional insurance to my car loan & I was told I would get a refund once the loan was paid. Wells Fargo immediately removed the car loan from the internet so I could not check anything that was going on. The bank representatives said they also had no access to the information. I received a letter telling me to pursue the refund with the dealership. The finance person at the dealership told me that they had already refunded all money to Wells Fargo Bank, but the bank would take 6 months to refund the money to me. I did in fact receive the refund in XXXX, 2022. 
1st, I do not believe this " insurance '' should just be added automatically to loans. 
2nd, Wells Fargo sent out fraudulent information ( and wasted my time! ) sending me to the dealership for my refund when they in fact had already received my money from the dealership and were holding it for what turned out to be a full six ( 6 ) months. 
3rd, I was never compensated or paid any interest during the six ( 6 ) months they held my $ 600.+. When a consumer is even just 1 day late, they are hit with late fees as well as interest & penalties.

Interest on $ 600.+ over six ( 6 ) months is a substantial amount of money that I feel should be paid to the consumer!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Cashing a check
Consumer complaint narrative:
I WAS NOTIFIED BY A COUPLE OF CREDIT AGENCIES THAT TWO INQUIRIES WERE POSTED TO MY CREDIT REPORT. I CONTACTED THE FINANCE COMPANIES, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX/XXXX XXXX AND WAS TOLD THERE WERE OPEN ACCOUNTS. I'VE NEVER HEARD OF THESE COMPANIES OR APPLIED FOR CREDIT. ON XX/XX/2019 I RECEIVED A CALL FROM A XXXX XXXX FROM XXXX, PHONE NUMBER XXXX, EXTENSION XXXX. SHE INFORMED ME THAT A CLAIM WOULD BE FILED AGAINST ME REGARDING A LOAN THAT I RECEIVED FROM XXXX XXXX FOR {$2400.00}. I TOLD HER I'VE NEVER HEARD OF XXXX OR RECEIVED ANY MONIES FROM SUCH COMPANY. I TOLD XXXX I WAS A VICTIM OF IDENTITY FRAUD. SOME ONE USED MY NAME AND INFORMATION TO OBTAIN A LOAN. SHE STATED THAT SOMEONE KNOWS ME VERY WELL. I INFORMED HER THAT I HAD FILED A COMPLAINT WITH MY LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENT REGARDING FRAUDULENT LOANS OBTAINED FROM PREVIOUS COMPANIES. I HAD SENT A COPY OF THE POLICE REPORT TO XXXX. 
PER XXXX XXXX THE SUSPECT WAS ABLE TO CASH THE CHECK AT TCF BANK WITH THE ACCOUNT NUMBER OF XXXX. I SPOKE WITH SEVERAL CLERKS AT TCF BANK REGARDING THIS ACCOUNT, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX AND XXXX AT XXXX. I TOLD THEM I WAS A VICTIM OF IDENTITY FRAUD AND TCF BANK ALLOWED THIS CHECK TO BE CASHED AT THE BANK. I WAS TOLD THAT I WOULD RECEIVED FORMS IN THE MAIL TO FILE WITH TCF BANK. AS OF TODAY, I HAVE NOT RECEIVED ANY DOCUMENTS. THE FRAUD TOOK PLACE WHILE RESIDING IN XXXX, WISCONSIN.

I have called multiple times to fix this and each time Bank of America says there are no problems. Today I login and call and they say I am two months past due. I can't tell if they are not applying the payments. So I paid XXXX XXXX  today and resetup the automatic payments. It is exhausting dealing with these people. Sub-issue: You never received your bill or did not know a payment was due
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2016 I called Target Red card accounting per their XXXX number provided and asked for the credit card accounts supervisor, I told her VERY SPECIFICALLY 3X that I would be leaving for XXXX on approx. XX/XX/2016 and I needed an EXACT ACCOUNTING of my Target card so I could pay the entire amount off as I would be gone 2 years without any way of receiving or paying any billis that would arrive after my departure. 
I was given a TOTAL ACCOUNTING of $ XXXXusd and paid that amount, in full, on XX/XX/2016. 
2 months later I received notification from my XXXX credit score that my perfect credit score was now XXXX. 
After many calls and absolutely NO help from Target, I found out that my account had been billed for purchases in XX/XX/2016 that should've been known to Target 's accounting and billing department. 
Because of their ineptitude and failure to report an accurate accounting of my account, my credit score was damaged irreparably and created financial hardships for me and a tremendous amount of business problems.

I had to wait 2.5 years to dispute my credit reports and send Target my complaint- which they summarily denied any responsibility. 
Target has since emailed me to say they had mailed a response to my demand for compensation but that was almost 2 months ago and no mail or email correspondence has been received. 
Target is responsible for destroying my 45 year perfect credit for a {$19.00} charge they should have accounted for- causing me financial hardship and business problems not to mention 3 years of terrible credit and the horrendous stress it has caused me trying to rehabilitate my credit and my good name.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, 2019, Wells Fargo, ( herein " WF '' ) found a new way to charge overdraft and return item fees. None of the actions taken by WF is technically illegal. WF announced by letter that the bank was amending the terms of its Line of Credit Agreements to allow the bank, without prior notice, to close the account if it had had no activity for one year. I spoke to customer service, informing them that the ability to close the account without notice had an effect on many customer 's deposit account agreements, as these lines frequently serve as overdraft protection for the deposit accounts. That means that a customer who inadvertently overdraws their deposit account -- or who intentionally writes a check over the deposit account balance -- may be subject to overdraft fees or a dishonored item with a fee-without actually knowing that the line of credit account had been closed by WF without notice. The Customer Service person I spoke to was forced to agree that I had correctly interpreted the terms of the account change. 
Customers often do not know or understand the effect of the change of terms. As an attorney who wrote these terms for the former Wachovia bank, I do understand them and find the " without notice '' clause a unfair and deceptive action. Customers can protect themselves by taking a minimum advance from the line of credit and paying it back on the next day. However, since the lines of credit were sold in part as overdraft protection lines, it is grossly unfair to allow the bank, particularly this bank with its recent customer service debacles, to take this action, The bank should absolutely provide a prior notice to shutting down the line so that customers can take appropriate action to protect their good credit standing on their deposit accounts. I can not determine if WF is taking this step to increase overdraft and returned item fees or if it is closing accounts without notice to control the access of employees to these lines of credit. Did CFPB order Wells to take this action to " clean up '' its house? If it did, the result is still unfair.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Add-on products and services
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX ofXX/XX/XXXX I opened a XXXX card with them, the limit was not what I was expected and I was recommened to wait 6 months, apply for another credit card and that I would be able to combine their limits. I had previously used this service successfully. 

On XX/XX/XXXX after six months I again applied for the same card and was approved at the same XXXX dollar limit. I went ahead and went to their website to proceed with the combination of the two cards. I was then given an error saying this service is temporarily suspended. 

I called customer service to see when the service would be available again on XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke with a customer service representative and was told this service is unavailable and they have not date for when it will return. I then esclated to a supervisor and they informed me that this service is now suspended and has no date for return. The ability to request it is still on the website and my terms of service of both cards still mention the ability to do so. 

Capital One was unwilling to allow me to do this. After dealing with a Senior Account Manager I was told that there is no further place to escalate this issue and they were  unable to provide me contact with anyone beyond the Sr Manager. 

There was no communication on this feature change, it is still advertised on their website and XXXX. My expectation is that if they are removing a critical feature that I have used multiple times as customer has been removed, that it would be communicated and at least removed from the XXXX  or site. 

Had I had this information I would not have applied for this credit card. Now I am stuck with a hard inquiry on my credit report, a credit card that I really don't need since the whole objective was to raise the limit by combining them. They were also unable to provide me details on what further steps I could take to get the the credit lines merged. 

They gave me a XXXX dollar credit line increase on my original card, and a XXXX dollar limit on the new one. I do not understand why they would extend such a large line of credit on a new card as opposed to just increasing my current product with them. 

This has negatively effected my total age of accounts, hard inquiries on my credit report and given me another credit card to carry around.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2019 I was emailed saying someone sent me roughly {$590.00} through XXXX/chasepay. 

I wasn't aware that someone owed me money but whatever. 2 hours later I tried to log into my account to see if it was a mistake and that's when I noticed I couldn't log into my bank from mobile or from desktop. 

XX/XX/2019 roughly XXXX I called Chase bank to restore my access. They informed me that they froze my assets and my account because someone sent a fraudulent XXXX to my account. I advised them immediately that I don't know the person or the amount, yet they still kept my account frozen over a XXXX transfer. They said the need to investigate, but that department is closed till Monday. Since this happened on a Friday, they have kept my account frozen over the weekend and probably wont investigate till Monday and probably wont unfreeze my account till who knows when. I HAVE NO CASH AND NO MONEY TO BUY FOOD AND I AM STARVING. I never would have though that my account would be frozen otherwise I would have kept cash at home so I could buy food. Chase should not be allowed to randomly freeze peoples accounts when they DID NOTHING WRONG. Especially since in the terms for using XXXX, it says you can't chargeback a transfer, and yet, apparently you can. Clearly some scammer is messing with me. I have over {$7000.00} in my account and they froze it all over a {$590.00}. I get it, freeze or take the XXXX XXXX, but they should have ZERO rights to freeze my XXXX.

I did not authorize Elan or XXXX to do this and in fact was calling because I want to opt out of the transition. I have a balance transfer check I want to send from my new credit union and place on their new credit card. Elan further stated on the phone that if I closed out my account tonight I would lose all rewards points and suggested I check my point balance before proceeding. I hung up, went to my rewards site, logged in as usual and a message appeared stating " Cardholder does not participate. '' I then called the number on the back of my CC, found my point balance via the automated menu, and then proceeded until a XXXX person answered. After explaining this whole mess, the XXXX customer service person stated " they had jumped the gun '' on the transition. This all violates what is stated in their letter about this transition and I consider it a breech of contract. What recourse do I have to a ) get back my reward points?, b ) stop a credit transfer to Elan, a company I do NOT want to do business with?, and c ) make a clean break with both XXXX and Elan without it impacting my credit? Any help you can offer will be greatly appreciated!!

Sub-issue: Frequent or repeated calls
Consumer complaint narrative: I received about a year ago a letter from Rausch Sturm attorneys at law concerning a debt I have with XXXX XXXX, for a credit card for XXXX XXXX XXXX. I called and spoke to an agent explaining my situation that I am unemployed due to a handicap and unable to work. That I am trying to get SSDI but have not been approved yet. I worked out the issue with the agent who was in Wisconsin I believed. In the next few days I started receiving calls from agent for Rausch Sturm who were obviously calling from offshore because of their heavy XXXX accents. Even though I explained my situation to them they continued to call me every day claiming they needed a resolution with the debt. I finally had to send a cease and desist order to Rausch Sturm in Wisconsin to stop it. This year on XX/XX/2019 ; I received a letter from Rausch Sturm again inquiring about the debt. I called them and explained that I am still unemployed. The agent noted it on the account and asked about the Cease and Desist order. I told her to remove it because I wanted to work with them to resolve the debt. The next day I received a call from an offshore agent claiming to represent Rausch Sturm concerning the debt. I told him that I already spoke to an agent about it yesterday and explained it to them. His response again was but we need to have a resolution to the debt. I then remembered the last time when they would call every day. I called the number back on the letter and spoke to a XXXX at Ex XXXX and explained what happened. We determined that the Cease and Desist order should be reinstated. XXXX said she did put it back on. I figured that the Issue was resolved until today when I received a call from an Offshore agent claiming to be with Rausch Sturm about the debt. Her accent was so heavy I could hardly understand her, but I told her that there was a Cease and Desist order  and she admitted that it was on there and she would make sure no more calls came. Unfortunately, my experience is these offshore agents do not respect no call orders. I would like these Offshore calls to cease and only work with on shore agents. I do want to resolve this debt.
Company: Rausch, Sturm, Israel, Enerson & Hornik, LLP

Notice, congress said ANY card. The credit card is my social security card. This is the credit card I used to originate every consumer credit transaction below. They should be removed from my consumer report pursuant to 15 usc 1681a ( 2 ) ( B ). I am demanding that you remove these Transactions from my report immediately as they are a violation of my rights as a federally Protected consumer under title 15 chapter 41.

15 U.S. Code 1666d - Treatment of credit balances Whenever a credit balance in excess of {$1.00} is created in connection with a consumer credit transaction through ( 1 ) transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, ( 2 ) rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or ( 3 ) amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of an obligor, the creditor shall ( A ) credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumers account ; ( B ) refund any part of the amount of the remaining credit balance, upon request of the consumer ; and ( C ) make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order any part of the amount of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months, except that no further action is required in any case in which the consumers current location is not known by the creditor and can not be traced through the consumers last known address or telephone number.

18 U.S. Code 8 - Obligation or other security of the United States defined The term obligation or other security of the United States includes all bonds, certificates of indebtedness, national bank currency XXXX Federal Reserve notes, Federal Reserve bank notes, coupons, United States notes, Treasury notes, gold certificates, silver certificates, fractional notes, certificates of deposit, bills, checks, or drafts for money, drawn by or upon authorized officers of the United States, stamps and other representatives of value, of whatever denomination, issued under any Act of Congress, and canceled United States stamps.

I reserve the right to sue a credit bureau for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and I believe I can prove that you did not use reasonable measures to ensure the accuracy of my credit reports and now you are stalling the process even further.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/2018 I instructed Citizens Bank to make an electronic payment using the Citizens Bank mobile banking app. The payment was for {$3100.00} and was to be sent to XXXX XXXX as the payment processing bank for my XXXX MasterCard which had been opened in XX/XX/2018. The payment of {$3100.00} was the full amount of the statement balance and my instructions to Citizens was this electronic payment was the be sent on XX/XX/2018 to in time to meet the payment due date of XX/XX/2018. By reviewing my bank transactions on-line on XX/XX/2018 I determined that the transaction had not been processed. I visited Citizens bank on Friday XX/XX/2018 and learned that Citizens had opted to prepare a paper draft drawn on my checking account and send it via mail in lieu of the electronic payment as I had instructed. The banks stated reason for this action was to protect my funds from being misdirected as in their experience, a paper check was easier to track than an electronic payment. The banks customer service person made calls to Citizens Bank payment processing departments as well as to XXXX  customer service department only to learn that neither Citizens nor XXXX could provide information as to the whereabouts of the {$3100.00} payment. In the following week, I learned that the paper check ( # XXXX ) that Citizens had prepared had been processed by XXXX XXXX XXXX for credit to their customer, XXXX. Over the next several months, I made several visits to Citizens, made several phone calls to Citizens, XXXX and XXXX, all to no avail. In XX/XX/2018, acting on Citizens instructions, I filed a sworn affidavit regarding a fraudulent check claim ; it also proved fruitless. Citizens instructed me to contact XXXX XXXX and/or XXXX, as in their words, Citizens had done what they were instructed to do and they could not assist me any further. I have filed a complaint with the Massachusetts AGs office and their efforts have also produced no results. This matter is now eight and one-half months old and I have incurred an additional {$170.00} in interest charges while trying to resolve this matter. I have a very detailed written description of these facts with account numbers, addresses and names and telephone numbers of people whom I have contacted as well as notes of the substance of each conversation. As of this writing, I am still without my funds.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Greetings, I'm a XXXX years Honorably Retired and Permanently XXXXXXXX XXXX Veteran.

In the XXXX open complaint, I stated that I missed three payments ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) in the year of XXXX due to COVID-19.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid my mortgage off in full. Yet, Wells Fargo has placed serious delinquency on my XXXX credit report ( along with the other credit bureaus ). 

I found additional information from CFPB and DOJ copied at the bottom. I also attached this data as a pdf file. 

Based off this release, I feel that Wells Fargo has made a grave error by reporting to all three credit bureaus that I was delinquent. Wells Fargo has also reported to all three credit bureaus that Foreclosure started. 

Wells Fargo has caused GRAVE harm to me emotionally, mentally, and financially by placing adverse/negative information on my credit profiles. 

I was denied multiple times for loans ( i.e. refinance, loan modification, home equity, personal loans, etc. ) by Wells Fargo and other banks/creditors due to Wells Fargo 's actions. 

I humbly seek justice. 



FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE : XX/XX/XXXX MEDIA CONTACT : XXXX XXXX XXXX Tel : ( XXXX ) XXXX CFPB AND DOJ PUT LANDLORDS AND MORTGAGE SERVICERS ON NOTICE ABOUT SERVICEMEMBERS ' AND VETERANS RIGHTS Joint Letters Remind Landlords And Mortgage Servicers To Adhere To The CARES Act And Additional Legal Requirements Under The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act XXXX XXXXXXXX. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and U.S. Department of Justice ( DOJ ) issued two joint letters today regarding important legal housing protections for military families. One letter was sent to landlords and other housing providers regarding protections for military tenants. A second letter was sent to mortgage servicers regarding military borrowers who have already exited or will be exiting COVID-19 mortgage forbearance programs in the coming weeks and months. 

The letter to landlords and other housing providers reminds property owners of the important housing protections for military tenants, some of whom may have had to relocate or make other changes to their housing arrangements in response to the crisis. While military families enjoy the same legal protections and privileges afforded to all other homeowners and tenants, they also have additional housing protections under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act ( SCRA ), which is enforceable by the DOJ and servicemembers themselves. 

The letter to mortgage servicers comes in response to complaints from military families and veterans on a range of potential mortgage servicing violations, including inaccurate credit reporting, misleading communications to borrowers, and required lump sum payments for reinstating their mortgage loans. These complaints are being reviewed for compliance by the CFPB with the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act and other applicable requirements. 

The illegal foreclosures of military families in the last crisis was one of the financial industrys worst failures, said CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX. The CFPB will be closely watching mortgage servicers and will hold them accountable for illegal tactics perpetrated against military families. 

The Department of Justice takes seriously its responsibility to safeguard the rights of servicemembers and veterans, said Assistant Attorney General XXXX XXXX. While servicemembers carry the great burdens of this Nation, they should not have to worry that their sacrifices will result in economic harm to their families. Mortgage servicers and landlords must ensure that they are in full compliance with federal laws intended to protect servicemembers and their families during military service. 

During the COVID-19 pandemic, roughly 7.6 million homeowners entered forbearance. While the majority have resumed their regular mortgage payments, approximately 1.25 million borrowers many of whom are military borrowers remain in forbearance programs that will expire at the end of the year. Ensuring that mortgage servicers comply with their legal obligations is crucial, especially since a decade ago some large financial institutions illegally seized the homes of military families, sending their lives into a tailspin. These violations were a result of breakdowns in the mortgage servicing industry that were severe and widespread. The result was numerous settlements with regulators, including a {$180.00} XXXX settlement between DOJ and some of the countrys largest mortgage servicers. 

Servicemembers have several legal protections under the SCRA that are designed to enable them to devote their entire energy to the national defense. These include, for example, a prohibition on foreclosing on certain servicemembers mortgages without court orders, the ability for military families to terminate residential leases early, and without penalty, upon receipt of military orders, and a prohibition on evicting military families from their homes without court orders. In addition, under the CARES Act and Regulation X, servicemembers and veterans have the same protections available to all mortgage borrowers. These include, for example, streamlined COVID hardship forbearance options, requirements that mortgages receiving a COVID-19 hardship forbearance be reported as current to credit reporting agencies if the loan was current before entering forbearance under the CARES Act, and requirements in the Bureaus Regulations X and Z for treatment of delinquent borrowers and borrowers who have applied for loss mitigation. 

The CFPB and DOJ are calling on mortgage servicers and landlords to ensure that military homeowners and tenants are safeguarded during the pandemic and benefit equally from the Nations economic recovery.

Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Mercedes Benz Financial Services ( " MBFS '' ) improperly reports an amount assessed after the termination of the lease, as an unpaid loan, which impacts the credit in a more harmful way than if the item would be properly reported. 

At the termination of the lease, the lessee has to return the vehicle and receives a lease termination statement, from the dealer where the vehicle is returned. The dealer reads the odometer, looks at the overall condition of the car, inputs the data into the system and generates a statement showing the amount to be paid in case of returning the car and a buyout proposal. 

In my case the value of the amount owed if returning the car was XXXX ( XXXX ) and the buyout was the residual value of the car. The dealer mentioned that any extra mileage fees will be waived. I opted for the return of the car and received a statement in writing showing a XXXX dollars owed to MBFS. 

Unbeknownst to me, the amounts were not accurate. MBFS assessed a {$5000.00} amount based on additional mileage and opted for reporting the amount to the Credit Bureaus as unpaid loan. This foreclosed any possibility for me to obtain another car lease for 7 years. 

The proper way for MBFS was to post the loan as paid in full, as showed in the document obtained at the end of the lease, and the {$5000.00}, as a collection item. The collection item would influence my overall credit, but it would allow me to obtain another car lease. 

I believe that adding the {$5000.00} at a later point is fraudulent, as the amount would have greatly influenced my decision to purchase the car rather than return it. 

By improperly reporting the item MBFS are trying to extort an amount that I believe it is not due to them. Rather than trying to adjudicate the matter in court, they are choosing to miss-report in an effort to unduly obtain the funds. 

I have contacted MBFS, but the representative was unable to understand what is issue is.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing to you, as I was a victim of wire fraud during a real estate transaction recently, and I was unable to get information regarding my claim until an email was received today from Wells Fargo, with incorrect information and stating that I would not receive my money back. Prior to today, XX/XX/2022, every time I called I am transferred a minimum of 7 times, and everyone states that they can not help me and need to transfer me again. After an hour of this or more daily, I hang up. I also have had Wells Fargo employees telling me different things, and some who have stated that they can not find the claim. I have emailed the Board of Directors at Wells Fargo last week, and still not one of you has had the decency to contact me regarding this matter. Today, I spoke with XXXX XXXX. To follow up on the email I received and explained that I had wired the money on XX/XX/2022, and on XX/XX/2022, I reported that the title company that the money was sent to, just notified me that they didnt receive the money and report that the wire instruction email was intercepted by fraud.. XXXX stated that the records show that it was reported that I notified them on XX/XX/2022, and there was nothing else they could do to help me. That {$18000.00} was my entire savings and I am currently homeless, have no money and in a state that I recently relocated to. I have been in tears daily, explaining this over the phone or in person to Wells Fargo employees, and nobody will help me. I was initially told by your Wells Fargo that I would receive my money back in a maximum of 10 days, and that was on the day reported, XX/XX/2022. however, It has been much longer than that and I can not even receive an update. The FBI was notified after I was aware of the situation too. This is ridiculous and horrible customer service, and I need I am definitely going to remove the little bit of money I have in Wells Fargo and transfer to a better bank ; Wells Fargo has been incompetent and not following their own CODE OF ETHICS. Why would anyone want to have their money in your bank when this is what happens. Banks are supposed to protect customers and treat them with respect and as a human being and protect their money when things like this occur. I have spent so much time and energy on this issue and have not received any further information than was given to me the day that I reported the claim. This situation is extremely stressful, and Wells Fargo has just made it much worse than it needed to be and they are not assisting me with this situation. I would appreciate anything you could do to help me or guide me in the right direction, as I lost my entire savings. 

Thank you XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
